course.subject: COMP
course.name: Introduction to Computer Science
course.description: This course introduces students to the world of Computer Science. Students will experience a range of fun and interesting areas from the world of computing, such as game programming, web programming, user interface design and computer graphics. These will be explored largely by programming in the Python language.
course.exclusions: COMP 1022P, COMP 1022Q (prior to 2020-21), COMP 2011, COMP 2012H

reviews.author: Harry Ho
reviews.title: Assignment 易，Mid-term 淺，Final 難
reviews.comment_content:
梗要：
* 以 Python 3 + PyGame 作藍本，教授 programming 入門及基本 UI 概念

格式：
* Lecture: 每星期 2 堂，每堂約 1 小時；不計 Attendance。
** Lecture 只以 course website 的 PowerPoint 為教材，而 website 每星期會更新一次。
** 課程本身建議使用一本由 lecturer 著作的 textbook (《Interactive Python Programming for Beginners》，2016年9月，約$190)，但不靠 textbook 已足以應付所有考核內容。
* Lab: 每星期 1 堂，每堂約 2 小時，不計 attendance。
** Lab 只用到 course website 的材料，每堂各自有一個 Lab 課題。
** 除 Assignment 需要用到的 Lab 之外，所有 Lab 均無需遞交或評分。

課程範圍：（括號文字為 textbook chapter number）
+ Programming 入門及 Python 基本 functions (03,05,07)
+ 基本條件式 (if...elif...else)、迴圈 (while, for...in) (05,06)
+ Turtle library 的基本繪圖 functions (02)
+ 以迴圈繪畫 Turtle (06)
+ PyGame library 的 MIDI 功能及時間控制(time.sleep())
+ Data Structures: List, Tuple, Dictionary (08)
+ List 及 String: Slicing 及基本 functions (append(), insert(), remove(), extend(), reverse(), …) (08)
+ Function 的結構及操作、global 及 local variables 的區別、stack、recursion (09)
+ type()、file read/write (04,13)
+ Dictionary 的結構及操作 (10)
+ Turtle 動態操作及設定: speed(), tracer(), reset(), shape(), shapesize(), ontimer(), update(), … (11,12)
+ Turtle 的滑鼠及鍵盤 event 控制 (12)
+ Class 及 Objects (14)
- 作為一個 introductory course，未有全面覆蓋 Python 功能 (e.g. with…, lambda, exception) 尚算合理
reviews.comment_teaching:
L1 & L2: Gibson LAM, gibson@cse.ust.hk
L3 & L4: Alex LAM, lamngok@cse.ust.hk
Lab Instructor: Ronald MO, ronmo@cse.ust.hk

優點：
+ 全英文教授，但用字簡明，語速偏快
+ 有獨立 course website (http://course.cse.ust.hk/comp1021/)
+ 每堂內容會預早一星期於 website 公佈，教材包括 PowerPoint PDF (有彩色及黑白版本)、code examples
+ 每堂 lab 的 instructor 會詳細按 website material 教授每個步驟的注意事項及其意義，有需要時會提供實際 code，所以不明白 code 的同學可以爭取 lab 機會抄下 code

劣點：
- 首幾堂 lecture 未有於每堂內完成該堂內容，教學進度因而滯後
- lecturer 慣用英文教授，且發音有時不準
reviews.comment_grading:
佔分比例：
【1】Mid-term Exam (open-book, 1 hr) = 20%
   -- Week 7 進行，考試範圍至約全個課程的 40% - 45%
   -- 若不赴考，或將 Mid-term 分計入後會令整體分數更低的話，佔分將變為 0%
【2】Final Exam (open-book, 2.5 hr) = 40%
   -- 考試週進行，考試範圍為全個課程
   -- 若之前未有赴考 Mid-term，或將 Mid-term 分計入後會令整體分數更低的話，佔分將變為 60%
【3】Assignment 1: Music System = 20%
   -- Python command-line 文字 program，讀取代表一段音樂的 plain-text file 以輸出 MIDI 音效
   -- 20% 中：Lab 3 & 4 基本完成部分 = 15% + 15% = 30%；額外進階功能 (列出音符及樂器資訊、倒轉音樂等) = 70%
【4】Assignment 2: Game Project = 20%
   -- Python Turtle 視窗介面的 Space Invader 遊戲，由 user 輸入敵方數目，並就每個 keyboard 及 mouse events 作出回應
   -- 20% 中：Lab 7 & 8 基本完成部分 = 16% + 18% = 34%；額外功能 (遊戲設計主題、自訂音效及 sprite 材質、cheat mode 等) = 66%
【*】Assignment Point = 2% (只適用於 Assignment 1 & 2 總共得分 < 40% 的情況)
   -- Lecture 期間，lecturer 會請學生答問題；同學每次若被選中並答中，將得到一個乒乓球以作記認，下課後可憑球申請取得 2% 的 Assignment Points
   -- 若本身 Assignment 1 & 2 總分已夠 40%，將不會額外得到 2%
   -- 若本身 Assignment 1 & 2 總分不足 40%，將只會為 Assignment 總分最多增至 40%

Grade 約膜情況：
【1】Mid-term Exam：Mean = 69.3/100，Max = 100/100，Min = 6/100
【2】Final Exam：Mean = 62.4/100，Max = 100/100，Min = 12/100
【3】Assignment 1：Mean = 88.5/100，Max = 100/100，Min = 0/100
【4】Assignment 2：Mean = 92.4/100，Max = 100/100，Min = 0/100
* 本人 【1】94/100 *20% +【2】78/100 *40% +【3】100/100 *20% +【4】100/100 *20% = 90%，得 A-
reviews.comment_workload:
- 一般而言，只需細讀 lecture PowerPoint 及參考 code examples，即可答對 Mid-term 的 90% 或以上分數、Final 的 80% 或以上分數
- 上堂前應準備好 PowerPoint，hard-copy 也好，電腦 soft-copy 也好；若本身未有 programming 底子，應預先閱讀 PowerPoint 的大綱
- 落堂後應溫習重點，通常是 structure、syntax 等等
- code examples 只作參考之用，明白課題後可以嘗試改動 code，查看 run 出來產生的效果有何變化
- 實際背誦不多，要爭取高 grade 唯有反覆練習及嘗試 run code
- 兩份 Assignment 基本上有 source，而且 lab 有 instructor 親自送 code，應該不難應付
- Assignment 緊記要準時交呀！做不完都要先 submit！
- Final 最後幾題主要考對 data structure (List) 的熟識度，取分之道是保持頭腦清醒

** 希望幫到各位。

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: Why are all the exams this semester so hellish???????????
reviews.comment_content: Basic stuff of Python. This semester excludes objects due to the shortened semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: David is a really funny and nice guy. The TA named Jimmy is also very nice because he is willing to answer all your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm exam is really simple. The mean is 75 and the SD is 15.
HOWEVER THE FINAL EXAM IS HELL. YOU CANNOT POSSIBLY FINISH THE EXAM BECAUSE THE TIME IS VERY SHORT AND THE QUESTIONS ARE VERY VEEEEERY LONG AND IT REQUIRES YOU TO DOWNLOAD MANY FILES. YOU WOULD NOT EVEN BOTHER TO THINK BY THE END OF THE EXAM BECAUSE YOU WOULD FEEL SO NERVOUS AND DESPERATE AND WANT TO KILL YOURSELF.
For final, the mean is 41.1 and the SD is 13.8. I just cannot imagine how some guys got something above 80. INSANE.
I got 100 for mid-term and 53.08 for final. Got an A. Seems like above 1 SD for midterm and final can already secure an A. Very good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Really little workload. The labs are counted as assignments and you only need to submit 3 of them. The labs are taught step by step. The TA almost gives you everything except for a few lines of code every time.

reviews.author: Saul Goodman
reviews.title: Saul Goodman's honest review
reviews.comment_content:
Russian guy here after finishing Better Call Saul. It worths your time more than studying COMP 1021, so go watch it. Expectally if you like Breaking Bad.


Anyways let's go back to the main point. Basically COMP1021 teaches you how to program with python.

If you had any programming background, such as ICT in secondary school, or knowing any forms of object-oriented language (C++, java etc) , you will find this course easy. If not? Better call Saul.

Also, too much turtle shit so I give it a C
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof David is definitely a good teacher. He is funny and clear.

Mr David! Please stop talking about turtles.
We need to cook!

STFU Jessie
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 2 marking methods in this course just in case you F up your mid-term somehow. Method with the highest result will be automatically used.


mid-term (0%/24%)
mean: 71.9
SD: 21.4
it's fine (burning)


Final Exam (40%/58%)
mean: 48.57/100
SD:19.29
the mean explains all, good luck


Lab project (36%/42%)

PS: I got B+ in the end instead of A range cuz my god damn electricity went out suddenly during final due to FUCKING building circuit failure. At this point even the best lawyer in this world can't help shit.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much of a workload, a total of 7 lab works, in which only 3 of them is required for marking. All of them are not difficult (only if you have sufficient background), and even if you really don't know, it will be taught step by step later on.

There are sufficient amount of resources and time for you to understand everything even just through powerpoints and self-learning since the workload of this course is really not that high.

At last, do you know that you have internet learning materials? Constitution said you do, and so do I.

reviews.author: mark_
reviews.title: human aptitude / geometry test disguised as programming course
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Python stuff. If/else, for loops, lists, dictionaries, basic classes, methods/functions, recursion.

Also, Turtle graphics (a library where you draw pictures using "turtles", which are basically just brushes/pens which you move around using code).

Content should be extremely easy if you've done any form of programming before. But be careful in Python with data types since it's type-optional (and type hints aren't taught or provided in exams)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Alex Lam (my professor) is good at teaching and repeats things to make sure things are clear, since programming concepts are often unintuitive at first and require reinforcement when first encountering them.

However, the lectures for me were a waste of time as I already knew programming. I skipped most of the lectures so I can't say much else about the teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two grading methods.

24% midterm + 36% lab + 40% final
OR
42% lab + 58% final

There are 7 labs + one intro lab, 3 of which are graded out of 100.

Labs are easy, but be extremely careful and check each case carefully as often there are no partial marks and one silly mistake causing your program to crash in a test case can cost you 20% of the lab score. (true story D:). The labs usually have a mean of 90-100 with s.d 8-10.

The midterm is fairly easy, as long as you're somewhat careful and double-check your answers. If you've done programming, you should have at least half the time to check your answers. Exams are done remotely this semester. Mean was 71.9 with s.d about 21.4.

However, the final is hell. There is barely enough time for you to check your answers. The questions are extremely weird and try to trick you, for example by multiplying a number by 2 but they made the number a string instead of an int. You have to be extremely careful. The mean this semester was 48.57 with s.d 19.29.

Alternatively, you can see the final as a typing test and just type out all the code they don't let you copy. If you are fast enough at typing (at least 90-100wpm) then this is actually a viable option for you, and makes the final much less stressful.

My scores:
Lab 1 - 80%
Lab 2 - 100%
Lab 3 - 100%
Mterm: 90%
Final: 100% (after grading change)

Overall: ~97% (definitely enough for A+)

It is quite difficult to get an A/A+ even if you've already programmed before, because the exams basically are a human aptitude test or a geometry test disguised as a Python exam. There are only one or two questions where you use Python to solve a problem. They purposely make the tests tricky and weird because too many people going into this course can already program so they had to "fix the curve" somehow
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is extremely light.

7 labs + 1 intro lab, 3 of which are handed in and also graded. Non-graded labs do not have to be done but I recommend at least skimming them as they often re-use lab content in the final exams.

The actual labs are easy, as long as you know how to read instructions and do some basic programming.

reviews.author: patrick330602
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty easy if you know programming, and you will be very easy to fit in even if you don't know anything about programming.  After these classes, you can actually make a game on your own.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is very humorous, and the class is.... fairly fun, but sometimes you have to spend time to understand what he actually teaches.
reviews.comment_grading: Reasonable, and you will know where you lost your points, and if you don't know, the tutor is very willing to tell you which part is wrong.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair, there are usually two projects in the course, and you can do most of your job in the lab session, but it might be heavy for the one who don't know programming.

reviews.author: YJ
reviews.comment_content:
學programming入面嘅python（？）
表示之前未接觸過programming其我覺得有啲新奇

學完之後會識得用佢嚟整啲小遊戲，都幾開心幾有成功感

會學到基本嘅programming語言
reviews.comment_teaching:
表示係ust聽咗咁多難聽嘅英文之後，聽rossiter嘅英文會令你】你覺得你進入咗第二個世界，絕對聽出耳油 ，佢把聲同迪士尼讀故仔嗰啲差唔多

由於呢個course係比啲未接觸過programming嘅人讀，所以佢每部分都會講得好明，加埋勁多example，務求令你明晒先落堂， 佢仲要成日搞爛gag同自嘲，唔會令你覺得悶

不得不提嘅仲有佢啲雞精notes，midterm final都會有一份，又會有turtle嘅summary。真係做得好詳細，有晒example，全部你要讀嘅嘢都會喺晒入面，佢仲會慢慢解釋比你聽。

此外，midterm final 前佢都會比exercise你做， exam之後即刻就會解卷

仲有錄影上網有得重溫，一個好有heart嘅老師

注 佢話如果你唔去自己個lab去人哋個lab比佢發現咗佢會扣分
reviews.comment_grading:
靚grade ，唔midterm final 都below mean 但係 B+
利申功課一份 9X 一份滿分

同埋佢又兩個計分方法 一個計midterm 一個唔計 ，佢會睇下你邊個高分就採用果個計分方法 ，佢話係因為驚有啲人一開始未接觸過python可能midterm唔知發生咩事，所以就比多啲時間佢，final 先計分
reviews.comment_workload: 又兩份功課 但係lab果時佢都同你做咗八九成 自己在放多一兩粒鐘 finalize下，check 下有無error 就ok 架啦

reviews.author: Alex CHIU
reviews.title: Good enough for a Common Core Course
reviews.comment_content:
Python 3 stuff.

Textbook: Interactive Python Programming for Beginners, written by Gibson and Rossiter, can be easily found in the book store.

Two lectures and one lab per week.

Each lecture lasts for approximately 50 minutes, I was in the one from 4:30pm to 5:20pm, but later went to the one from 3:30pm to 4:20pm much more often. The content is based on the lecture notes on the course website but not the textbook I have mentioned before.

Each lab is about 110 minutes, I was unfortunately enrolled in the 9:00am to 10:50pm session. There would be exactly one topic for every lab session. Sometimes the content could be taught a little earlier than the lectures, but for most of the time, what you see in labs have been taught before.

Very basic things about Python. In the last two lectures, Rossiter mentioned Objects and Recursion, I suppose these are for the 201X series?
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite fun.

Rossiter's English is not hard to understand, and the speed is appropriate. There were many in class demos, and a lot of quiz questions. Rossiter used these questions for bonus, but only one guy can get it, and he would randomly ask students to answer, don't be sad if you are never asked, it's all about luck.
The lectures really told me I should never be confident about my fortune.

About the labs, ummm... Since I usually choose to finish the code using course materials before the class, I can hardly tell whether the instructors' teaching style is good or not.

All instructors and TAs are prepared for my questions and I can get my answer for most of the time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just go to other people's review to see the percentage, I would only show my score.

Midterm 100/100, Final 93/100, Assignment 1 to 4 each 100/100, Bonus question 2/2 (Well I heard there's a X/8, ummm...)

All above mean.
Very luckily got an A+ at last.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very small.

Well this is compared to those in 1022p of course, when I saw them worked hard on Saturday for their assignments, I have already finished my codes for lab session in less than one hours.

It seems that listening in class and do all the lab stuff can ensure you an A or A+?

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.comment_content: How to use Python 2.3. While loop, for loop, if conditions, hello world, pygame, turtle graphics etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fun. At least not boring
The lab sessions are useful for homework and you can try what you have learnt in lectures by making some games
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite Good. Mean = B
Getting full marks in assignments is quite easy because you can keep making corrections before the due date of the homework.
reviews.comment_workload:
Few.Only 2 assignments which 60% of content will be taught during lessons. 40% have to complete by yourself.
Exams are open booked. You just need to revise a little bit at home before examinations

reviews.author: Himmy
reviews.title: 揀啱instuctor超重要,同埋睇路
reviews.comment_content:
對於maths佬嚟講需時消化,建議上少人嘅lecture,有咩事直接舉手問,
有啲turtle嗰啲比較煩,logic就好啲
最好睇下source先上,否則容易炒車
想靚grade(尤其aim CS/CPEG)一定要花時間理解佢點嚟
reviews.comment_teaching: 我本身報Gibson,佢幾搞笑但比較適合高階學生,唔係好適合我依類讀maths大嘅電腦廢物,後尾轉咗Cindy,佢講嘢偏細聲但易明好多,唔識仲可以直接約佢問,佢會點到你明為止
reviews.comment_grading:
for電腦人:小心駛得萬年船
for非電腦人(小弟):早讀早爛有得追
>97%: A+
~90%: B+
小弟:79.68: B-
我lab除咗最後嗰個之外全部full mark,一定要靠exam食糊,mt當練習就可以㗎啦,因為可以唔計分唔使太擔心
exam我得七成分,主要係我本身電腦底差,電腦底好嗰啲就最好前一晚早啲瞓,要「槍桿(應該係滑鼠)握得緊,眼睛看得清」因為啲options好似,好易中伏
強烈建議返學校考,免得屋企考畀人周camera 問題,有人因為camera 搞到食D,唔好話自己住大西北出嚟好耐,我住屯門坐6點鐘前開嘅巴士七點唔駛到學校,七點半前清水灣道同牛池灣村未咁快塞車㗎
除咗去421X(teaching lab)考嘅同學之外一般都冇插蘇,自己同電腦都要叉飽電先返學,一定要帶多個功率25W以上,電荷10000mAh以上嘅尿袋(實際情況問電腦供應商或者睇說明書)
reviews.comment_workload:
熟電腦就好快搞掂,我依個電腦廢物就有排搞,小心唔好打錯字,否則成個㣔唔到有搵人搞,
3份hand-in lab+3-4份額外lab proj(會考但唔使交),一般一至兩星期一份,我自己要做成個禮拜有凸
我aim Mech就冇花時間做其他lab,但aim CS/CPEG最好做下

reviews.author: Klay12
reviews.title: Comp1021---Review from a student with no programming background
reviews.comment_content:
# It is interesting because they use the “Turtle” library as a platform to teach us.

# Basic programming with Python including loops, if-statement, functions, recursion and so on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
# Good teaching

# He is really energetic in all the classes and he would answer your questions asap if you send email to him.
Reg him!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme (1/2):
1)
Lab: 3x12%=36%
Midterm: 24%
Final: 40%

2)
Lab: 3x14%=42%
Midterm: 0%
Final: 58%

Choose the higher score!

Stat. (my_score / total_score, mean, s.d.)
Lab: 100/100  
Midterm: 100/100 , 71.9 , 21.4
Final: 61/100 , 46.26 , 18.6
Total: 84.4/100 (Grading Scheme 1)

Final Grade = A
I would say the grade is good because this score is supposed to be B+/A- in the past few semesters. (Probably because the final is hard this semester)
reviews.comment_workload:
# 7 Labs in 12-14 weeks but only 3 particular Labs will be counted to your final score and they will record the videos for you to follow the instruction. (Not hard and you should get 100%)

# Personally, I did all the self-exercises and all the past papers for both midterm and final. It may take a lot of time, but it indeed helpful! (Really recommend you guys to finish all because the questions are quite similar to the exams)

# Midterm is relatively easy, just try your best to get full; while, Final is extremely hard, you should be REALLY careful!!!

reviews.author: alucard
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty easy as I knew Python personally

Before Mid-Term:
Everything is easy.
-Input/Output
-If/Else
-For/While loops
-Strings/Lists/Variables
-Random
-Turtle

After Mid-Term:
Things are getting more difficult
-Functions
-Recursions
-Objects

Ranting time:
Online exams for this course were such a clusterfck. The mid-term exam was delayed for 30 minutes because too many people accessing the website at once and could not get into the monitoring zoom meetings. Canvas was also a disaster for online exam. For some reason, we couldn't go back to the previous question once we hit next. And I shit you not, they put the hardest question at question 2. WTF was I supposed to do? My friend and I literally stuck on this one for ages and he ending up not finishing 2 out of the 6 questions in part A. And I accidentally clicked the "next" button without finishing a question. Fml

TL;DR :
1. The online exam experience was terrible.
2. Make sure don't accidentally click the "next" or "submit" button as next semester are likely to be online exam as well and are likely to be using this shit system aka canvas as well.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interesting.
Gibson lessons explains all of the concepts while trying to make the lesson much more interesting. He often jokes about himself with the programs.

Although it is better to attend the lectures, but you can understand the concepts by reading the lecture notes by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pretty good I would say.
The reason for that is because I lost around 6~7% of the assignment score.
In previous years, the exams were too easy to the point where students had to get 99.5 in order to acquire A+.
A single mistake could have affected your grade. The difficulty of final exam of this semester had definitely increased drastically, and it definitely saved me.

The stats of the final exam:
    Average ~55.9%
    Standard deviation ~20.5%
    Maximum 100.0%
    Minimum ~8.6%

There are two grading system. One includes mid-term score, one's not
My score(adapting the first method):
Assignment(36%/42%): 93.3%
Mid-term(24%/0%): 100%
Final Exam(40%/58%): 75%

My score: 87.6%
Letter Grade : A
reviews.comment_workload: 3 Assignments only throughout the semester. Each takes around 1~3 hours to finish. Extremely Light workload. Videos will guide you step by step and make sure to check thoroughly to see if any mistakes are made.

reviews.author: 16y39y
reviews.title: decent introductory course
reviews.comment_content: A decent introductory course based heavily on Turtle graphics. Not too difficult to handle, especially the first few weeks which cover basic programming concepts like moving the turtle, if/else/elif, loops etc. A bit similar to basic programming content covered in ICT syllabus, but it's not too hard even if you don't have much programming background or prior knowledge. Notes and examples are detailed and quite helpful in illustrating the concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor mainly uses examples to teach us the concepts in class. It is good that we get to see different ways to apply to knowledge and see the concepts in action. He teaches with heart and really tries hard to make classes fun and lively. He is also very helpful and often patiently explains concepts in detail to students both in class and after class. Sometimes he does not explain certain important concepts clearly enough, but it's fine as long as you read the notes yourself or approach him after class.
reviews.comment_grading:
This semester we had special arrangements, with assignments taking up most of the marks. I think you need around 97-98 to enter A range this semester. All the averages are so high (except for the midterm) so you must make sure you get it all correct before you submit your assignments.

Professors provided two grading methods:
Method 1
Assignments x2 (35% x2)
Midterm (10%)
Online assignment (20%)
Method 2
Assignments x2 (25% x2)
Midterm (35%)
Online assignment (15%)
+ bonus points (mine was up to 1.5)

The two assignments are not too difficult because a beginning code is given to help you and a big part of it is done during the labs, so if you go to the labs and ask your friends it should be generally fine. The mean is usually around 90.

The online assignment is like an online quiz with multiple choice questions and short questions except we were given many days to do it, and many of the answers can be obtained by running the programs directly or testing the programs, so it was not hard to get high marks, again the average was around 90.

The midterm was not too difficult (open book), but the time given was a bit too short and each of the questions take up many marks, one small careless mistake can cost you 6 marks which will make a big difference in your grade. Luckily, there is an option where your midterm only counts for 10%. Also by all means try to get your bonus points they might send you up 1-2 subgrades!!!!

Grading should be better during normal semesters though.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty chill and light. You can technically skip all the lectures and the labs. There are only two assignments in the semester and if you really rush through it you should be able to complete it within a few hours.

reviews.author: I want to sleep
reviews.title: Easy course if you familiar with programming
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches us how to draw some stuffs and programming syntax with python 3.7.

lecture notes are provided with examples and common errors. The labs will help you familiar with programming syntax and some logic. Also the labs will talk about assignments, so no need to worry about assignments.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is a funny guy. And he will live code during his lecture (in fact he prepared some files haha). You will get a lot of examples on his lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Well... I learnt programming, so I got A+ as expected.

Assignment 1: 100/100
Assignment 2: 90/100 (because of late submission)
mid-term(open notes & book): 100/100
final exam(online assignment): 100/100

Here are some tips if you want to get high mark in this course:
1. don't buy and bring the book to the mid-term / exam, totally useless. Because the test is examining your logic, not syntax. The book doesn't teach you logic. You will waste lots of time in reading book during test.

2. practice your logic. As I mentioned, logic is the main point. You can google "sorting algorithm" or "binary search algorithm" and learn it, I still remember the mid-term asked somethings about sorting, and final asked about searching.

3. test specific cases. Like some list functions, E.g. test remove() will remove more than one elements or not, and will it has a return.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 2 assignments + mid-term + final, remember to submit assignments on time.

reviews.author: patatalam
reviews.comment_content:
basic programming stuff
1. basic python syntax
2. tuples, list, index
3. for loops while loops
4. RGB color
5. recursion
6. class and objects
7. continue, break
...

and then turtle library
1. drawing shapes (circles squares
2. import libraries
** circles are really confusing
...
(mb i missed some of them
reviews.comment_teaching:
rossiter is a very good lecturer, explains concepts very well
better to go to lectures, it saves time for revision, and highlights important parts that will be mainly tested in exam

besides, he will ask u confusing questions that most students will make mistakes (and it think this is the most valuable part)
reviews.comment_grading:
two grading schemes
1) lab 42%, midterm 0%, final 58%
2) another one i forgot

if u answer rossiter's questions correctly in class, u will get a 0.5% bonus directly added on top of ur total score!

i use the first scheme
my scores:
lab 100%
midterm 67% mean: 66.8, sd: 21.4
final 92% mean:71.1, sd: 19.3
bonus 0.5%

grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
2 hr lecture, ard 2-3 hr labs
no attendance will be taken for both lectures and labs
if u think u kno python well enough, and dont need the TA's help, u can just skip the labs

i think there r 8 lab sections, 8 lab tasks, but u only need to hand in 4 of them.
the labs are not that hard, most of them i finish it within the lab section.

-----
what i did for this course
i attend every lecture, and i started my revision a week before the final exam.

my method of revision is
1. going through all examples in lecture slides,
2. i code the examples using my own way
3. compare my codes and lecturer's codes
this helps u to familiarize python, and helps u to code more efficiently
this is just my own method, may not be suitable for everyone, but mb it would be a good reference to those who are new to programming

reviews.author: 冷山
reviews.title: 没有想象中那么好龟
reviews.comment_content:
the content is very appropriate for comp students.
有过编程基础的同学学起来会非常轻松
甚至可以不用来上堂最后还是考得很好
主要学习了python programming
turtle graphic是作业的主要考查对象
对比Java这个课似乎更加有趣？
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lam是个很好的老师
有大量学生没来上堂他会非常体贴的看一下科大附近的交通情况
上课的内容与考试非常相关
课后他会非常耐心地解答问题
他的英语 广东话 普通话都非常好！
reviews.comment_grading:
并不算特别好龟
因为这个课的大神很多
但是通过自己不懈的努力
拿个A还是不难的
reviews.comment_workload: 非常轻

reviews.author: Dipsy
reviews.title: MUST TAKE COURSE!!! GOOD GRADE!!!
reviews.comment_content: Please take this course even if you have programming background and want to take COMP102X course.
reviews.comment_teaching: LAM Ngok is a kind teacher, he is willing to answer your questions, but lectures are sometimes boring and slow.
reviews.comment_grading:
you can all in final if your mid term is not as good as final.
seems like other COMP 102X don't have this privilege.
I get A+ very easily.
reviews.comment_workload: just two tiny programming assignment, interesting but easy. If you have problem, there is tutor in programming common and lab sections. so easy

reviews.author: kentanggoreng
reviews.comment_content: Contents are interesting and useful, especially if you are considering to learn more about programming. Even if you don't, you get to learn the logic people use in Computer Science, and it's quite useful, I guess.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter was very organized, very structured and very helpful. He tried to make the class not to be boring. His ppts are very detailed and complete, I sometimes find this annoying because I can't jot notes in class because everything's there already, but I guess it's good if you're planning not to come to class at all. Lecture videos are also provided.
reviews.comment_grading: Gradings were alright. The midterm was too easy (the bell curve was not really a bell, it was left skewed) and most people got almost to full marks in the assignments, thus making competition to be really tight in the course.
reviews.comment_workload: Compared to other courses I have taken in UST, there are quite a lot of things you have to do for this course. Other than just studying, you need to practice (a lot) and finish 2 assignments. They're not really hard, but they still take up some time.

reviews.author: lmhayden
reviews.comment_content:
教D野幾簡單，介紹下點樣用python (詳細教咩我就唔喺度講，可以睇返其他comment)

Exam全部都係online (可以選擇返ust考)，建議返UST考好啲，因為online下有啲規矩好難確保自己遵守咗，嗰啲ta真係會好認真咁睇曬，所以唔好諗住可以走雞，如果俾人發現冇遵守到規矩 會有扣分嘅penalty

lab session係online 可以選擇去同埋唔去，不過我相信大部分人都唔會去，因為lab都係比你問問題 (如果你有hw唔識做)

就嚟考試嗰陣時，instructor會放4-6份past paper出，所以唔好咁蠢去goop買past paper
reviews.comment_teaching:
LAM, Ngok唔錯，上完堂會留喺課室出面解答學生嘅問題，有時會有D follow-up email 解釋一啲比較難嘅嘢 (e.g  recursion)

如果有啲根本係out of syllabus 嘅嘢好直接咁講 叫我哋唔使咁擔心
reviews.comment_grading:
有兩個scheme計算grade
scheme 1: Midterm - 24%, Labs - 36%, Final - 40%
scheme 2: Midterm - 0%, Labs - 42%, Final - 58%
所以Midterm其實係可以唔去 (但係我唔建議，因為確保唔到Final一定識做曬)

雖然我話教啲嘢幾簡單，但係要好小心咁做exam嘅題目，只要錯咗其中一步，成題都會冇分

My scores: Midterm - 77, Labs - 100, Final 92
overall: 95.36 - A
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload好少
成個course只係要交3個lab 同埋midterm final，嗰三個lab大部分都會有段片教你點做 (TA會少少答案比我哋抄，但係都有少部分要我哋自己做)，同埋佢會release個marking scheme出嚟，你只要對返marking scheme每一個攞分位，攞滿分應該唔難，(就算真係唔識做，都可以買source)

比小小tips大家，如果考試唔識做題目，你可以打返條題目落去python (which is allowed during the exam)，當然時間會比你識做嘅多好多，但係都好過成題唔識做然後零分，但係唔好expect每一題都可以咁做，因為根本唔會夠時間

reviews.author: Mango Pudding
reviews.title: Interesting programming introductory course, but be especially careful in exams
reviews.comment_content:
Python 3.9, plus modules like "Turtle" graphics and "Random"
- Python basics
- Intro to Turtle graphics
- If statements
- Loops (While loop first then for loop)
- Lists, tuples, strings
- Modulus operator
- Continue, break
- Logic operators
- Slicing
- Functions
- Dictionaries
- Handling data types
- Multi-Turtle
- Turtle graphics event handlers
- Text and file handling
- Turtle graphics setworldcoordinates()
- State diagrams
- Objects
- Recursion
(Does not include try-except, map, or lambda but it's understandable and expected)

Pretty interesting content by utilising the Turtle graphics library, especially in later labs where you "make" a jigsaw, "amaziograph", music system and robot maze from their given template codes.

It may require some effort to fully grasp some later topics like recursion for beginners but still is fairly beginner-friendly if you are willing to learn.

Tons of assistance are offered, like the Canvas discussion tab (where TAs will answer questions), emailing the professor or just asking the professor after the lecture. OR just watch Python tutorials on YouTube, this programming language is easy to get into, and even junior secondary students can do it.

An absolute breeze for those with prior programming experience
(Declaration: I have ~2 years of Python 2 experience on Tello EDU drone programming before this, though some of the content still is new to me as those weren't used in the program I worked on. Personally, this course is still easy despite the new content to me.)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Really friendly professor, and is willing to discuss more advanced topics that are not in the syllabus after the lecture. Very quick in replying to emails. He sometimes sends us emails with reminders, further clarifications and the video recording link if he overran the lecture.

Dr Alex Lam is a good professor for complete beginners in my opinion, but not so much if you have prior programming experience (since you could read the notes instead if so). I attended all lectures and most of the time I just worked on my own programs.

For beginners, this teaching style might be easier to follow. He often starts with a quick recap of the last lecture before moving on to the content of that lecture, so that you'll remember it. He mostly follows the slides and then demonstrates the concepts in the Python shell.

= Differences between instructors (From the slides of the first lecture) =
You can participate in other lecture sessions even if you are not enrolled in them, plus lecture videos are available on the course site for everyone anyway

- Dr Alex Lam & Prof Wilfred Ng: Teach using slides, and using mainly examples on the course site
- Prof Kim Sung Hun: Teach using slides, but using new illustrations and examples beyond those on the course site
- Prof David Rossiter & Prof Gibson Lam: Teach using other things instead of slides, and using new illustrations and examples beyond those on the course site
reviews.comment_grading:
The highest mark of either:
Midterm 24%, Lab projects 36%, Final exam 40%; or
Midterm 0%, Lab projects 42%, Final exam 58%
(There is also a practice midterm exam that does not count towards the grade, but lets you be familiarised with the exam procedures)

Midterm stats:
- Maximum: 100/100
- Minimum (except zero): 10
- Mean: 71.9
- SD: 21.4

Final stats:
- Maximum: 100/100
- Minimum (except zero): 4
- Mean: 48.57
- SD: 19.29

Hand-in Lab average stats:
- Maximum: 100
- Minimum (excluding zeros): 14.8
- Average (excluding zeros): 98.0
- SD (excluding zeros): 9.6

The exams are more like a test of meticulousness since it is very easy to miss something or be mistaken (especially under stress), which results in a wrong answer, which is 5-10 marks lost per question since there's only one answer per question and no partial scores.

Both exams are online (due to mixed mode), sent to you as two PDF files, and answers are submitted through Canvas. There is a short break between part A and part B.

You can only use Python, the COMP1021 Course site and sites that do not have communication features (Like the official Python documentation).

Technically you could type out all of the code (even if you can't directly copy from the PDF), though I find understanding the logic first, then coding an abbreviated version of it to be better.

Midterm:
- A: 7 questions in 25 minutes
- B: 5 questions in 25 minutes
Final:
- A: 9 questions in 40 minutes
- B: 9 questions in 40 minutes

(Due to mixed mode:)
There are on-campus seats that you could reserve so that you don't need to set up the Zoom camera (as you are supervised in person instead). I did it on-campus for midterm and on Zoom for the final, and I'd prefer to reserve a seat. Be sure to request it as soon as it is available as they are very limited. Also, note that it is highly likely that the rooms do not have electricity outlets (other than one reserved for emergencies), so charge your device to full before attending.
reviews.comment_workload:
7 Labs in total (6-8 depending on the schedule of your semester, this semester has 7 labs)
- 3 Labs are "Hand-in labs" that are counted towards the grade (Lab 2, 5, 7 for this semester)
- About one week to complete and hand in the compulsory labs
- The rest are technically optional, but they serve as good exercises to be more familiar with the content
- (There are also many interactive examples besides the optional labs to practice on)

The labs are not difficult at all, they provide video tutorials that walk you through the entire lab. Even if they don't explicitly provide the code of that part, they give you the logic of it so that you could easily work it out. If still in doubt, simply ask on Canvas.

reviews.author: Edeline
reviews.comment_content: Some basic ideas of python.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dave is a funny professor. I never felt boring in gis classes. Instead of using PowerPoint, he always makes examples in python to let us easily understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't do well in writing program. Even though I worked really hard, it took me lots of time to think. It already took me two minutes to understand each question!! So I almost hadn't finished the part:(
<Midterm>
Part A:
7 questions have to be finished in 30 minutes
the questions were written in Docx. so that we can copy and paste in python.
Part B:
7-8 questions have to be finished in 30 minutes
but the questions were written in pdf. so that we can only understand on our own.
my grade:30 /mean:6x(I forget) /total:100
<Final>
same as midterm but extend to 45 minutes in part B
my grade:3x(I forget) /mean:5x(I forget) /total:100
because of the online mode(open book), the questions were very hard this year so professors didn't count the worst question you did(this just mean they gave seven points to me)
I got C+(well I think I'll fail so I think the grading is fine:)
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light! There were seven labs but only three were hand in labs. The guidances written by TAs were very clear and easy to follow. If you understand the concept, the task will be easy to complete.

reviews.author: Wai Gor
reviews.title: Online exam grants me good grade
reviews.comment_content:
This course is about using Python to do all kinds of basic programming stuff. For the basics, you have to learn the basic variable types, data stuctures, loops and conditions. For the more advanced (haha, I don't think so), you have to do turtle control stuff ,which I think this will be the only time you use it in your whole life, as it's so useless I don't know who in the hell would even consider using it.

Even though this course is called introduction to computer science, if you think this is what computer science is really about, you are so wrong. Therefore, if you are choosing computer science just because of this, I prefer you think twice before doing it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching depends, if you are going for LAM, Gibson, then you are fine and you are fortunate enough to enjoy the best teaching quality available in this course.

LAM, Ngok was my professor. He's pretty kind and very passionate in teaching. The only thing was that his voice is too boring and it makes you sleep. I once tried paying full attention to listen to his lectures, it results in me being unconscious for the rest of the lecture.

As for KIM, Sung Hun I am not so sure. Rumors has it that he's not good as Gibson but I can't really tell.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A + by getting all scores available in the course as well as getting 6 bonus points (the maximum of bonus points should be 3 points only, but because of the chaotic situation in this semester, they messed it up).
The only conclusion I can tell from my grade is that you get A+ by achieving full marks or even exceeding the full marks.

However, a friend of mine got 99.67% and he got an A, so you can see how bad the grading this is. Bare in mind guys.
reviews.comment_workload:
I didn't really devote a lot of time into the course.

I just use the programming knowledge I learnt before I entered HKUST and I got a pretty decent grade for the course. I assume that's a course with very light workload?

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: easy course with fierce competition
reviews.comment_content: Basic programming, teaches the python language, including stuff like turtle windows, functions, different types of variables and more, if you have learnt programming this would be very familiar (and easy).
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is a very good lecturer, while the lectures can be quite boring due to the course materials, Gibson tries to keep us interested with some jokes and references to popular culture, you can easily see his efforts in teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since the course material is quite easy, and some of the students are very familiar with programming before taking the course, competition is quite intense.

Grading includes:

Mid-term: very basic python knowledge, and is very easy to mess up since the problems are quite tricky. I personally got around a 70/100.

Assignments: VERY easy, the 2 programs required (one being an "art gallery" using the python turtle, and one being a simple Tetris game) are very easy to write as the school gives you most of the code. Many students would get full marks on this, so make sure you check the program multiple times to ensure the program meets all of the requirements. I personally got full marks on both.

Online final: Very easy as well, you have the time to look things up and the questions are very straight forward. I personally got a 92/100, losing some marks due to carelessness.

Distribution of grading:
Assignment 1 25%/35%
Assignment 2 25%/35%
midterm 35%/10%
online assignment 15%/20%

As you can see, 2 ways of calculating the final score, the school will automatically choose the higher scored method for you, no worries there.

Overall I got a B+, which while not that bad, I felt like I could do better... but it also shows how competitive the course is, even with these grades I was not able to get an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
VERY light. The two programming "assignments" are essentially copying and pasting the code as over half of the program and the structure of the program is already given to you at the beginning, all it takes is to piece the code together by yourself, which is quite easy.

Getting full marks on BOTH assignments is very doable, and many students gets full marks.

reviews.author: Hailey
reviews.comment_content:
Very interesting content, pretty basic so it wasn't very hard for me to catch up with the content even though it was my first time to learn computer science.

Midterm, Final, 2 assignments
reviews.comment_teaching:
He teaches very well and in a very fun and interesting way. He gives lectures in a pretty organized way and teaches in a way that students can understand more easily. Plus he uploads lecture videos on the website which greatly help students review for exams and students who missed classes.
Labs are very helpful for assignments because they show you how to do almost 80% of the assignments.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was OK
Midterm was very easy- many people got full marks.
Final was a disaster but since it was difficult for almost everyone so the grade was not that bad.
Most people got full marks for assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
More than average?
It takes quite a lot of time to finish assignments as well as studying for exams.

reviews.author: Benny Heung
reviews.title: 夠 basic
reviews.comment_content:
呢個 course 學 Python
一開始教最基本嘅語法 ( Indent , print , variables 等等 )
之後到 if 同埋 loop
仲會有基本嘅 MIDI , Read / Write File 等等
亦會教用 turtle , 由最初畫下公仔到最後寫個 game 出嚟
基本上都係啲好 basic 嘅 programming
比起 Java 可能無咁實用 , 但係可以幫你打好寫 code 嘅基礎
有 DSE ICT Programming 底絕對唔難
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson 講課好生動 , 有時唔係太跟 PowerPoint 講亦都好 organized
有時會搞下 gag 又會走嚟走去 , 上佢堂唔會悶
英文口音唔太重但幾快下 , 但唔太影響聽書

上堂答指定問題可以加 assignment points

Lab 嘅 TA 都好流暢 , 條理亦都分明
唔會話聽唔明 , 有時都會搞下 gag

( 不過我 lecture 同 lab 都走咗唔少 , course website 齊曬 materials , 如果你底子夠走唔走都無所謂
但真心建議上 , 反正上堂氣氛都幾開心下 )
reviews.comment_grading:
一個 Midterm 同 Final , open-notes 所以問題不大 ( final 前直頭比份廿幾頁 Revision notes 你 )

2 個 Assignment 都 full mark
Midterm +1 個 SD 多啲
Final 高唔夠 1 個 SD
最後 A 咗

Grading scheme 唔寫太多 , 其他人都寫咗
只係 Assignment 真係要用心啲做 , 因為個 mean 都幾高
同埋答卷要小心陰濕位 , 因為每題佔分都唔輕
reviews.comment_workload:
兩個 Assignment ( MIDI Player 同 shooting game ) , 上 lab 會教大概點做 ( 同埋 lab notes 會講明邊啲係 assignment 嘅部分 ) , lecture 會講邊啲係 extra 要自己做 , 所以要小心唔好睇漏 , 上足 lab / 睇足 lab notes 教學就其實唔難

總括 workload 絕對唔算重

reviews.author: az
reviews.comment_content: Basic Python programming with a significant amount of turtle graphics included to confuse those who already know Python.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor explains the concepts clearly, and the in-class questions can clear up the common misconceptions about Python.
reviews.comment_grading:
24% Mid-term, 36% Labs, 40% Final
or
0% Mid-term, 42% Labs, 58% Final

There is a total of 3 labs, and the marking schemes are provided, so you should make sure that you get full marks for all labs.

The mid-term and Final exams are conducted online via Zoom, and you can read your own notes and run Python code during the exam. The questions are not too difficult but the time limit is a bit tight.

My scores:
100/100 for all labs
100/100 for mid-term
93/100 for Final
Overall grade: A+

Overall the graded components are not that difficult, so you should expect a high cut-off for the final grades.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only required ad graded coursework is the three labs, so the workload is pretty light.

Though if you are learning Python for the first time you might need to spend some more time to brush up your Python skills.

reviews.author: MJ999999
reviews.comment_content: A pretty good way to start learning Python. If you learned any programming language previously, the content should be easy. No creativity is needed, only logical thinking to be able to read and understand programs.
reviews.comment_teaching: Our professor gave quite a few examples for different concepts and demonstrated the exercises. The pace was just about right for an introductory class, but again, really slow in the beginning for experienced people.
reviews.comment_grading: Not the biggest fan of grading. There are two methods you can be graded upon. However, most people get nearly 100% for most lab work, so test result is what matters the most. The grading method itself is quite harsh in a sense that it allows no mistake in tests. There are very few questions in both midterm and final exams, and just one mistake will probably cost you a grade (e.g. A to A-). You only write down your answers, not your working out.
reviews.comment_workload: There is barely any work to do. Though there are several labs, all except the last task took about 10-20 minutes. The pace of teaching is slow, so revision is also quite easy as well.

reviews.author: Lucas Hui
reviews.title: Not that good course for grading for people don't have programming background
reviews.comment_content: This course mainly teaches people how to use python to program. You will learn basic skills for programming. Then you will need to apply the skills you have learned in some practical projects such as making a math game, jigsaw, music sound, to name but a few, in this year. Their will be two exams and the questions mainly test that whether you are carful enough! Therefore, sleep well before you do the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: It's flexible timing that even you have registered in that period, you can go to other classes if you are not avalable for that session.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not that good as if you get mean, you may only get B- for my case.
reviews.comment_workload: Not that high as long as you work hard.

reviews.author: Ireneee
reviews.title: WARNING!!!! NO TOLERANCE FOR CARELESS MISTAKES!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_content:
This course is all about the basics for python, including if/else, logical operators (AND, OR, …), functions, class/object, different data types (lists, dictionaries, …), recursion.

Turtle is quite a significant part in this course, about graphics and geometry (which I consider this useless based on my need for future).

Generally speaking, it is fairly easy. It is beginner-friendly in terms of the difficulty of content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I only attended the lectures the first week. David is very passionate and the flow is easy to understand.

No attendance requirement so you can always keep up using the zoom recording provided. All recordings are available for all lecture sessions.

I have some Python programming background so by checking the PPTs would be enough for me.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two methods:
1. 24% midterm + 36% lab + 40% final
2. 42% lab + 58% final

* Lab: 7 labs in total but only the specified 3 are counted towards grading.

The higher score calculated from the above methods will automatically be used as an overall grade.

Even though the content is not hard as an introductory course, it is sort of difficult to get high marks in both final and midterm. No partial marks are awarded so basically one mistake results in no mark for the question and could possibly get you a lower grade range if it is for final. Many students take this course so it’s rather competitive in nature.

The key to get good grade is to answer questions fast and accurate enough - practice and understand the materials well to figure things out in a snap.

NO TOLERANCE FOR CARELESS MISTAKES!!!!!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light in general.

It only requires the completion of specific lab assignments and preparation for the midterm and final.

Labs are easy to follow and can easily score full with adequate amount of attention to do as the instructions say.

reviews.author: ummmmuu
reviews.title: 專搞人心態嘅course
reviews.comment_content:
都係啲basic python野 小學生都識
詳情可以參考其他人嘅review，大致上一樣
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson 同埋 David 嘅風格差唔多，教書幾有趣 - A
Lam ngok 教書有啲悶，不過幾好人，佢落堂會係出面等一陣，冇人問野先會走 - B

TA無個好，尤其是嗰個Eden,
簡直典型職場老屎忽，講唔過就攞自己所謂嘅職場經驗嚟大你，assignment唔使旨意係佢手中𢯎到分
而且佢地會係final前幾日通知你midterm無啦啦扣分，專搞心態 - E
reviews.comment_grading:
垃圾
可能今年mean奇高 冇9X一定冇A-range
有兩個grading schemes，計唔計midterm嘅分別
小弟嘅分:
Mt 93%
Final 74%
lab1/4/5: 100+100+89 (睇咗10次marking都俾人扣，牠們説我的program唔夠user-friendly，所以-11，無言)
Overall = 86% 得B 靚唔靚就你自己衡量啦，我冇嘢好講
利申: dse ICT有 5*，自認自己都經常粗心大意，低分自己攞嚟
btw zoom好多人俾人捉冇開cam，影唔清嗰啲，所以建議去quiet room考，個班人為咗拉低個mean乜都做得出嘅。
reviews.comment_workload:
0 workload
主要考你細唔細心
啲野唔難，但題目好多伏位
如果你打字夠快就容易高分
******記得記得一定要book quiet room考, zoom考容易出事

reviews.author: hishamhm
reviews.comment_content:
In terms of content, COMP1021 teaches you the basics of Python Programming.
Here are the specific modules we are taught:

Introduction to Python
Introduction to Turtle Graphics
Comments and Text
Making Decisions
Loops
Lists and Tuples
Slicing
Functions
Data Types
File Handling
Dictionaries
State Diagrams
Turtle Object Creation
Event Handling
Stacks
Advanced Operators
Objects
Recursion


Turtle Graphics is simply a module in Python which mainly draws things onto the screen.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Rossiter:
In terms of teaching, I would say he is easy to understand. It is easy to follow along what he is teaching in the class.

Professor Golin:
Although I did not attend any of his lectures, I have watched some of his lecture recordings before. He explains concepts very clearly and clearly outlines what we are expected and not expected to know. His organization of concepts is also good

Professor Lam:
Professor Lam explains the concepts very clearly and in depth  and I could understand him well. He is also very helpful. At the end of the lecture you can ask him questions and he is very patient and kind to answer them well.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are actually 2 methods which determine your final grade

1st Method:
Midterm 24%, Lab projects 36%, Final exam 40%

2nd Method:
Midterm 0%, Lab projects 42%, Final exam 58%

The highest of the above 2 marking methods will be used for the calculation of the final grade

Here are the performances for this semester:
First hand-in lab assignment:
Maximum mark 100
Minimum mark not including zeros 20
Mean not including zeros 98.8
Standard deviation not including zeros 4.8
Minimum mark including zeros 0
Mean including zeros 94.5
Standard deviation including zeros 20.7

My score = 90/100(This was because of one silly mistake :(   )

Second hand-in lab assigment:
Maximum mark 100
Minimum mark not including zeros 5
Mean 85.8
Standard deviation 28.6

My score = 100/100

Third hand-in lab assignment:
Maximum mark 100
Minimum mark not including zeros 5
Standard deviation 25.0
Mean 80.4

My score = 85/100 ( This lab was the hardest yet)

There are also other labs but those are not hand-in. However, it would be very useful to do them if you have the time

Midterm Exam:
average = 62.1
standard deviation =  24.1
maximum = 100
minimum = 7

My score = 36

Final exam:
average = 71.3
standard deviation = 20.7
maximum  = 100
minimum =  4
My score = 74

My total percentage score(using second marking method)  = 81.42%

Shockingly enough, I got a few points above mean for all my assignments and my final exam.

Despite this, I am getting just a B-
reviews.comment_workload:
In terms of workload, it was light.

There are 3 hand-in labs in which you have to work on. What they basically do is give you instructions and using these instructions, you would have to create programs.

In addition to that, there is the mid-term exam and the final you would have to study for.

reviews.author: Fructose
reviews.title: Be careful on every detail
reviews.comment_content:
The course content is:
1. Introduction to Python
2. Turtle
3. Comments, Variables and Text
4. Variables Types and 3 Operators
5. Making Decisions
6. Looping
7. Finding Repeating Patterns
8. Lists, Tuples and Strings
9. Functions
10. Dictionaries
11. More on Turtle
12. Turtle Window Event Handling
13. File Handling
14. Programming with Objects
15. Recursion
The course contents are basic since it's an introductory class and doesn't involve many advanced skills. And another reason is Python has relatively easier and clearer structure than C++, so it's a good choice taking 1021 as a first step to programming,
reviews.comment_teaching: The class was interesting and helpful. I choose not to go to class after a few classes, and it's still OK by only viewing the PPTs, doing past papers and interactive examples on the course website. All of the concepts are not difficult so if you give it a try, you will understand what it is.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not bad, but it's hard to got A+ since there are many schoolmates who have learnt python before. Midterm could be in or not be in the grading, as professor think it might be fair for those who haven't learned computer programming before. The system will automatically choose an higher mark for you.
I got:
93/100 in midterm;
100, 100, 90 in three graded labs;
93/100 in final.
And an A overall.
The papers are kind of tricky, because the time is not sufficient, you may slip a line or two in the question. Sometimes that's the way to increase your speed, but sometimes it may cause error.
That's why I lost 1 question for both midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is really great. You only need to do 3 hand-in labs, and for most the labs there are assistance period for you to raise questions, and most of the code will be given in the teaching website and video although I prefer to have it done by myself. The uploading procedure might be a little tricky because the lab is graded by machine and it has restrictions over the file name, file type, variable name and so on. So please pay attention to all the things on the course website. It would be a easy class following the instructions.

reviews.author: Gggggggggg
reviews.comment_content: Basic python programming and use of turtle
reviews.comment_teaching: Alex will go through every detail in the ppt and sometimes repeat again and again to make sure we fully understand the stuff inside. However, doing this is sometimes quite boring to me. I would prefer him to talk about other examples that is different from the ppt when he repeats the same concept. This will make it less boring and allows us to know more about different applications.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean in midterm is normal. However , the mean in final is super high this semester!
reviews.comment_workload: Normal

reviews.author: oaiiiiii
reviews.comment_content:
Python basic content, like for loop, while loop , slicing, lists, tuples, strings, logic , different data type and file handling.

Mainly using python turtle to draw different pictures and make little games, which is quite fun.

Python is one of the easiest language to start learning coding.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teacher is great and very nice and talks very slowly to ensure everyone can follow.
Speed 2x is suggested for watching zoom recordings.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade: A+
Lab:100%
Midterm: mean
Final exam:100%
One thing I like about the grading system is that there are two ways to calculate your final score. One is including the labs, midterm and final exam. Another is including only the labs and final exam. The final grade will be the higher one among two calculation methods. So no worry if you do not do great in your midterm like me. You can still get a very good grade if you do great in the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is ok. There are totally 6 labs, one lab one week averagely. Only 3 of them  are hand-in labs. The labs are easy if you follow the guide of the lab.

Doing the labs is essential because it is very good exercise to learn about python. You will be good in final exam if you really understand the labs.

reviews.author: Jones
reviews.title: Pretty Good Course
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty easy as I knew Python personally

Before Mid-Term:
Everything is easy.
-Input/Output
-If/Else
-For/While loops
-Strings/Lists/Variables
-Random
-Turtle

After Mid-Term:
Things are getting more difficult
-Functions
-Recursions
-Objects

Ranting time:
Online exams for this course were such a clusterfck. The mid-term exam was delayed for 30 minutes because too many people accessing the website at once and could not get into the monitoring zoom meetings. Canvas was also a disaster for online exam. For some reason, we couldn't go back to the previous question once we hit next. And I shit you not, they put the hardest question at question 2. WTF was I supposed to do? My friend and I literally stuck on this one for ages and he ending up not finishing 2 out of the 6 questions in part A. And I accidentally clicked the "next" button without finishing a question. Fml

TL;DR :
1. The online exam experience was terrible.
2. Make sure don't accidentally click the "next" or "submit" button as next semester are likely to be online exam as well and are likely to be using this shit system aka canvas as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pretty Good, Straight to the point and easy to understand. Prof Kim is a pretty nice professor too
reviews.comment_grading: Pretty Good Grading, tho you really have to be really careful in the exam, one careless mistake can cost you a subgrade
reviews.comment_workload: it s alright

reviews.author: Sofy Twilight
reviews.title: The name should be Introduction to Python / Introduction to Programming
reviews.comment_content:
Python
Print
Input
if ... else...
while ...
function
random
list
data handling
recursive function
objects
dictionary
turtle

For a python course this is a very trivial content. Except the TURTLE, not everyone has a good image imagination ability. And also, it is not like a computer science course but rather a programming / python course, that's why I have this title. A real computer science course should have some basic introduction to algorithm, memory and data structure, while python can be kept in the session to introduce the programming language. For the TURTLE, just forget it. Some may find it interesting, but most find it suffering.
reviews.comment_teaching: Wilfred is a good and kind person. I like his way when talking in the classes. That's not boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
The Grading scheme is fine. Two choices.
24% Midterm
36% Lab
40% Final
or
0% Midterm
42% Lab
58% Final

I strongly recommend you to do all the labs, they are not difficult to get full marks and can ensure that you can pass the course.
While in the past, the midterm is easier and many use it to "save" grade. This time the situation is totally different, midterm is quite difficult and mean is only 57, while final is easy and mean is 74.5! But I still suggest you to take midterm to reduce your risk. And in fact, doing midterm is equal or better than not doing in any cases.

Messages that not helpful:
I got full marks in midterm final labs This is a worthless data to help you to access the cutoff.
reviews.comment_workload: Not many. As long as you complete the labs. But of course, remember to revise and make sure that you understand ALL the concepts.

reviews.author: Pedrey
reviews.title: Very nice course, loved it
reviews.comment_content: Simple introductory python. For those who haven’t touched upon programming before (including me), definitely manageable.
reviews.comment_teaching: Love prof. Rossiter’s teaching, very engaging lessons and I just love his English accent a lot, it’s very comfortable to listen to. Easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very leng grade in my opinion, scored full in all assignments and +2SD in midterm, but only scored 77% in finals. Still got A+ so very surprised.

Doesn’t take attendance so I just watched all lecture recordings. They had a page just for this course (with all lecture recordings from all professors) so basically u can still watch the other professors’ lecture recordings if u want to
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, only lab assignments about once every 2-3 weeks. The labs are super easy cuz basically the lab TAs will record videos to teach you how to do the first 70% of the assignment and leave a small amount of work for you to figure out on your own (which was quite simple as well). Midterm was easy, but final was trickier than expected, I expected a higher mark for final but turns out still got A+ with only 77% in finals.

reviews.author: Harryp
reviews.comment_content: This course mainly teaches Python and basic algorithm knowledge. From basic output to some knowledge about recursion and class.
reviews.comment_teaching: I really love Prof Gibson's teaching. His fast speaking is a challenge at the beginning for me. But gradually I can understand better and better. He always personally types the code to demonstrate for students.
reviews.comment_grading: This time there are many students taking this course. So, rather high pressure existed. I think the final exam was more difficult than the past ones. The grading method is acceptable to some extent.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is adequate. Only some weekly assignments. Those are programs and there are lab courses that can teach you how to make it.

reviews.author: Natcha
reviews.title: Good python intro course
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is organised and clear. I already have a python background but I think someone who has little to know background would find this course quite easy to grasp also. The slides are extremely clear and easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching: Alex Lam is my professor and he talks at full speed since his way of speaking is wordy and each lecture is only 50 minutes. However, he is a pretty chill and nice guy and will be willing to answer your questions. If you don't understand Alex's lecture you can always go watch David Rossiter, once of the better professor, videos instead.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is extremely good.

2 ways of grading:

24% midterm + 36% lab + 40% final
42% lab + 58% final

(they will automatically choose the better one for you)

Midterm: Is fairy simple and easy. Many people got a full score on this. (mean: 71.9)
Finals: The final is absolute hell. It is impossible to finish all of the questions since reading the questions itself will already take all of your time. After the test, you will feel like you want to jump out of the building and kill yourself. (mean: 48.57)
Lab: The lab is also easy to complete since there is a video to guide you all the way through. However, be very careful on checking your work before submitting because most of the labs are automatically graded by the computer and if you make one simple mistake, it will ruin your grade. The mean though, is always close to 100.

My scores:
Midterm: 78
Finals: 56
Lab: 100

Final grade: B+

I am actually pretty satisfied with my grade since I think my scores are not that high above the mean :)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is reasonable. There is a lab for every week but only 3 is graded. You don't need to attend the lectures if you don't want to.

reviews.author: VictorF01
reviews.comment_content:
It's straightforward for people with programming experiences, and I believe it's not hard for people without any experience.

It covers basic python programming, mainly using turtle. If you know python, then what you need to do is to look up some turtle functions on the course website from time to time and then skip most of the classes to do more important things.

If only considering the contents and teaching, this is an excellent course for someone who wants to learn a programming language.
(Rather than an introduction to CS I'd say it's an introduction to turtle graphics)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great teaching, detailed notes and well-organised structures.
Also, all the materials can be found on the course website, that is the only thing you need.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 grading schemes:
Midterm 24%, Lab projects 36%, Final exam 40%
Midterm 0%, Lab projects 42%, Final exam 58%

Although it seems that you can give up on your midterm, I highly recommend you do your best in midterm cause the final is way harder. It's not that the question itself is tricky; it's that it's too easy to make mistakes.

Labs are pretty easy. Just follow the mark scheme carefully, then you will get full marks.

Because most people taking this course have programming experiences and the exams' questions are way too easy, getting a high A  isn't that easy. It's not really accessing how well you know python; it's actually testing how careful you are.
reviews.comment_workload: Little, almost none. The only time that I remember I took this course was when there's a hand-in lab or an exam.

reviews.author: Cdb
reviews.comment_content: The contents are fascinating and valuable, particularly if you want to learn more about programming. Even if you don't, you'll understand the logic used in Computer Science, which is probably extremely important.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson was a fun guy, his lesson will never bored. He always explains the concepts clearly by using the funny method.
TA is great too.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grades were alright. The midterm was easy, HOWEVER, the final is a little hard and not enough time.

My marks:
Midterm: 100/100
Final: 75.4/100
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is low, all the labs were easy to finish.

reviews.author: Not WiFi
reviews.title: Interesting Course
reviews.comment_content: Some basic Pythons concepts and code usages.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson always gives some examples which can be easily understood. Also, he always talks in an interesting way and tries to get our attention. His English is clear and easy to be listened.
reviews.comment_grading:
Although I did not know anything about Python and other computer programs before, I still could get a good grade. The assignments were easy since there were guidelines for you to follow. For exam, I think online exam is harder than f2f exam(maybe since we can use Pythons for help), but if you finish all the past paper and understand the concepts, then you will be fine. I think this program aims to give you a taste of Pythons and attract you to learn.
Btw you can choose to attend the midterm exam or not depends on which score calculation method you want.
reviews.comment_workload: Not big. Only 6 assignments in total with 1 optional midterm, 1 final exam.

reviews.author: CyRuS128
reviews.title: very good
reviews.comment_content: basic of python, concept about programming, it maybe easier if you study ICT in DSE
reviews.comment_teaching: LAM Ngok is a good teacher, he is willing to answer your questions, but lectures  boring and slow. you can skip the live, and use 1.5 speed to rush the video, and the TA is very helpful
reviews.comment_grading:
assignment full marks
mid term- below mean 十幾分
final - 踩mean

有兩種計分方法， 一個係asm + mid term + final，一個係asm + final(佔曬 midterm 同final %）
會用高分既方法
grade B+
reviews.comment_workload: 6 lab for whole semester, the TA will teach you step by step to final the lab

reviews.author: Rishab
reviews.comment_content: The content was good. The programming was done on Python, and we used Python IDLE all the time. It covered the basics of Computer Science, and the content we learned was what you usually expect to learn in other Computer Science courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was fun. We were allowed to attend any of the instructors that were teaching the course. If you asked a question, the instructors and TAs would always give good feedback.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was fine. We had 3 lab assignment, one midterm and one final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There were 3 labs that we had to finish through the course.

reviews.author: yoyoyoyooyy
reviews.title: Might be difficult for beginners but still manageable
reviews.comment_content:
Literally the introduction of Python
Before midterms: Playing with shapes and colors, relatively simple code.
After midterms: the code gets complicated all of sudden. Lots of things to memorize.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Rossister's lectures are really useful and interesting. He provides lots of supplementary examples which is helpful when preparing for the exams. He is the best professor in this course.

However, professor Chan demonstrated every example in her lecture. If you are a beginner and need to understand the basic concept her class is also helpful. But only taking her lecture won't be enough to get used to solve questions in the actual exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two grading scheme
1.Lab 36% Midterm 24% Final 40%
2. Lab 42% Midterm 0% Final 58%

Labs: detailed instruction - mostly get full marks
Midterms: If you have understood the contents well, doable
Finals: the contents themselves are difficult and the level of difficulty of the exam also increases so much.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload if you manage the time for labs.
The work only contains labs once in two ~ three weeks. As a beginner, the lab 1~4 (before midterms) was kind of easy. I was able to finish it within one hour. However, from lab 5 to lab 7, it was really difficult for me. I coudnl't complete the code by myself and needed to get help from my classmates.

reviews.author: Charizard
reviews.title: Nice class bringing you to the world of computer
reviews.comment_content:
Basically some fundamental elements of Python 3.8. Python’s unique language feature allow you to write code naturally, just like speaking English, don’t worry about the content.

Actually, I think the most important knowledge is logic. If you think like a computer, you will easily get a A+. You don’t need any CODE computer background, visualized computer programming like Scratch or LEGO EV3 is much more enough.

REMEMBER, LOGIC IS THE KEY.
There aren’t many advanced elements in this class, I think it accumulates students LOGIC.

For a question, SET YOUR GOAL, THINK LIKE A COMPUTER.
reviews.comment_teaching:
David’s teaching is pretty nice, very interesting class.

However, you don’t need to attend any of the lectures (I do so) because the cse website include all slides in class and all video recordings. You can learn by your own in weekends so your timetable will be more flexible. In this way I missed many interesting class, ah so sad.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 Lab assignment with Mid and Final.
Because of the Covid, we have all exam online. We can use python and google, but the question is much harder than before (maybe to prevent cheating lol).

Teaching team is very nice, they knew the exam (especially the final) is very hard, so they exclude 2 of the worse performance questions’ score so your result will be much better.

2 Grading methods, one includes mid and another excludes. HOWEVER, TAKING MID IS RECOMMENDED. So you can know how did you learn in the previous part (because they are basic things that cannot be skipped in the final)

Lab: most student get 100 so please ensure you do it carefully. If you don’t know how to finish, check the website! There are very detailed videos.

Mid:
Mean: 64
SD: 21

Me: 92

Final:
Mean: 56
SD: 20

Me: 94

Overall 96.5, but I only got A- ??? My friend’s said there must be a mistake, I just emailed TA and Prof and they said they will check my grade later.
I’ll update my grade in the comment area.

The Professor said a TA made a mistake and my grade has been changed to A+.

Fair grade I think. REMEMBER THAT YOU CAN USE GOOGLE AND PYTHON! Don’t just look at the code and think.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not very heavy I think, I’ll only work on this class when there was a lab assignment and before exam (I even don’t review before the mid because I got a fever :(

So don’t worry about it, the class is very flexible, manage your time well.

THINK LIKE A COMPUTER, LEARN LOGIC RATHER THAN PYTHON. That’s the key.

reviews.author: 落車請早揚聲
reviews.title: learn_how_to_program_with_Python
reviews.comment_content: teaches basic syntax, logic about programming (using python). Most content has to do with the "turtle module", which is a module in Python that we can use to draw different things.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Rossiter's teaching is absolutely amazing! Unlike other instructors in this course, he seldom use the slides during the lecture, instead, he demonstrates everything during the lecture, show how he types, formats, figure the logic, etc.
The combination of his attractive British accent and humorous lecture style will definately make you love this course!
reviews.comment_grading:
very good!
there are two grading schems. (one include midterm and one doesn't include midterm) you can see the exact percentage for each part on other posts.
As for me, I got full in labs, midterm not so good(mean +0.89sd), final quite good(mean +1.56sd), eventually overall 93.04%, A+.

BTW, the midterm was actually easier than the final. the final was REALLY HARD, but don't worry, it's hard for you, it's hard for everyone else too. During the final I really thought I was doomed, but eventually it was +1.56sd and A+ at last.
reviews.comment_workload:
not too high, but it's good to always "play around". (Prof.Rossiter said it is the best way to learn programming) when doing the labs, try to "deliberately mess things up", and see what will happen. when you have questions, before google it or asking the TA, try to try it out yourself. just something simple in the IDLE and run the code, see what will happen. It is the best way to learn programming.

If you only focus on finishing the labs and attending the lectures, the workload isn't tough. but it can get higher when you "play around a lot".

reviews.author: 快樂肥仔
reviews.title: A nice course with a nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
As I'm not majoring in CS, I don't know whether the skills I've learned will be useful or not in the future. But I'm still happy for successfully using Python turtle to draw lovely images and create amazing games.

Don't think that the exam will be easy! As the professor mentioned earlier, they are now trying to make the exams more challenging, but it is still a fair test and will not be too difficult if you are willing to pay an effort.
reviews.comment_teaching: David is definitely one of the best professors I've met in the UST and his accent is so attractive!! He's super humorous and you will never be bored during his lectures! He would also provide many examples so that we can fully understand the theories. P.S. Kelvin is also a super helpful TA!

Minimum 20

Lab 5:

Maximum                                 100  

Lab 7:

Stdev (excluding zeros)           11.4

Maximum                                 100
