reviews.author: JDC
reviews.title: Nice Teacher, Fun Class
reviews.comment_content: The content is appropriate and enjoyable to a person with no programming experience. You learn how to create games such as tetris as one of the assignments, and the concepts presented in tutorials are usually quite interesting. You learn basic programming ideas through python, and the language itself is fairly straightforward and intuitive for a beginner. You access libraries such as the turtle library and time library, which allows you to create some basic yet cool programs. The powerpoint slides are usually quite succinct and only contain the necessary information, which is nice when studying. The tutorials are fun and nice to do because they test your own problem-solving skills sometimes, although a lot of the times the code is basically given to you through the resources given which is nice as well as you don't spend too long trying to figure out the code you need.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teacher is very good, he has a passion for the subject and really wants his students to succeed. He is likeable as well, and encourages us to ask questions and participate in class. Sometimes his analogies are difficult to understand but overall a good instructor.

I didn't pay attention to the TA because all the instructions and information you need for the tutorials are already on the website and resources given to you.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good, although this is for the 2019 Fall sem so it decided to do an online testing module for the final exam and changed the grading scheme. The original grading scheme was quite fair and the revised one was also fair when considering the situation. As long as the exams are good the grade should be fine, the assignment is usually easy to get 100% on as well.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not heavy, just need to finish the 2/3 big assignments which are like medium-sized programs that feature graphics, games etc. And you should also attend tutorials but those you can kinda skip and just follow the instructions at home, unless you really need the TA's help. The assignments are quite simple, especially for someone who already has experience with python or programming and should still be fine for someone without any experience as well.

As long as you have a good grasp of the content and concepts introduced in class, it should be fine.

reviews.author: //Snow.
reviews.title: You gotta try this course
reviews.comment_content:
Full of basic programming knowledge of Python, range from printing a single line of statements to program recursions. Online website with powerpoints that will basically teach you everything.
But I don't really recommend people with completely no programming knowledge and interest to attend this course, it won't be fun when you have no clue wtf you typing into the IDLE.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is literally the funniest professor, just seeing him teaching is pure amusement. He can combine both humor and teaching together perfectly, simply awesome.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got A-
Yes, A-, even though I didn't attend most of the lessons :)
reviews.comment_workload: Just 2 hand-in assignments and they teach most of the required skills in the labs. But actually you will figure it out by searching it online even when you don't go to the labs XD

reviews.author: lmao7799
reviews.title: very good course
reviews.comment_content:
Notes are useful and well-organised.

Lab work every week will build up your understanding on how to put codes together to create a program. There are notes and instructions teaching you how to make different programs step by step, such as Tetris, drawing pad, firework animation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lessons are eye-opening as professor will demonstrate how to write codes at a simple and precise manner during lessons instead of merely teaching based on the notes. Professor Kim also made several games with Python for us to understand the learnt materials better. He is a nice and funny guy, I am sure anyone would enjoy his lessons haha. Professor Kim has a unique accent that is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
There is midterm, 2 assignments with transparent grading guidelines, and online assignment (which is used to substitute the final exam for this semester due to unexpected class suspension).
Attendance is not needed for both lectures and labs.
The grading is quite reasonable, however since most of the students will get full marks, you may not have a good grade if you  miss out any bonus marks in assignments.
For midterm, you can have cheat sheets, without limitations on how many pages lol. But it is better to have a look at the content first, don't expect you have enough time to go through the given notes during the midterm as time is very tight.
The online assignment (/final exam) is kind of unfair. For this semester, we have 5 days to work on it, and everyone has a different set of questions, of course with different levels of difficulties.
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments are not much, but it takes time to understand the concepts and debug the codes, since the given instructions on the webpages will not tell you exactly what to put in your program.

reviews.author: 夜猫
reviews.comment_content:
As easy as a simple game. If you played some video game of programming that this course will be a simple task and focus careless mistakes.

Including:
-basic python(or what?)
-turtle(a class of interact, simply take it as a series of commands to help you make a window which show your work)
-logic determine( true or false is true, true and false is false, true or true is true, false or false is false)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Spectacular!
A wonderful, fun and friendly( to you and your grade) instructor.
However the course is too easy so that I did my work on the lecture without listen.
The wonderful pt is: Even I did not listen, his questions were enough to learn all contents.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two grading scheme with those parts:
-Midterm exam
-Final exam
-Lab assignment and others

Lab is easy to get full mark if you follow TA and for me TA is useless on programming but helpful to debug. (They are good but the works too easy. However, when you write code, there is bug, or are bugs)

Another two parts:
scheme 1: Midterm 40% final 60%
scheme 2: final 100%
automatically take the higher one
reviews.comment_workload:
EVERYTHING IS EASY!
BUT CARELESS MISTAKES!

Actually the lab will take time to write codes but it is only work without the two exam.

Oh, wait. The exam is able to take cheat sheet, in my words, open paper exam.

reviews.author: gdhdsv
reviews.title: good course, good grade
reviews.comment_content:
contents are easy, it is about the basic logic of programming. They use different kinds of metaphors to explain the concepts and provide ample examples which are easy to understand. I think you don't have to be very brilliant and hard-working in this course. Just have a quick perusal on those ppt slides, try to run those examples programs, make some little change on them and you will learn it effortlessly.

how much time you need basically depends on your coding background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lam Ngok speaks clearly and with jokes (although not much people laugh at them). It's ok if you don't have time to attend the lectures and study alone because the ppt slides itself are easy. But I discourage you to do that if you are a programming newbie. I attended all the lectures because I have time and I took that for a review.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is a good-grade course for someone with little experience in coding. I learnt some c++ before so it is good-grade for me. 69/100 in mid-term and full marks in 2 assignments and 96/100 in online assignment and I got A-.

mid-term was an open-book test, but I forgot to bring my printed ppt slides, and I was half an hour late. Don't act like me.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is modest. If you are beginner and you want to get full marks in 2 assignments, just focus on the labs and follow what they ask you to do and you will get around 80%. The 20% is left to you.

reviews.author: J Yang
reviews.title: Recommended for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
The course is mainly about Python 3.7 and its basic grammar. The content is mainly focused on turtle function after midterm.

I would say the whole thing is pretty easy to understand if you check with the slides and examples often. You don't even need to go to labs as it does not take attendance and it is VERY VERY tedious.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is in range but it is not difficult at all because it is a beginners' class. The instructor and professor were trying hard to make everyone understand what they were talking about, so don't even worry if you are a total beginner.
reviews.comment_grading:
Highly competitive. The grading in this fall term was altered so it does not help. A simple mistake would let you say goodbye to A range.

Also would like to mention, the course uses two grading systems and chooses the best one as your final grade, which is very thoughtful.
reviews.comment_workload:
Two assignments in total. The second one is a bit harder and more complicated than the first one.
Labs do not count but it is worth practising.
Midterm and final are OPEN-BOOK.
Only takes me about 3-4 hrs a week.

reviews.author: tyj
reviews.comment_content:
The lecture content is quite basic if you have experience in programming. And there is no attendance requirement for this course.
There are two assignments: L-systems and a Tetris game. The first system was much easier than the second and only required repetitive work.
Gibson teaches according to lecture notes he wrote, so they are complete. Also, he co-authored a textbook that can be used for reading ahead.
There was only a proctored midterm this semester. It is supposed to open-book, but time is limited.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson tries to make the class interesting and accessible to people new in programming, so he often repeats simple concepts. He and the TAs are very helpful and prompt in answering questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair although the papers can be challenging. The mean for this midterm was exceptionally low. However, the instructors are flexible by providing two grading schemes. This increases students' chances of getting a better grade.
For assignments, a marking scheme is provided so that the requirements are clearly stated. Clear feedback is also provided.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light unless you take the initiative to do more programming exercises. Labs can be finished without attending the sessions.

reviews.author: HowardKang
reviews.comment_content: First part is turtle graphic and basic loops, should be easy for those who have learnt programming before. Second part is dictionary, basic OOP, etc, more difficult than the first part.Thus remember to attend lectures after midterm.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is quite humorous and able to explain the content clearly, but in able to finish a topic on time.Therefore, the syllabus is for reference only.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 66
First Assignment 83
Second Assignment 95
Online Quiz 88
Final Result: B
reviews.comment_workload: Actually not quite much, lectures and labs aren’t compulsory. Yet, if wanting to get a better result, please attend both of them as much as possible.Revision is also necessary if you are not a genius in CS. Remember to hand in the assignment punctually.

reviews.author: wtf522
reviews.title: Good grade course if you have a programming background
reviews.comment_content:
To put it simply, it's a Python introductory course.

Major topics include:
- basic programming concepts (loops, conditionals, functions)
- simple data structures (list, dictionary)
- turtle programming
reviews.comment_teaching: He is a passionate lecturer. He tries hard to make classes fun and lively. He shows live examples to illustrate new concepts, sometimes even makes intentional mistakes to consolidate our understandings.
reviews.comment_grading:
Due to the situation in Hong Kong, two new grading methods were provided:
- Assignment 25%*2, Midterm 35%, Online Final 15%
- Assignment 35%*2, Midterm 10%, Online Final 20%
(Online Final is an online canvas quiz with a span of 5 days and no time limit)

Statistics:
- Midterm: Max: 100, Min: 1, Avg: 57.9, SD: 25.1
- Assignment 1: Max: 100, Min: 3, Avg: 92.5, SD: 29.6
- Assignment 2: Max: 100, Min: 20, Avg: 92.6, SD: 28.6
- Online Final: Max: 100, Min (excluding 0s): 8, Avg: 87, SD: 14.77

Bonus marks:
The cap of the bonus marks is 3% of the course total. At the beginning of the semester, the lecturer mentioned that we might get the bonus marks by making some videos, but he never disclosed the details. In the end, it is replaced with answering questions regarding details in the online lectures.

Overall comments:
The grading is not that good in this semester. All the averages are so high that the deciding factor of your grade comes down to the carefulness. You probably need around 97-100 overall to get A range, which may be easy for those who have a programming background but hard for the others.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are just two relatively easy assignments, one midterm and one final. No attendance is taken during lectures and labs.

For someone who has a programming background, it's perfectly fine to skip all lectures and labs, and go to the exams with just a Python cheat sheet from Google. But for those who are new to programming, it may be time-consuming to familarise themselves with the new concepts.

reviews.author: ogt
reviews.title: Introductory Computer Science Course
reviews.comment_content:
As the other reviews have said, this course introduces basic programming concepts (conditional statements, loops, basic data structures, basic recursion, a brief overview of OOP) in Python.
The course is centered around a particular Python package, the turtle module, and most concepts are introduced using this module.
I wish the course covered more concepts, as at the end of the semester it feels like we have barely scratched the surface of the vast world of programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching was good. Concepts are quite simple so not much to say, but the professor was funny and made an effort to make the class entertaining. He also showed live examples which was good.

The labs were ok, if you have previous programming knowledge you can do them by yourself as instructions are provided online.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading this semester was changed due to on-campus classes & exams being canceled.
Midterm & assignments stayed the same though:
- Midterm: Max: 100, Min: 1, Avg: 57.9, Std. Dev.: 25.1
- Assignment 1: Max: 100, Min: 3, Avg: 92.5, Std. Dev.: 29.6
- Assignment 2: Max: 100, Min: 20, Avg: 92.6, Std. Dev.: 28.6

The final was replaced by an online quiz:
Max: 100, Min (excluding 0s): 8, Avg: 87, Std. Dev.: 14.77

Grading was good. I would recommend going through the past papers to make sure you understand everything, and if you don't, look up youtube videos because there are plenty of useful resources online.
Due to the on-going events and changes in grading, you needed 100/100 (3 bonus points were given for watching lectures) to get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very low, no note-taking is required as the material is easy and the slides are well made. Just a bit of studying and doing past papers before exams.
Assignments were quite easy too, as most of the code is given in the labs and you just have to add a few features.

The first assignement was an L-system "displayer". In the second assignement, we made Tetris. Most people get full marks so be careful though!

reviews.author: hsheridan
reviews.comment_content: Basic python programming course. Most of the contents are not very difficult and some of them are quite interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson teaches quite good and always uses his own examples to explain the contents.he will answer all question patiently. His teaching is very clear
reviews.comment_grading:
fair
Assignments: 30%
Midterm: 25% or 5%
Final 45% or 65%
reviews.comment_workload:
1 midterm
1 final
2 assignments
No Attendance required for the classes and labs. However, the he may set up some bonus questions .Those assignments will be educated in the lab . So in the event that you go to every one of them and pay attention, you can get high marks.

reviews.author: Sahil Daswani
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty easy if you know programming, and you will be very easy to fit in even if you don't know anything about programming. After these classes, you can actually make a game on your own.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures are pretty useless. The professor just reads off the slides and sometimes adds on a little bit more information but its pretty easy to self learn the content as the slides are pretty informative.
reviews.comment_grading: Gradings were alright but the midterms seem to be getting harder every year.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty small. You only have 2 assignments,1 mid-term and 1 final. The assignments may be a bit time consuming if you don't have much experience programming.

reviews.author: mint3
reviews.title: Not particularly hard
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers the basics of the Python programming language and Turtle graphics
Concepts covered in the midterm includes:
- Variables
- Functions
- Lists
- Inputs
- Types
Topics introduced after the midterm includes:
- Slicing
- Objects
- Screen events
- Timers
- File handling
- Recursion
The topics introduced after the midterms are considerably harder to understand than those before the midterm so if you are a slow learner or have little programming experience, you should study the lecture notes and lab notes thoroughly.
reviews.comment_teaching: The explanation for the concepts are clear and aided with examples and that makes it fairly easy to understand. The lab notes explains the steps in depth and in detail so they are very easy to follow and replicate.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 30%
Midterm: 25%/5%
Final 45%/65%
The later grading criteria if you score higher in the final than in the midterm. Both of the exams are open book and open notes, however the midterm stats is quite depressing.
Max: 100, Min: 1, Avg: 57.9, SD: 25.1
Bonus points can be gained by just watching the online videos and answering a few questions.
My grades:
Midterm: 94%
Assignments: 100%
Final: 96%
Bonus points: 3
Final grade: A+ (yay!)
reviews.comment_workload: If you have experienced with Python before, you can as well as skip all the lectures and labs and do everything by yourself. The assignments were easy (Assignment 1 took me like 90 minutes to complete)

reviews.author: tinggia
reviews.comment_content: Suitable for those who don't have experiences in programming like me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson makes things simple and clear. He tries to make be funny so you won't fall asleep.
The TA is patient and nice but not that good at explaining things in English. You need to stay really focus to understand his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: Some other people have already learned these stuff before but are still taking this class. So it might not be that easy to get A+. I haven't got my grade, but I think it should be OK.
reviews.comment_workload: Have a few assignments in a semester. I think it's quite easy. Just follow the instruction and go to the lab, then you will be fine.

reviews.author: JustChill
reviews.title: A nice programming course for beginners!
reviews.comment_content:
It will teach you the fundamental basics of programming by using python and turtle.

Attached is the course details which you may find useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches very well in a very fun and interesting way. He even shared with us why he is getting fatter and fatter - the quality of the canteens in UST.
reviews.comment_grading:
As most of the people actually have background knowledge in programming (esp. those who studied ICT in their high-school), quite a lot of the people can get a very high mark (even full mark) in midterm and final exam. The mean score and SD for the midterm in 2019-20 Fall is 57.9 and 25.1.

Assignments: 2 Assignments in total and most of the students can get a full mark for their assignments as TAs will guide and teach you how to do the assignments during labs.

Couse weighting:  
Midterm 25%, Assignments 30%, Final exam 45% Or
Midterm 5%, Assignments 30%, Final exam 65%
It will automatically choose the highest mark of these
two calculations for you. So if you fail to get a satisfactory score in the midterm, you still have a chance to do better in the final exam!
reviews.comment_workload:
No Attendance needed for both lectures and labs. But the lecturers might prepare some bonus question after the lectures. Most of the bonus questions are not difficult and you will get a bonus score if you can answer the question correctly. So it's always better to attend lectures and labs!!

Midterm and Final exam are open-booked so really not much workload from this course!

reviews.author: yayyyyy
reviews.title: Good grade low workload
reviews.comment_content: Basic python with lectures and labs, use python programming in interesting areas such as game programming, computer graphics, and user interface design. Easy concepts about python, simple logic with examples and applications.
reviews.comment_teaching: David is really good at teaching. He is funning, clear and organized. He also gives examples in class, which is not posted on notes or websites, so they are quite good for exam preparation.
reviews.comment_grading:
Labs: 4 x 8% =32%
Two options (automatically choose the better one):
Midterm: 25%/10%
Final: 43%/58%

Exams were quite easy, once you got all the concepts clear.

The professor randomly picked students in classes to answer questions, and if you answer it right, you can get a bonus card, which adds 0.4% to total grades at the end of the semester. The mechanism encourages people to go to class and be focused on his questions.

Good grading in general.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light in my opinion. No attendance required so if you are competent in python, you don't have to go to classes.

The tasks in the lab are also not hard, you can complete them by yourselves in advance.

reviews.author: Monish
reviews.title: COMP1021
reviews.comment_content: Content is fairly easy, covering the basic Python principles along with turtle graphics. All lecture notes provided.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor was OK, but a bit slow and boring. Couldn't cover all the required materials until the lesson before midterms.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was Good. Midterms count as 35% if you do well, if not then only 5%. Finals count for 45% and the two assignments count for 15%.
reviews.comment_workload: Very low work load, only the 2 assignments to do. Lab attendance not necessary, work to do in labs were rather limited anyway. Exams are also open book so not much revision is required

reviews.author: angiechan
reviews.comment_content: It's about basic python programming. There will be two lectures per week and every lecture is around one hour. There will be a two hours lab every week also. People usually do their assignment during the lab. Topics are list and string, dictionary, turtle, class and object and data structures etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is good and he planned the lessons well. Sometimes he will all questions during class, which you will get marks towards your final grades. So it is important for you to attend your classes.
reviews.comment_grading: The exam paper is not that hard but there are some tricky questions. We have to be careful of those questions. If you study well, your hardwork will pay off. Remember to go through the lecture power point well and understand the lab assignment, it can help your exams a lot. It would be much better if you finish all past paper. Getting full marks in all your assignments address important because most of the people will get 100 marks and the mean is quite high also.
reviews.comment_workload: There are not much workloads. There are labs which you have to write some Python codes. But the content is not that hard.

reviews.author: janetzhang321
reviews.comment_content: I really enjoyed this class. I had some programming experience in high school, which was very helpful, but there are lots of people who don’t have experience and still do well. If you are interested in the subject and willing to work hard, this class is very doable. There are tons of office hours, which you should go to right away if you are confused, especially at the beginning of the semester because computer science builds on itself. My advice is to start the projects early (seriously, look at the prompt before class and then try to do half of it by the next class and then finish before the deadline) and get help often. You might want to look at some online coding courses before hand, but it isn’t necessary. Many people take this class having never looked at code before in their life and are fine, but it is definitely harder because coding is a new way of thinking that might not work for you. Also, it is important to go to class because there were several questions on the final that are based on programs we went over in class but weren’t explained in the textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching: hard to understand and follow
reviews.comment_grading: light grader
reviews.comment_workload: hard

reviews.author: CHEN,Maoyiyu
reviews.title: Introduction to Computer Science
reviews.comment_content:
One of the three introductory CS courses.
Although the title is introduction to computer science, it is actually a fundamental course of Python.
The content is easy and interesting even for beginners, so you don't need to worry about it if you just focus in class and practice after class.
Course Outcomes:
1. Demonstrate programming skills with and emphasis on the Python programming language.
2. Write programs in interesting areas such as game programming, computer graphics and user interface design.

Lab & Lecture both required but not compulsory. I'll illustrate it in "Grading".

The slides are enough, you don't need to buy a book unless you need more illustration.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is quite funny, so you don't need to worry you will fall asleep.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Basis: A+ to F
Lab & Lecture both required but not compulsory. Attendance will not be taken but if you skip lectures you will miss the chances of bonus, in the form of answering questions rightly in class. The instructor will randomly pick one student, for instance, the one wearing green etc. Each bonus counts for 0.4% to your final grade. You can skip labs if you are good enough to finish the assignments yourself, otherwise you'd better solve all your problems during your lab time.
Grading Scheme:
Labs 4*8%   32%
Midterm 25%/10%
Final      43%/58%
Two schemes designed for those who don't do well in midterm. The system will automatically choose the higher one of it.
Midterm and Final are both normal ones, which means easy for those who work hard and okay for those who pay little.
Lab assignments are harder than midterm and final. If you can finish them perfectly, those MCs and fill-in-blank questions in midterm and final will definitely be easy cases for you.
reviews.comment_workload:
Normal.
Pay attention in class and often practice for examples in slides and lab assignments, you can get a very good grade.
Remember, comprehending and practicing are more important than memorizing.

reviews.author: Humi@SENG
reviews.comment_content:
A very basic introduction to Python

His joke helps me remember many details so I didn't study much before tests.
Also, most of the TAs are kind and would very willing to answer any question you raised.
They would spend lots of time teaching you the details in the lab section.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is fair.
Assignment: 100%
Midterm: 76%
Final: 84%
Bonus: 2%
Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Light.
Actually, you can skip all the classes. Just handing in 4 assignments and attend the final exam is enough for you to take an A grade.
Those assignments will be taught in the lab section. So if you attend all of them and take attention, you can surely get full marks.

reviews.comment_grading: Easy to get a B+/A-, as long as you don't make any careless mistakes, but really hard to get an A/A+, go register 1022q if you want better grades. Also, exams are open notes, midterm exam may not count towards final (depends on other grades in final and labs). Past papers are given before exams.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload, only 4 out of 7 labs needed to be handed in. No homework.

reviews.author: Kelvinluk827
reviews.comment_content:
Boring content. They are just some basic things of programming that should have been finished in weeks.

the basic things, such as basic syntax, I/O, condition (if then else), loops(for loop, while loop), operators, file I/O, string and string manipulations, some data type (tuplet(=constant array), list(=array), dictionary(=map in c++)),colours , a little bit of object and event in python.

main focus is on the turtle graphic of python and the professor usually uses turtle graphic as a tool to teach some of the basic things mentioned above.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Rossiter taught the course in a fun(funny) way. He deliberately raised the tone of his voice to produce a delightful atmosphere. eventhough the content is quite boring, his way of presentation would definitely keep us awake.

BTW, he never picks the ones who raise their hands to answer his questions and he picks his target with a weird standard each lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 3 parts: assignments, midterm and final.
and there are 2 method of calculating the overall score, the 1st one is taking account of all 3 parts in different ratio. the 2nd one is counting the score of assignments and final only in different ratio. I have forgotten the exact ratios and cannot find it again as the page of the course is removed.
It is alright for you to skip the midterm if u have faith.

there is bonus mark given to those who answers questions during lecture. 0.5% per question

as the course content is too basic and easy and the exams are open book and open notes, students tend to get high marks, which means careless mistakes HURT A LOT.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very low.
there were only 4 assignments for us. they were given during lab lesson and will be guided from the start to the end by the ta in the lab lesson. So there was literally no out of class work if u follow ta's instructions during lab lesson.

If you are a person that hates attending lab lesson like me, a detailed guide for each lab and assignment were given online. you can follow the guide and finish the assignments within an hour at home EASILY

reviews.author: Doraemon
reviews.title: A great introductory course in Python programming
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers most of the fundamental concepts and logic in programming using the Python language and follows the textbook Interactive Python Programming For Beginners by Prof. Rossiter and Prof. Lam. Topics covered include:

1. Basic turtle graphics
2. For loops, while loops
3. Lists, tuples, strings and dictionaries
4. Defining functions
5. Window screen events
6. Basis in object-oriented programming
7. Recursion
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching was great. Prof. Rossiter's lectures were interesting and fun. He frequently asked questions in class so that you can get more practice in reading and understanding programs and codes. This certainly helped to consolidate materials taught in the lectures.

There are two TAs responsible for each lab session. They will guide you to complete the lab project step-by-step. However, you may skip all lab sessions if you think you can complete them on your own.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 2 scoring schemes in this course:

Scheme A: Midterm 25% + Lab projects 32% + Final exam 43%

Scheme B: Midterm 0% + Lab projects 42% + Final exam 58%

The scheme that gives a higher overall score will be used to determine the final grade.

Given that I have almost no experience in programming, I got an A in this course. In my opinion, the course grading is excellent. It is quite easy to score full mark in lab projects as they are really simple, and the lab TA will show you almost all the codes you need for your lab project.

Midterm and final are easy (compared to other courses I have taken) but just quite tricky. Getting 80% or above is not hard if you are careful enough. Both midterm and final are open book, so they really test on your understanding of the logic of the programs.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very light.

There is a lab project every week but only the odd-numbered ones are graded. In other words, there are altogether 8 lab projects in which 4 are graded. The lab projects are not hard at all and can be completed in less than 2 hours.

Since the midterm and final exams are both open-book, there is no need for any memorization. It is recommended that you should try understanding the logic of different codes through lab projects, or even try to design and write a program of some simple games. By doing so, studying for this course will be much fun.

Those labs are very easy and tas will help.
its easy to get full marks in labs and assignments.

reviews.author: Tony TSOI
reviews.title: Good Course
reviews.comment_content: Despite of the basic structure of the programming language, turtle graphic tool was also a big part of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually I don't think I am able to judge the instructor's teaching because I almost skipped all the classes. According to my few experiences of the course, the instructor would review the contend of the class before and then start the new lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: There were two methods of grading according to the authority of the midterm exam. I got an A finally (around 94%). If I worked harder and attended all the lectures and labs, I might get an A +.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too high, I skipped almost all the lectures and labs and it was still fine.

reviews.author: Danik02
reviews.comment_content: Basic introdution to python, very good for beginners. Two lectrues and one lab per week. If you took programming lessons before, this will be very easy for you, if not you will be fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecturer is quite funny and speaks well, don't have much experience with TAs.
reviews.comment_grading: Since most people finish their homework without problem, midterm and final have bigger impact on your grade, but test aren't that hard.
reviews.comment_workload: Lectures are very good for understanding what you have to do to complete homework, so if you understand lectures you can get them finished very fast.

reviews.author: Anothersarahwhy
reviews.title: so easy
reviews.comment_content:
it is easy even if you are not familiar with computer or coding.
this is an introductory course about python
reviews.comment_teaching: he is so funny and he would ask questions
reviews.comment_grading:
good grading
there are bonus mark if you answer the question correctly in class.
and if you miss midterm, dont worry about it as there are two weighting system
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is not heavy because the assignments are taught in the lab session so you can actually finish your assignment in lab session
mid-term and final are open book

reviews.author: ysj0828
reviews.comment_content:
Python
Basic programming logic and make use of turtle library to draw or make "animations".
reviews.comment_teaching:
If you can manage to understand contents in the lecture notes without any help, you don't really have to go to lectures.
Just basic programming stuff
For me, I found lectures kind of useless because he was just reading the lecture note word to word.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 Marking scheme:
2x5% from Assignments + 90% finals

or

2x15% from assignments + 30% midterm + 40% finals (not sure about the exact percentage)
reviews.comment_workload:
2 Assignments, Mid-term, Final
The assignments don't take too much of your time. They are do-able.

reviews.author: KST
reviews.title: 必讀course
reviews.comment_content:
內容以python爲主
冇programming底唔會差好多，佢由最基本開始教，循序漸進
仲會教turtle graphics，畫唔同的形狀、圖畫、甚至整遊戲都得，算幾好玩

programming方面同中學ict的programming elective 教的嘢差唔多，只係變左做python，要稍微熟悉一下啲syntax
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecture 個professor都係跟powerpoint讀，上左幾堂冇上，有時間有興趣可以去聽下，另外send email問嘢佢都會好快覆。
上堂答問題有分加，好似0.4%，最多計兩題，每堂問1-2題。
TA好好人，program有bug可以問佢，如果上完lab都未解決到bug，可以send email俾佢，佢會講翻邊度錯。
lab會一步一步guide住寫，跟住professor打就得，不過佢有時會打錯，要同學幫手搵bug，幾得意。
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term比較容易，考基本programming, if then else, loop, variable scope等等，所以要特別小心做，有啲伏位，不過時間好充裕

Final要諗多啲嘢，題目複雜啲，特別係L-system會比mid term複雜好多，都係要小心做，時間都係幾充裕

midterm同final都係open book/notes，佢仲會俾一份簡而精的note，print呢份入去考就夠

mid term mean左右
assignment 兩份滿分
final 1.2 sd above mean
0 bonus lecture point
grade A
reviews.comment_workload:
有兩份assignment要做，一個係L-system，一個係食鬼遊戲，lab上會教大部分，跟住佢做就得，自己加少部分code就搞掂。
Mid term 同 final 因爲係 open book，所以冇咩嘢溫。

reviews.author: baboon_x
reviews.title: Wakey wakey boys & gals
reviews.comment_content: Quite easy. After all it's just a common core. Don't expect too much.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Alex, the lecture instructor, would spend 80% of the lecture reading through the slides for the lectures before, and the rest 20% reading the ones for this lecture. The lecture time would be halved if he stops asking 'OK' after every piece of explanation.
Luke, the lab coach, would make some bugs due to typos, and he can't realize that. The lab time can also be halved if he use correction tools like grammarly or what so ever.
Though these instructors are nice guys, the documents can all be found online, and in most time they are just showing you through, so I cannot say this is high-quality teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fine. But never hold the illusion that you can gain the bonus points. Though Alex claims that he picks people randomly, he actually has some preferred seats (I'd say he's never realized that). And every time a bonus question is raised, more than half of the class would raise their hands, but only one single student is lucky enough to be the chosen one.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite small as you can finish assignments in labs.

reviews.author: 黑貓
reviews.comment_content: Quite easy. Teaching basic stuff like for, while, if. The whole course focus on turtle graphic and data handling.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teacher is quite funny and there are videos play in class.
reviews.comment_grading: There are mid-term and final. The mid-term is easy to get full mark but the final is quite tricky. Be careful and you will get at least B range. The 2 assignment are easy to get full mark as the lab will teach you to write most of the part. Even if you have any things unclear, the lab helper will help you to fix it.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite low workload as the assignment are almost done in lab.

reviews.author: Raydomie
reviews.title: Fun animation and games programming
reviews.comment_content: Content was really fun, even though the nature of programming is supposed to be technical, we make games and animation. Not boring at all, attended 100% of the class. A lot to do with visualizing the outcomes from just reading the codes. This is a class for someone who wants to have fun, i guess, because we learnt to use Turtle Graphics instead of industry relevant things like data-mining sort of things. But then again, the basics are all the same, so learning this, you get the idea of how things run.
reviews.comment_teaching: David is really cool, he sounds very sarcastic but in a funny way. Learning environment was great, and engaging. As someone from a business background with almost no programming background at all, he made it easy for me to understand. Class atmosphere was fun, and i could tell that people are actually enjoying the class. There's tons of methods to get to an answer, but he always challenges the class how to cut the lines even shorter, which i thought was really an elegant way of writing codes.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was really straightforward. For lab, it's a bit of work, but hey, if the code runs, and requirements are met, then you get full mark. Quiz and Exam is a bit tricky, because you gotta visualize the outcome just by looking at the code. For example, if you read this code, do you think the program will execute the desired outcome? or Fill in the blanks to make the code work. In the exam i just gave up on 2 questions because i was tired to think. Still got "A-". The mean of the class is about 70/100 at that time
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was okay, the 4 compulsory lab submission was challenging, but the TA Gee would cover everything. Since the lab participation is not compulsory, you don't really need to go. Besides, the instructions given on the assignment is really clear that you could do them yourself.

reviews.author: NaokiR
reviews.title: (Relatively) Good course for students with no programming background
reviews.comment_content:
No attendance requirement (Though bonus points are given in class, which counts toward your final score). I only attended 3 lectures.

The syllabus is fair. Gives you a general impression of what programming feels like. Not so helpful if you have a little programming experience. If you want more challenge, go get COMP1021P or take the C language waiver to start from COMP2011.

Only two assignments, each lasts about two weeks. It wouldn't be too hard if you put time into it even if you're just a beginner. Very detailed program structure was given to students so you can count on that if you need help. Most people were able to get full marks on their assignments.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson is helpful (if you ask him questions within the syllabus. You won't be able to get specific python instructions on your own project.) and kind, and humorous, and cute.

Tutorial sucks. Just don't go. You'll be able to figure it out on your own before the instructor makes his way out of those bugs he writes.
reviews.comment_grading:
You might be able to outperform those students with more programming experience than you.
I strongly suggest that you don't rely on your very helpful docs and IDE all the time, as you would get a hard time eye-balling all bugs when you're in the exam. If you write your code with pretty good style, chances are that you'll be mad about those silly mistakes on the test paper that no human could ever make.
*For this term, the grading policy changed slightly. Mid-term will be considered 10% or 30% in your final score, so you won't be able to skip it and just get a full mark in your final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very little workload if you get yourself a good IDE and enjoy typing, as most assignments are labor work and typist training.

However, you would like to get very familiar with the python module used in class (for this term, the turtle module). This saves you A LOT of time in your final to give you A LOT more time to debug and check your answers rather than referring to your cheatsheet all the time.

reviews.author: 姓楊
reviews.comment_content:
Basic programming stuff, with python 3 programming language.
I studied ICT in DSE, programming elective with pascal programming language and the materials were not hard to me. I never attend any lab or lecture. Just that I did not imagine drawing with turtle function will be a focus in the course.

Doing the assignments, L-system and pacman was also fun. Got enough guidelines from the lab template (which you can get on the course site).
reviews.comment_teaching: My professor was the one with afro-like hair style. His accent was very accurate and "immersive" (I mean this in a positive way). I only attended one lecture to see if I have to attend any though so this is all I can tell you of his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean for the exams is quite high, like 70+, with S.D. of around 10.

Your mid-term score will account for 10% or 30%(not sure) depending on which calculation grants you a higher total mark.

Got 93.4/100 in total, which equals an A. With 1.5 mark more it will be an A+. Sad but nothing I can do now anyway.
reviews.comment_workload:
As I have mentioned the guidelines for assignments are adequate. Complete a few easy requirements for your program and you will easily get full marks (or at least not far from).

Doing the assignments were also quite enjoyable.

reviews.author: HoodieBae
reviews.comment_content: Focuses mainly on turtle graphics, basically, everything revolves around turtle graphics. Then need to incorporate different topics such as lists to turtle to create different images.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teachers were great and energetic. I did not feel bored in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Assignments weren't hard as long as you followed the instructions and went to class. Could get 100% on the assignments as marking scheme was provided.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 2 assignments, midterm and final. Not much work, spent around 6 hours each on the assignments and didn't study much for finals as it was open book.

reviews.author: scarkkk
reviews.title: interesting leng grade course
reviews.comment_content:
basic programming knowledge and skills about python like those if else, looping, class & objects and recursion might be a bit difficult for beginners but since the exam is mainly fill in the blanks and mc so i think you can still manage it.

you will also learn turtle graphic in this course which will be used to draw different pictures and patterns through basic commands or l system
reviews.comment_teaching:
the lecturer explain quite detail and clearly, its easy to understand even without any programming background. he is also very friendly so you can ask any question if you have any
the ppt is very useful toooo
reviews.comment_grading:
assignment 1: 95/100
assignment 2: 100/100
mid-term: 96/100
final: 94/100
grade: A
most ppl manage to get full mark for assignment and mean for exam are around 6x/7x you can decide whether its good grade by yourself loll
reviews.comment_workload:
the only workload is just two assignment most of which was done in the lab so the workload is quite light ya
one of the assignment is making a pacmen game its so cute i love it :D

reviews.author: fannycky
reviews.comment_content: The content is not too difficult. The course teaches basic python language. Students can design their own program, so the course is quite fun for students who love programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor speaks fluent English with a clear explanation by example and exercise.
reviews.comment_grading: Go through all the powerpoint and assignments is enough for examination. The exam examines students' understanding of python but not memorizing skills, so study by using the python program is recommended.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too heavy. Only two assignments per semester and the difficulty is moderate.

reviews.author: Hojin
reviews.comment_content: The content is simple python programming. Even if you don't know programming you will be able easily learn how to program.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is okay. He teaches very well, and is always open questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very reasonable.

Assignment 1 15%
Assignment 2 15%
Midterm 25%
Final 45%

I got hundred in mid-term and two assignments, but got mean on final exam and got B+. I remember the mean being pretty high for assignments and midterm, but final exam was not. This final exam can influence your grade very greatly.
reviews.comment_workload: Depending on your programming skill the amount of time it takes for you to do your assignment may vary, but it does not take over 2 days if you attended all the lab sessions.

reviews.author: TomLing
reviews.title: 靚grade course
reviews.comment_content:
中學有讀過programming嘅話讀呢個course會幾輕鬆, 因為基本concept都掌握左, 我中學讀過ICT, 呢個course 係我最好成績嘅一科。
Content 大概包括 looping, functions, variables, 仲有個python特有嘅turtle graphing。
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢教得還好, 雖然自己睇powerpoint都可以跟倒進度, 不過佢上堂嗰陣都會講啲細節值得留意吓。
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term: 99
Final: 85
有兩個assignment, 有lab會guide住你做, 佢會講做倒啲乜就有幾多分, 基本上慢慢做滿足哂佢啲要求就會有滿分, 最尾個grade 係A-, 佢會俾啲past paper 我地做, 所以肯努力就可以有A range。
reviews.comment_workload: workload 好少, mid term前一份assignment, final 前又一個, 平時係無功課嘅, 係一個好低workload 嘅course。

reviews.author: MarcusLo
reviews.comment_content:
Basic python programming. This course is easy even for beginners with no programming background. The materials become a little bit harder after mid-term if you have no prior programming language.
All ppt used in class will be uploaded on course website.
Content includes python basics, turtle graphics, dictionary, recursion, simple structure of class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear but a bit slow. LAM often spend first 15-30 minutes reviewing the content of the previous lesson. The result is falling behind schedule.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade. Note that the mean of all assignment and tests are high, about 80% ~ 90%.
Notes and books are allowed in tests.
0.4% extra credit will be given to students who correctly answer quetions in class. If you are chosen but you don't know the answer, LAM will help you with it.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload. Only two assignments are graded. The assignments are on adding new features on files of previous labs and there are clear marking scheme for each assignment usually posted on the course website one week before deadline.

reviews.author: Ritakw
reviews.comment_content:
Python programming
1星期兩堂Lecture(1hr each)，一堂lab(2hrs)
唔take attendance
只要認真上堂，睇筆記，就會跟到～
會上堂問問題，答啱有bonus，佔好少percentage
有midterm，final，都係openbook
reviews.comment_teaching:
patient,
解釋好detail,
不過上堂會有啲悶同
進度有啲慢
reviews.comment_grading:
每份assignment 15%
midterm 10%
final 60%
midterm同final有兩種計法，會揀好啲嗰個計grade ^^

assignments mean 9X，可能有source
midterm, final open book, 但相對個mean都會高(midterm 8X, final 6X over 100)

me:
midterm, final above mean 0.2至0.3sd
assignment1 below mean 0.2sd
assignment2 below mean 0.6sd
-> B grade
可參考
reviews.comment_workload:
2份assignments，lab要去，特別有講關assignment事嘅lab，幫你做咗大部分嘅programming，有唔識要問TA
但建議assignment唔好拖到最後1刻，第2份會唔夠時間做

reviews.author: Andy Liu
reviews.comment_content:
--Basic python syntax
-a lot of turtle graphics
(won't be hard in the beginning if you had learned some basic programming languages before)
--L-system and stack
--Files(not easy but also not important,  wasn't tested)
--dictionary(quite important, tested a lot in the final)
--a little taste of Object-Oriented Programming
--a little taste of recursion

Basically, it's a common core course, the topics aren't too hard to learn. You can buy the textbook if you are that kind of learner.
It will be hard for you to get good grades if you think it is that easy.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson is a great professor.  Interact with the students vividly. Going to his class wouldn't be a burden.
Talking with his slides, but sometimes he'll adjust the code a little bit to make it more interesting.

Labs are very useful for your assignment. And the professor answers your questions online very quickly.
Just ask if you meet any problems on the slides or in your assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
bonus mark: answer the question in class will earn 0.4% each time
15% assignment1
15% assignment2
25% midterm (open book)
45% final (open book)
(or 10% midterm, 60% final ->encourage you to work harder if you are not familiar with computer science and do badly on midterm)
the professor will help you calculate the better one.

grading is good
I got full marks on both assignments, 98 on the midterm, and 94 on the final. => get an A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Although there are two assignments, you can earn 75% of the grades just attend the lab and follow professor's instructors.  The rest would be a little challenging, but wouldn't be devastating.
Apart from the assignment, you don't need to spend too much time review the notes if you go to class and follow Gibson.

reviews.author: XUYANBO
reviews.comment_content: As an introduction level course,1021 shows basic knowledge of programing.Also python is not as difficult as java. Assignments are fun to do. After taking the course it would be easier to learn other programing language.
reviews.comment_teaching: It's actually enough by looking though notes by yourself but the lab sessions are rather important because it teach you how to implement those knowledge you have learnt.
reviews.comment_grading: Being careful enough will get you A range.
reviews.comment_workload: There is little work load as there are only 2 assignments and no quiz and homework.

reviews.author: LouiseCarocy
reviews.comment_content: The content was interesting and useful, mainly about basic python knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is fine and you can watch lecture videos. The teacher is always willing to help and is friendly and kind.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is a little bit unfair for me because I did quite good on midterms, assignments. But I did terribly bad on my final so my grade is really bad. That makes me feel that my effort was all gone.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy for me, especially for the second assignment. You have to spend lots of time checking and thinking where went wrong.

reviews.author: elwc
reviews.title: Jeng Course Must Take
reviews.comment_content:
由淺入手，會教 python programming ge基本知識，例如decision, loop etc.
會結合python turtle教，只係寫program黎畫畫
個人認為midterm前齋睇notes都會明

midterm後內容會深入少少
dictionary, data type, recursion, object...

無programming底的話唔建議走lab / midterm後lecture

A+

Assignment One 100/100
Assignment Two 100/100

Overall係靚grade
reviews.comment_workload:

而之後亦都會有充足時間比你做埋剩低ge部份

但係兩者都係open book
就算溫書都唔洗死記，最緊要清楚明白concept就包無死

reviews.author: Aimme
reviews.title: 好龜課，比較簡單
reviews.comment_content:
Python入門，對我這種計算機小白非常友好了
教的東西都很簡單
reviews.comment_teaching:
講課基本照slides念，自己看也可以，不過平時上課最後會有一些bonus題目，都是考點，所以建議聽課
一不小心翹課太多就會發現有很多slides要看……
教授很可愛，跟我們吐槽來科大工作後長的啤酒肚XD
reviews.comment_grading:
grade神
拿A+要確保接近滿分，因爲這課上的人還是比較多的，不過大部人都是A range，考好一點都有A了（90左右）還是比較容易的
考試是開卷的，可以自己帶東西，不過上課的slides有很多，所以final一定要留時間出來好好整理！！！
順便本人final 100/100，吹一波我自己
reviews.comment_workload:
沒有作業，兩個assignment加midterm和final
輕鬆啦

reviews.author: DWVoid
reviews.title: A Mixed Feeling about this course
reviews.comment_content: To be honest, this is the part which I personally as a student who have some background in programming have a mixed feeling about. The content itself is interesting, really, but you will only enjoy the content as much as I do if you do not struggle with the it. I can see that some really effort must have been put into selecting those interesting interactive examples which demonstrates what you can do by coding, but as far as I can tell, some of them are too complicated for new programmers to understand. Just like the final assignment a 500+LOC simple game which requires some serious planning job is just too much for some new learners to do on their own
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is really a very passionate instructor, which made the experience of this course really pleasant. I will not comment on how efficient the content was delivered during the course since I basically learned the python needed for the course just after an long afternoon in the library when I get the textbook, but if you have to take the course, I personally recommend Gibson over all other instructors.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fine. For the 2018-2019 fall semester, there is only 2 programming assignments and two exams, as long as you can use python and pay very close attention to the details of the requirements, you will do fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Fine for students who can write simple programming without much struggling, no matter if you have relative background knowledge or you are a really good learner (actually much lighter than MATH if you falls in this cat). Otherwise it might be a nightmare, since you might easily spend hours on some errors and have no progress at all.

reviews.author: 2020survivor
reviews.title: Good effort contributes a lot
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Python:
if/while/for/def/class/...

Library:
Mainly turtle
reviews.comment_teaching:
Follows lecture notes carefully. (very easy for students to follow)
Smart students can finish this course through self-studying the whole semester.
Tends to review previous lecture's content at the beginning of every class, which is sth I really appreciate.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you're aiming for supreme grades, such as A+/A, be very careful of the assignments and the final exams! You could fall hard if you make any tiny mistakes and end up getting mediocre grades.

A-/B+ are relatively easy to achieve for those who had put adequate effort into this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not light, but just the right amount to have a basic understanding of Python.

Personally, I consider the assignments interesting and rewarding while accomplishing them. Hope you would also enjoy!

reviews.author: Explode muscle
reviews.title: Good grade COMP intro course, must take
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Python programming skills

- if else condition
- loop
- function
- turtle graphics
- stack, list, tuple
- dictionary
- file handling
- object
- recursion
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor is very humorous and nice, he gives detailed explanation of course content with good examples, very easy to understand. You won't find it boring in lecture. If you have a bit of basic programming skill before, you might find the teaching pace is quite slow. The teaching pace kinda speeds up after the mid-term.

There are also online lecture video on the COMP website for revision purpose. It is ok to skip lecture and just study the lecture notes but sometimes there is a bonus question each lecture asked by the instructor and you can get a bonus 0.4% mark.

Lab is useful for your assignments and you can try stuff from what you have learnt in lecture. Lab content is on the COMP website, so it is ok to skip.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two grading system and will take the highest one:
Assignment 1 L-system 15%
Assignment 2 Pacman game 15%
Mid-term 10%
Final 60%
or
Assignment 1 L-system 15%
Assignment 2 Pacman game 15%
Mid-term 25%
Final 45%

Assignment 1 100%
Assignment 2 100%
Mid-term 92/100
Final 84/100
2 bonus question: 0.8%
Total: 91.6%
Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Very little, only 2 assignments
Assignment 1 L-system is very easy, Assignment 2 Pacman game is a bit hard
This course requires you to fully understand the logic instead of pure memorization. Mid-term and final are actually easy but very very tricky. It is very easy to get A range if you understand all the course content but you need to be very very careful if you want to aim for A+.

reviews.author: Justin Li
reviews.title: Easy class for Engineering Students
reviews.comment_content: Very basic knowledge and concepts on Python programming. Focused a lot on the turtle graphics package. The Python language itself is easy to interpret, so this course is comparatively easier than COMP1022P and COMP1022Q.
reviews.comment_teaching: Give nice and very detailed explanation of course content. Good sense of humor and enjoys teaching the class. Only drawback for fast-learning students is that he teaches quite slowly by always revising the old stuff. It makes it very easy to catch up (In case you missed lectures, or if you are not as good) though.
reviews.comment_grading: Not harsh, not difficult to reach A range but course mean is generally high. The assignments have very clear marking schemes so you can easily expect your grade even before you submit your work. Exams however contains some tricky questions so make sure you revise your stuff thoroughly before taking it.
reviews.comment_workload: Low workload. The lectures and labs aren't compulsory, as long as you know your stuff. The two assignments requires more work and you may find some labs useful for it, so don't skip all of them. Mid-term and final exam are open book so organize your notes properly can be greatly beneficial. You still have to revise before exam so don't slack off because it's an easy course.

reviews.author: lllllllllllllll
reviews.title: Good Introductory Course for Beginners in Python
reviews.comment_content:
For a beginners programming python course, the course covers a lot of content. (ex. class and recursion)

No required textbook, but I would say the textbook is really helpful for beginners. Many of the examples are covered in the lectures, and there are exercise questions for you to try. The course will cover all the content in the textbook.

CH 1 : Introduction to Python
CH 2 : Basic Turtle Graphics Programming
CH 3 : Comments, Variables and Text
CH 4 : Variable Types and Operators
CH 5 : Making Decisions
CH 6 : Looping
CH 7 : Finding Repeating Patterns
CH 8 : Lists, Tuples and Strings
CH 9 : Functions
CH 10 : Dictionaries
CH 11 : More on Turtle
CH 12 : Turtle Window Event Handling
CH 13 : File Handling
CH 14 : Programming with Objects
CH 15 : Recursion

Personally, the content in the last 2 chapters were the most challenging
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very approachable and willing to answer any and all questions that students have at the end of class. Although the class pace may seem to be fast at first (since he speaks very fast), he will do lots of revision at the start of each class which helps you remind the concepts and content learned in the previous lecture.

The lectures are recorded, so eve if you miss a lecture, you can still watch it later.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading seems to be reasonable. Even if you don't do well not the mid-term, the professors will balance it so that the final weights more toward your grade (and vice-versa). However, there are many students in the course with prior experience in programming that will make very few mistakes in the exams, hence the s.d. is really high.

Mid-term (10%/25%): mean = 76.2/100, s.d. = 20.6

Final Examinations (60%/45%) : mean = 64/100, s.d. = 24.6

Assignment 1 (15%): mean = 90.5, s.d. = 25.9, max = 100, min = 5

Assignment 2 (15%): mean = 92.0, s.d. = 27.2, max = 100, min = 10
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is average, only 2 mandatory assignments, but it is recommended to go through the examples in the lecture slides.

Many people say that the course has light workload, but if you have not done a lot of programming before (like me), the 2 assignments can take up a lot of time - especially the second assignment (creating a Pacman Game)

The professors frequently asks some questions based on lecture content that can earn you bonus marks. Just review the lecture slides, and this should be ok.

reviews.author: Never Social
reviews.title: I want to pick CS cuz I studied this.
reviews.comment_content:
Move over to the other post for detailed course overview.
Python, basic concepts that are common for all languages: loops, variable declaration, logical operator etc.
Turtle module is introduced before loops. Its a graphical output thingy, wise pick as it helps us visualize our codes.
Deepest we went is recursion, I remember a corresponding exam question being you have to figure out a code that reverts a string.

You can also use the lecture notes for different comp course like 2011etc. Once you know the address for 1021 you'll figure it out.

2 projects (generating a tree, pacman), you have more then enough material, support, and time to prep it.
mt, finals: bring any non-electronic materials in.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The internet is your textbook.
I didn't attend the lectures after some while. Better read the ppt and build the codes in my own pace.
DL some other IDE for use, the default one sucked.

Don't expect the lab TA to figure out your careless mistakes in the laboratory sessions. They sure have knowledge but they aren't fully prepped for the lab session. (I don't think they should).
reviews.comment_grading:
Even if you don't have coding background, if you have good logic then you gucci, just read the codes line by line and understand what is going on.

Midterm 25%, Assignments 30%, Final exam 45% OR
Midterm 10%, Assignments 30%, Final exam 60%,  picked in your favor.
Ah! And bonus lecture points for the lucky one who answers question in lecture. But hey! Can you compete with those over-excited spring-loaded-armed individuals who gets the answer wrong but somehow the lecturer makes it sound right?
Mid-term 98/100 (and I thought I was good until the prof said 16 or so gets full)
Both labs, final full.
A+
reviews.comment_workload:
I do believe that time is required if you wish to git gud.

I never have so much fun revising the course material, even managed to use text manipulation techniques to make a database on a game I was playing with its wiki lol.

reviews.author: pitterweasel
reviews.comment_content:
Content is good for an introduction to programming and covers all of the basic concepts.

Content consists almost entirely of a series of PowerPoints (which happen to be available on the course website so lecture attendance is unnecessary). For those with any programming background at all, looking through the slides every so often is good enough to completely understand the course content.

Some of the concepts and techniques needed for completion of the assignments are introduced during the labs, but these materials are also available online and very easy to follow.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures: Teaching is very slow (perhaps understandably so) and doesn't stray far from the PowerPoint slides. (I personally gave up on attending lectures after a week or two).

Labs: Better.
reviews.comment_grading:
Someone else will have posted the exact weightings (I don't remember them) but the main thing to note here is that your midterm grade is ignored and your final grade's weighting increased appropriately if your final grade would benefit from this. This means if the exam style catches you off guard during the midterm, you can remedy it for the final and it'll be as if it never happened.

Some of the exam questions give you part of a program and several blanks and ask you to fill them in to get a certain output. The questions in general are not difficult per se but can be tricky, so it's worth looking closely and thinking carefully about them and checking your steps if you have time at the end.

As for the two assignments: their weighting is significant and most people do very well, so make sure to follow the markscheme/spec very closely.
reviews.comment_workload: The only thing you have to do is two assignments, and these won't take very long at all if you've been following with the labs (which basically take you halfway through each already) and are familiar with the concepts introduced during lectures and labs. Going over the PowerPoints before the midterm and the final should be enough for preparation.
