reviews.comment_grading:
Open note for both midterm and final.
You can get a bonus for answering question during lecture.
reviews.comment_workload:
Little workload
50% of assignments is done during the lab and the rest is quite simple
Even if you have any questions, TA will help you.

reviews.author: shittycourse
reviews.comment_content: Basic programming skill e.g. for loop, while loop, if-else. Easy to follow even you know nothing about programming. It's a nice beginner course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor tries to give you a lot of humorous examples to explain the logic. Also, he is willing to answer students' questions after lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm is relatively easy but final is tough. Most of the students get high marks in their assignments.
Overall the grading is fantastic.
reviews.comment_workload:
midterm, final, two assignments ,labs

you can choose whether attend the labs or not. But it's recommended to attend labs since some of the labs are highly related to the assignments.

reviews.author: kus
reviews.title: Easy if you have basic programming knowledge
reviews.comment_content:
simple programming knowledge
Use python as the teaching language
.file I/O
.frame control
.simple input output
.loop(for/while)
.decision making(if)
reviews.comment_teaching:
humorous instructor
no attendance
step-by-step teaching in lab session
unnecessary to take any lab if you have programming background (even a little is okay)
reviews.comment_grading: good grade if you have logic
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignment
.L-system
.self-design game
1 mid-term(optional)
.won't calculate the mark if you didn't attain or (fail) and all your grade weighting will be on final and assignment
1 final

reviews.author: spiderbottle
reviews.comment_content:
It include Python programming skills
I think the content has a little bit of difficulty since I have no background for the coding. The textbook may not help too much because there are usually no problem solving steps. You should take your own time to practice more because there are many kinds of coding even for the same problem (I think it is easy to get confuse for those who have not background).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Lam is funny but his speech is a bit faster. He tried to explain every concept clearly and he was willing to answer doubts.
Both lectures and labs do not need to take the attendance.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are:
one mid-term exam which is open book/note exam for 1 hrs.
two assignments.
one final exam which is open book/note exam for 2.5 hrs.

There provide two calculation method for weighting, just take the higher one to be your final marks:
1. midterm 20%, assignments 40% (20% for each), final  40%
2. midterm 0%, assignments 40% (20% for each), final  60%
reviews.comment_workload:
It is light workload

only two of assignments you need to submit
the labs section is useful for you to understand the concept more and figure out the assignment (part of the assignments will be taught and the TA will give you some hints during labs lessons).

only one midterm and one final exam (if you want to get good grade, don't ignore the midterm although you have two choices of grading method).

reviews.author: vikychoi
reviews.title: <3 gibson
reviews.comment_content:
Easy course
Python is easy to understand and easy to manage
Mainly about:
Basic concept of data type, operators, input and output, loops
turtle graphics
file handling
function
recursion
a bit of object-oriented programing(just the basic idea, you don't have to actually code with it)
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course materials are well organized.
My lecturer is also very friendly and usually stays after lessons to answer questions. He gives very interestingly lesson by giving demonstrations in the course.
Gibson's lecture was not boring and actually quite interesting. You won't be bored during his lesson, so do attend his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good
You can get a bonus for answering questions during lecture.
i have got:
88% in mid term
95% and 100% in 2 assignments with 4 % bonus
90% in final
resulted in A+
reviews.comment_workload:
1 mid-term (easy, aim for 100%, but if u messed it up, you will still be fine as it can be neglected if it is lower than final)
2 assignment (pretty easy as the lab section would provide sufficient support)
1 final (The final was quite hard and actually needs a clear understanding of the topics instead of memorizing the codes)

reviews.author: Juho Jeon
reviews.title: COMP1021 is a good beginner programming course
reviews.comment_content: The content is fairly easy. Even if you are 100% beginner, you will be able to understand the concepts easily.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is very slow and managed for beginners. If you are bad at programming, the lab and the courses will help you a lot.
reviews.comment_grading: The special part of this course is that your mid term mark could be 0% of your final score if your final term grade is higher. This means that if you are straight beginner and screwed up mid term scores, there is no worries because you can learn until final term and get a better grade in final.
reviews.comment_workload: Work load is very less. There is no daily homeworks. Your only workload is review for the tests, and two assignments. One assignment is L-system program (you will know when you take this course), and another is python game that looks like Space Invader. Both assignments are fairly easy, and half of the assignment will be easily done by going to the lab. So there is not so much work load for this course. Plus, there is no attendance for lab and courses.

reviews.author: double
reviews.title: Be aware of those evil question
reviews.comment_content:
This course is mainly about basic programming knowledge.
Half of the lesson talked about turtle in python, while the remaining part is the basic part of python. That's all -- nothing more.

If you have learnt programming (especially oop), this course would be quite simple as most of the content is very very simple -- not even mentioned about inheritance.

still, don't under estimate this course as the exam is quite difficult. There are sooooooo many traps in the questions, and mid term exam is a chance for you to understand how evil they are. It is similar to those questions in dse, except in relatively shorter way.

No attendance, no quiz, no everything except assignment, just all in final and fail the course hahaa(just kidding i am sorry)
reviews.comment_teaching:
I won't say it is very bad, though I always felt sleepy in the lesson.( Maybe that's my fault :P)
My professor is LAM, Ngok. During the lesson not much interest things was taught. He simply explain the code function and taught us how the program work. (While I just understand these things from the book before I take the lesson).
To those who never learnt programming before I think he is still a good lecturer, just maybe a bit boring if you already understand what's going on.

(oh btw the tutor is not here anymore )
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade maybe not be as good as your expectation.

I make a small mistake and it cost me like 20 marks, and my mid term is below mean.(the mean is like sixty-something.)

The grade is compose by two part: assignment and exam.
For assignment, there are in total 2 assignment to do.
for exam, It can be either midterm + final or final only, take the highest marks in these two different ways.

Final:
Mean: 54/100
Sd: 2X
my score: 96/100

mid-term:
mean: 64.8/100
Sd: (forgot)
my score: 62

two assignment both get 100 mark, get A+
reviews.comment_workload:
littllllllle workload
even if you miss alllllll lab section, it is easy to get a satisfactory mark by only using two hour (of course only if you understand the content)

reviews.author: Kennychan1998
reviews.comment_content: Basic Python programming skills
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite good. The professor is teaching in a quite slow pace. Though those who already got the basics of programming may feel bored and wanted to proceed quicker
Thr professer is willing to help on students' questions and the course materials are more than than adequate
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good
The exams are not that difficult so it should be difficult to drow below B range
There are in class quizzes to raise the score, the questions are rather easy and direct so just raise your hand for the chance if you are confidemt enough
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments there
However most of the parts are done in labs
Hints will be given on challenging parts
Should not be too time consuming

reviews.author: Angus Chang
reviews.title: Basic programming course with good grade
reviews.comment_content:
This course discusses basic stuff about Python 3.6. Including basic syntax (e.g. write,input),iteration statement(for-loop,while-loop),selection statement(if-then-else),l-system,precedence and recursion. It is quite easy and if you pay attention to the course you should be good to go. If you have programming background this should be an easy course.

Highly recommend to all student who studies ICT (elective D) in secondary school to take this course. It should be very easy to you since the knowledge in Pascal/other language other than Java (Just study 1022P if you learn Java before) can somewhat translate into Python (though not all of them). Some new stuff (e.g. recursion, l-system) may be harder to understand but if you put attention on the lecture and have some revision, you should be good to go.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, Mr. Lam's teaching is quite boring. Especially to someone who knows programming to a certain extent. His English is quite clear and you can understand him quite easily. But he spends a lot of time explaining stuff that is actually very easy. This makes his lecture a bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
Mid-term:20%
Final:40%
Assignment: 40% (2 * 20%)

Or

Final 60%
Assignment: 40% (2 * 20%)
(if you mid-term exam will lower your grade)

My Score:
Mid-term: 82/100
Final: 92/100
Assignment 1: 100/100
Assignment 2: 100/100
Total: 95.2/100 (using second grading method)
Grade: A+

The exams and assignment are not difficult (except final exam, which is considerably harder than mid-term exam). You just need to take some time to work on them. Also, both exam is open book, so there shouldn't be much trouble on the exam. There will also be a set of revision notes provided before final exam(can be brought into final exam of course) so you can put all your effort in the final exam even if you failed in the mid-term exam.

But since this course is quite an easy course, the mean is also very high. You will need a high mark to get into A-range (~>90). Getting full marks on assignments are essential since they are quite easy. There will also be lab sections where you just work on the assignment, you ask the TA for help when you face any problems or difficulties.

The lecturer will also ask questions during lessons. If you answer them correctly (which, you should because the lecturer will help you even if you aren't quite sure about the answer), you will get some extra mark that will contribute to your assignment marks. (You can't get higher than full marks, this is only useful if you can't get full marks in the assignment)
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.
2 assignments which are some programs.(Drawing pictures using l-system, Python space invader)
2 open book exam.
There shouldn't be much trouble for you if you manage your time well.

Good luck to everyone who wants to take this course.

reviews.author: Siya
reviews.title: Great course
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is fairly not that difficult, especially if you have a background of basic coding. As long as your basics are clear, you shouldn't have much problem with the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Lam is an excellent teacher. He ensures that the entire class is involved and is quite hilarious. He explains everything very clearly and is open to any questions/doubts.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite fair. Although the exam papers might be a little tough.
reviews.comment_workload: There are two assignments in the entire duration of the course along with a mid term exam and a final exam. The mid term exam is not compulsory and is not counted if you perform better in the final exam.

reviews.author: Jen Chung
reviews.comment_content: Basic Python programming content. If, for and while loops, functions, basic turtle graphics, l-systems.. etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Try to go for Gibson's lectures even if you are not enrolled in his class. He does much better lectures and you usually will not feel like falling asleep.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good transparency. They give you all your grades including all the statistics.

Assignments are very easy and are worth 40% of your final grade in total so make sure you get as high as possible on them. Mean for assignments is usually around 90-93%.

Midterms: 20%
Finals: 40%

In the case of you scoring better on final exam than on your midterm, the final grade will be worth 60% instead while midterm will not count towards your final grade. So if you do badly on your midterm, you can still all in the finals and get into the A range.

1 SD above mean is about an A-
Mean is about B
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments, 1 midterm, and 1 final exam.

The workload is relatively manageable.

They usually give you several weeks to work on each assignment, but try not to do everything last minute, as you want some time to double-check everything and make sure you get that high % for you assignments.

reviews.author: llllll

reviews.author: Patrick.K
reviews.title: A good beginning course for programming.
reviews.comment_content: Easy to understand if attending all lessons. Just some basic knowledge of python. Examples used in lesson are available for reference in course web.
reviews.comment_teaching: A bit bored, but the instructor is nice and willing to answer questions after the lessons. He will overrun almost every lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: Not bad, for myself, midterm a bit higher than mean, final below half sd, full marks in both assignments = B.
reviews.comment_workload: Two assignments together with midterm and final. Assignments are easy if you attend labs. Labs are VERY VERY VERY IMPORTANT for your assignments. Final is a bit hard, required more revision.

reviews.author: kevinho
reviews.comment_content: Basic python programming taught through turtle graphics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Interesting and fun, easy to follow with lots of examples, slides are easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good, can get into A-range easily, a bit harder for A+ but certainly achievable. Midterm is easy and Final is a bit more challenging.
reviews.comment_workload:
No attendance, 2 assignments which took me about 4 hours each.
The assignment is an L-system project and a game project. Grading schemes were released so you could check your program yourself and fix all the possible bugs. Easy to get full marks.

reviews.author: Joseph Lam
reviews.comment_content:
Python 3 + turtle library built in python
If you know programming, this is a pretty easy course. If you don't, it is easy for you to learn some basic programming concepts.

There are some basic programming knowledge:
- if/ else
- while/ for
- variable type
- function
- recursion
- basic class (OOP)
etc.

There are 2 assignment:
Assignment 1 is about L-system. your program should draw an appropriate picture. All the technical and math stuff are given and the only thing you need to do is implement those things into your program.

Assignment 2 is making a shooting game. It is a bit challenging but there is enough time for you to do
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is very interesting in Gibson class. He often uses some funny way to talk about the programming concepts.
If you ask him questions, he can explain to you very well.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very good.
If the midterm result is not good, it will automatically exclude. I'm one of the examples.
it is easy to get A-range if you know programming.

2 Assignment - 20% each
Midterm - 20%
Final - 40%
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very low, basically, there are only two assignment and they are not difficult at all. If you are careful enough and follow the lab instructions, you can easily get a full mark.

reviews.author: zlong
reviews.comment_content: It's all about giving you a basic idea of how to use Python. There are 2 assignments in total with a midterm (optional) and a final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lam Ngok is nice and he is always willing to answer our questions. He explains quite clearly and slowly to make sure you understands. He will ask questions at the end of the class and if you can get the correct answer, you can get extra marks added to your assignment.
reviews.comment_grading:
For people who have programming background, this course might be easy. But for people with no programming background and weak with logical thinking, both final and mid-term will be tough.
My assignment 1, midterm and final are below mean half a SD but I still get into B range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment 1 is about L-system which is to draw some pictures.
Assignment 2 is about a shooting game.
Many hints are provided in the lab session and you only have to add some features base on the lab work. So that the assignments are not that difficult.
Mid-term is optional. If you score higher in the final, the mid-term result will not be used to count your final grade.
Final and mid-term are both open book, open notes. No memorization is required.

reviews.author: Aaliya
reviews.comment_content: The whole course is focused towards turtle graphics using python, which in my opinion doesn't really help when it comes to showing your expertise in the subject. Good course for programming beginners I guess.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, never went for a single lecture after the second week of the semester. The lecture slides and the book are enough for learning all the contents of the course. The professor was okay, but went too slow for someone who has programming background from before.
reviews.comment_grading:
2 Assignments - 20% each
Mid-term - 20%
Final exam - 40%

Assignments are the easiest to score in as both of them are based on the labs so make sure you attend all labs.
reviews.comment_workload: Easily manageable.

reviews.author: Lucian
reviews.comment_content: It is quite easy if you have the experience of programming. If not , take it easy!  You could handle it if   spending a little time!
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is a humorous teacher because he could read the PPT while making up so many funny stories. He is also very considerate. You could feel free to ask any questions related to this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very considerate grading way
First assignment                    20%
Middle Exam                          20%   （0%）
Second assignment               20%
Final Exam                            40%   （60%）
This course could not care your middle exam if your middle score is not ideal then make the final exam score take up a more important status.

A friendly Reminder:
Be careful on your assignment !!!!!!!!!
I didn't care it , although i got a quite high score in the final exam , i just get  A  QAQ
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.
You could read the ppt on your own in advance so that you could decide whether you come to the lab (lecture) or not.

reviews.author: Zori
reviews.title: An easy, good-grade course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is the basic knowledge of Python for beginners, such as the for loops, the L system, functions, recursions and so on.
The content is super-easy for anyone with programming experience, acceptable for students with no programming background, such as me. The material given from the website is also adequate enough for students to understand well of the lectures.
There's basically no attendance requirement in this class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pro. Lam will explain almost every detail of the class in every lecture , which sometimes makes the lecture a bit of boring because he sometimes spends pretty much time on a tiny point, and will spend around 5-15 minutes going through the last lecture, depending on the difficulties.
He will also usually try to find some videos relevant to Python program before the lecture.
However, he is very patient and friendly to students, indeed. He would love to answer any question from student within or after the class.
reviews.comment_grading: The distribution is the higher grade of "40% assignments + 20% midterm + 40% final" or "40% assignments + 60% final".
reviews.comment_workload:
There's no homework but only 2 assignments in the class. So the workload is low on the whole.
It's practical to do some extra exercise in the textbook to have a better handling of the class.

reviews.author: 科大CS(ChiSin)佬
reviews.title: 靚grade course
reviews.comment_content:
好基本嘅programming, 有冇接觸過programming都好容易學。
比較難嘅得recursion, 其他有上lecture有做lab就會明。

lecture notes全部放晒上網，而且Mid-term同Final都係open note，考Mid-term/Final之前更加會有Revision note同埋Code list俾你，連自製note嘅時間都慳返。
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture其實都係讀ppt同講解Example，無咩特別。而Lab session就俾你做lab exercise(唔使交)同assignment嘅，但係就唔計attendance，都係預你用嚟問唔明嘅野。
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term 係可考可唔考，如果Mid-term分高過Final嘅話，Mid-term就計20%，Final計40%。如果Final高分啲就唔計Mid-term分，即係Final計60%，Mid-term唔計分。
兩個Assignment就各佔20%
以我為例

Assignment 2 100/100 (20%)
Mid-term 88/100 (0%)

Overall 94%  有A+

佔分嘅得兩個Assignments(Mid-term前後各一) 同埋Mid-term+Final
好輕鬆

reviews.author: AStar
reviews.title: COMP1021
reviews.comment_content:
Python:
Basic input and output functions
Random numbers

Use of range(), len()
Operators
if, while, for
Function
Recursion

Objects

reviews.author: Think
reviews.comment_content: Content was great and easy to understand. The lecture notes are very self explanatory and it is all you need to study for the final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good, passionate, and straight to the point. Answers all questions and explains very thoroughly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good.
Mt 20%
assignment 1 20%
assignment 2 20%
Final 40%

If you work hard, you’ll get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. Labs are easy, assignments require some effort to think of ways to write maybe three-four lines of code, but not too hard. No attendance, so there’s no great need to be in class.

reviews.author: asto
reviews.title: A good, must-take basic programming course
reviews.comment_content:
Basic programming based on Python version 3.6
Content includes: (NOT in time order!)
1. Preparation (register for CSD account, set up Python, etc.)
2. Basic “Grammar” i.e. Syntax you should follow
3. Usage of Python turtle graphics (Basic drawing commands, EVENT HANDLING)
3. Loops (For, While)
4. Collections of data (list, tuple, dictionary)
5. Handling of those “collections” (access by index, slice notation, add/remove/reverse, etc.)
6. Data types and conversion (integer, float, string, etc.)
7. File handling (Read, Write, FORMATTED OUTPUT)
  7.1 String handling (Strip, Slice)
8. Functions (Creating, Calling w/ arguments)
  8.1 Global/Local variables
  8.2 Special: Event handling functions for turtle graphics
9. Basic Classes (Aka. Object-oriented programming) (Creating instance, interaction)
10. Basic Recursion (Recursion depth, judge what a recursion can do)

Note: No MIDI related stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No attendance.

Gibson is a great instructor. Lectures are always fun and you can learn a lot. Never miss lectures.

He is helpful and willing to answer questions after lecture, in either English or Cantonese (But not Putonghua sorry...)

Labs are basically programming exercise, since I rarely attend them I can’t say much.

Lecture notes and Lab notes will be provided, no lecture video. But rarely will lectures teach something out of the note, so as the lab. Even in assignment labs (labs to give you some tips and help you finish the assignment), all the code provided in the lab will be in the note too, so don’t worry much if you skip it (Though I do NOT advise you to do so, since you can’t be sure to understand everything by just looking at the notes)
reviews.comment_grading:
Great. A+ at the end.

If midterm score > final score:
Assignment 1/2 20% each
Midterm 20%
Final 40%

If not:
Assignment 1/2 20% each
Final 60%
Midterm IGNORED

Personally: (All means exclude zeros)
Assignment 1/2 95/100, mean @90+
Midterm 85, mean@67, +0.8sd
Final 90, mean@53.9, +1.4sd
Assignment bonus +2 (If you answer quizzes correctly in lectures, you get 2 bonus/time. Gibson will pick only one person/quiz)
Overall %=197*0.2+90*0.6=93.4 A+
Midterm will cover everything taught before midterm, and final will cover everything. Be sure to review thoroughly before exam, don’t miss anything taught.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.
Only 2 assignments to do. NO ANY OTHER STUFF (Though you should review lol)
Assignment 1 L-Systems, create a program that can draw some patterns based on the input
Assignment 2 Game Project, create a silly game
As said before, there are labs that will help you do these assignments, but codes provided in the lab will also be present in the note, you can copy them. But surely you should do some further work before finishing the assignment, which will typically take 2-3 hours each.
But in all, very very light workload! 3*2=6 guys.

reviews.author: 阿賢
reviews.title: 好grade
reviews.comment_content: 好多人講左.
reviews.comment_teaching:
我上Gibson既堂既, 佢教書語速快, 流暢, 識搞笑.
但溫書既時間有問題, send左email比Gibson 同 lam Ngok, Gibson係完全龜速回email,有一次更加無覆到我既問題. 而 lam Ngok 就好快覆.
reviews.comment_grading:
好grade
但強調一樣野, 千奇唔好比朋友抄功課!!
一比Gibson發現就即刻 0分.
如果你要抄功課都要改足variables, structure 同logic,
否則後果自負.
reviews.comment_workload: 少workload

reviews.author: Stan1ey
reviews.title: Content is good but really hard in the final exam
reviews.comment_content:
The content is the basic grammar and the structure of how to use Python.
In this course, you will understand the data structure such as stack or class.
More about this course can look through the other comment, I don't want to copy and paste :)
But the final paper is pretty hard, if the paper writer is Gibson. There are some traps that you need to justify. Also, you need to understand the whole language to get a high mark in the final exam
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson is a good instructor as he is a quite funny person. You will not get bored when attempting his lesson. On his lesson, sometimes he won't follow the example in the slide but slightly modify the code to become another work.
It is much interesting than those who just follow the powerpoint and read through it.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is good in comparising to those which mean is within C range.
The grading system is pretty simple,
20% for each assignments(2 in total)
20% in the midterm exam
40% in the final exam
Noted that if you can get a higher score in the final exam, your midterm exam won't be counted. In this situation, the percentage of the final exam will become 60%.
That's why I get very low mark in the midterm exam(below about 1SD), but a above mean 0.6 SD in the final exam and get full in two assignments,
I get a B, which is pretty good.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy as you need to hand in two assignments only in the whole semster.
One is about L-system, and another is Space Invaders.
Half of the code will be provide in the Lab so it is pretty easy to follow.
Also, if you really don't know how to do the assignment, the Lab's TA are able to help you to solve and answer your question so a lot of people can get full on it.

reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is one of the better lecturers at UST, his lessons are not boring and he explains every concept very clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:

Assignment 1 (20%)
Mean: 91.8
Standard Deviation: 18.1
My score: 100

Final (40%)
Mean: 53.9
Standard Deviation: 25.1
My score: 64

Assignment 2 (20%)
Mean: 90.9
Standard Deviation: 27.65
My score: 100

My grade: B+

* If it helps with your final grade, your 20% weighting from midterm will be allocated to final, i.e. 0% midterm, 60% final
reviews.comment_workload:
Labs cover 70% of the assignments so you don't need a lot of time after lessons to finish them. Both exams are open-book so don't waste time memorizing everything. However, I would advise people making their own cheat sheet rather than printing all the materials from Gibson, as you won’t have time to find the relevant info during the exams. It will be much better if you remember where did you put your stuff on your own cheat sheet.

Assignments are VERY IMPORTANT. I didn’t perform very well on the exams and my assignments help a lot on my grade. You will have more than enough time to do the assignments so make sure you test your program again and again, getting a full mark will help you a lot.

reviews.author: ptrknow
reviews.title: Easy contents are NO guarantee of easy exams and good grades
reviews.comment_content:
Note that the contents of this course vary from year to year, or maybe from semester to semester.

Python part:
1. Text input and output / Variables
2. if-else statements / nested-if
3. while loops / for loops / nested loops
4. Data structure: List and Tuples
5. Lindenmayer System (L-system)
6. Data structure: Stack
7. Functions
8. Operators and Data types
9. Data structure: Dictionary
10. File Handling
11. Objects
12. Recursion

Turtle Graphics part:
1. Moving and Drawing commands (turtle.up, turtle.forward, turtle.left, turtle.circle, etc.)
2. Commands to handle colours (turtle.color, turtle.colormode, etc.)
3. Filling commands (turtle.begin_fill, turtle.end_fill)
4. Text Input and Output commands (turtle.write, turtle.textinput, etc.)
5. Commands to control visibility (turtle.hideturtle.etc.)
6. Commands to control shape (turtle.shape, turtle.addshape, etc.)
7. Commands to control screen update (turtle.tracer, turtle.update)
8. Window setup command (turtle.mode, turtle.setup, etc.)
9. Event handling commands (turtle.onclick, turtle.ontimer, etc.)
10. Others (turtle.width, turtle.speed, turtle.Turtle, etc.)

The contents are quite easy, as long as you are willing to go through all the given notes thoroughly. Unlike COMP 1022P or Q, this course puts some stress on introducing the basics of computer science in line with teaching you to program in Python.
reviews.comment_teaching:
LAM, Gibson:
1. Easy-to-understand
2. Teaching (Speaking) style is generally funny

LAM, Ngok:
1. Very detailed explanation (sometimes lengthy though)
2. Boring (Sorry to say that, but it really is)

LAB (Ronald Mo):
easy-to-follow

Both lectures and labs don't take attendance. Generally all three of them are okay. Just sit whoever you like and ask whatever you want to (they are willing to answer any questions).
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is based on
1. Two assignments (total 40%, 20% each)
2. Midterm (20%)
3. Final (40%)

Assignments:
The two assignments of this semester are both a bit tricky, but you can still figure it out by devoting a little bit of your time. In general, they are easy-to-handle. Getting full marks is a must.

However, you should be reminded that you better finish the assignments ON YOUR OWN, and make sure that your work is not accidentally LEAKED. You will certainly score zero in assignment if professors find any trace of copying (from your work or in your work), and no matter what your reason/excuse is, professors will regard you as plagiarizing.

Midterm:
Tricky and demanding in speed. In this semester we have only 1 hour to finish the paper, and comparatively the paper is not really short.

Final:
Tricky and difficult. For some questions what I can really do is pure guessing.

Generally, the use of various data structures (lists, tuples, dictionary) with looping and L-systems with recursion are the main points in this semester. Also, as stated in the title, easy contents do not guarantee you a good performance in exams or a satisfactory grade. But still, at least try your best to avoid careless mistakes !

Overall statistics for reference:
Assignment 1: max 100; min 5; avg 91.8; sd 18.1
Assignment 2: max 100; min 3; avg 90.9; sd 27.65
Midterm: max 100; min 18; avg 66.9; sd 21.8
Final: max 100, min 8; avg 53.9; sd 25.1
(Zeros are all excluded)

My result
Assignments: both 100/100
Midterm: 89/100
Final: 71/100
Overall: 86.2% (A-)

The grading is fair I guess. But an A- is a bit below my expectation. Thanks for the final !
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not really much, as compared to other courses.

But I advise spending more time on practicing to trace the code involving lists / tuples / dictionaries with loops (in particular nested-loops).

reviews.author: supermin
reviews.title: Easy course as a non-computer background if you do regular revisions.
reviews.comment_content: I never learned programming in my entire life, and yet this course was relatively easy. You start with very basics, then progress onto more difficult and complex commands/codes/etc. If you previously learned Python, then congrats, you just got a free A or A+.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor always tries his best to make the lecture entertaining, and being a small class (compared to ones in huge lecture theaters), he is able to communicate with the students effectively. He will answer any questions with kind so ask anything to him.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are midterms, finals, quiz, and assignments.

The interesting thing about this course is that if you were to gain a low midterm grade, then achieve a better grade in finals + assignments, the course will not consider your low midterms (so the grade will be calculated without it). So you are able to attain a higher grade. And all exams are open book!

Assignments are not that difficult (though requires some extensive thinking) if you regularly reviewed.

Quizzes are not compulsory; the lecturer asks a question, and if you answer you get 1% extra grade per question. You don't have to answer it, but it's an extra percentage to your grade, so might as well try.
reviews.comment_workload:
No weekly assignments, but there are two big assignments. As mentioned before, requires thinking, but overall not very difficult.

If you regularly study you will gain B+ and above very easily.

Actually when you get not-really-satisfying grade on the midterm, the prof will make the midterm percentage to the total grade to 0% so that if you work hard on your final exam and assignment then you can cover your mistake in the midterm.
so overall, not bad.

reviews.comment_grading:
Grade calculation method 1
Midterm 20%, Final 40%, 2 Assignments 20% for each

Grade calculation method 2
Final 50%, 2 Assignments 25% for each

Midterm is optional, but I recommend taking it because it is so much easier than the final. At the end of semester, your grades (calculated by 2 different methods above) are compared and the higher one is chosen to be your final grade.

I got 0.4 sd above for midterm (mean 71.6, sd 27.1)
0.7 sd above for final (mean 53.1, sd 22.86)
and full marks for both assignments.

My grade was higher without the midterm score, and finally I got A. Grading is really lenient.

reviews.author: Brian D
reviews.comment_content:

There are two assignments, each of which contributes 20% towards total grading, totaling 40%

reviews.author: LULLUL
reviews.title: 10/10, Definitely would reg again.
reviews.comment_content: Has very clear powerpoint slides uploaded to course website. Easy to follow. Even got a summary cheat sheet provided for final exam.

reviews.comment_workload: Only 2 assignment, mid-term and final. Assignment might take some time for people unfamiliar with programming stuffs, but still easy to get full marks as long as you are careful at reading.

reviews.author: Seeking4u()
reviews.title: beginner-friendly Python programming course
reviews.comment_content: Although the name suggests “Intro to CS”, it’s actually just basic programming in Python.
reviews.comment_teaching: Most of the time, content presented in the classroom is covered in the lecture notes. But sometimes the instructor will use other examples, which are more interesting than those in lecture notes. For example, he uses real midterm data (scores, student ID, lecture section) to teach us file reading in python. He knows the materials quite well, and he does try to make the lessons interesting. Sometimes he will ask questions, you get assignment points (used to boost assignments marks if you didn’t get full marks) for answering them correctly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment 1 (20%)
Assignment 2 (20%)
Midterm (20%)
Final (40%)

This is the regular grading methodology, however if you didn’t perform well in the midterm, and you manage to do very well in the final, they automatically exclude your midterm score in the total grade. In this case, final will weigh 60% in the total grade. However take note that final is definitely more difficult than midterm.

Overall, the grading scheme is quite generous. 99% for assignment 1, 100% for assignment 2, 94% for midterm, 94% for final = A+ , but I guess I’m on the boundary between A and A+ since the high score is always 100, better be extremely careful and score full marks if you aim for A+.

Assignment 1 mean score : 89.9, SD : 15.43
Assignment 2 mean score : 94.1, SD : 12.67
Final mean score : 62.3, SD : 22.6
Midterm mean score : 69.1, SD : 22.2
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course is acceptable, might be heavier for beginners in programming. If you are somehow new to any programming language, then simply reading the lecture notes might not be enough, if you want to secure good grade, practice coding from scratch or tweaking code presented in lecture notes can help you get familiar with the course materials. There’s lectures and lab every week, no attendance is taken though. Skipped two of the lectures, and two of the labs. You can self study lecture notes if you miss the lecture. For lab, the detailed instructions are posted on the lab website, so no worries if you accidentally skipped it. By the way, lab 3 and 4, 7 and 8 (I skipped these two) are related to the assignments. You will eventually use code written in lab to complete the assignments.

Code for assignment 1 (use turtle graphics and pygame midi module to implement a fairly simple “music player”) can be written in less than a day, since they really provide a lot of guidance in the assignment document. But be sure to spend (possibly a lot of) time to test the program!

Assignment 2 (use turtle graphics to implement a space shooter game) will take more time to complete. Searching for game materials to use, and editing them, might take as much time as writing the code. I spend a few days on assignment 2, possibly because I prefer working in a relaxed mode. Just don’t procrastinate and you will be fine for both assignments. You can always approach TA to seek help in completing assignments, they are very willing to help. But as the deadline gets closer, they might be very busy because many students need their help.

Midterm and final are open book and open notes examinations, so you will be fine provided that you are familiar with the materials, and understand the concepts.

reviews.author: helloitdog
reviews.title: Should ace it if you took DSE ICT(Elective 2D)
reviews.comment_content: Basic iterations and decision of programming. Basic ideas and paradigms of CS. Content may be jumping from one to another frequently. If you have no programming background, it's better to take a look at some coding examples (Psuedocode will do).
reviews.comment_teaching: In detail. Prof. Lam has a tendency in speaking faster and faster in class. You may want to raise your hand if you can't keep up or have any questions. He doesn't like people talking in class, so just keep the volume to a minimum with your coursemates. TA/IA are always helpful in your assignment or any bugs that you find. Though, ask your friends to take a brief look if a problem is found. Don't find TA/IA about silly mistakes instantly or you risk get your *** kicked xd.
reviews.comment_grading:
Full marks on both assignments
92/100 midterm
86/100 final
Overall: A
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments (all are programs)
Part of the assignments are done in labs, additional bonus for completing the rest. The bonus tasks may be daunting, but you may, of course, ask TA for insights on how to do the program. They will give you some tips on how to deal with the problem. Last-minute completion is a NO. Do NOT do it in the last minute as debugging will take you longer time than typing the program itself. On average, 1 week per assignment (I didn't go to lab frequently)
Labs take no attendance.

reviews.author: Jayeon Koo
reviews.comment_content: The course teaches simple python syntaxes and how computer logic works. This is a great starting course for anyone new to coding because you can learn how to give your computer commands and follow their logic while not having to deal too much with the complicated coding syntax (Java).
reviews.comment_teaching: Not enough supplementary explanation is given during lecture. The instructor simply reads off of the ppts, which are all uploaded on the comp website, so I stopped going to lectures midway. Revising on your own will give you the same understanding of the class material even if you don't attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Although the course is relatively easy, many students who have taken python prior to this course are also present, so it is hard to go from a B range to an A range. To get an A range grade overall, a perfect score on the assignment is a must. The final exam questions difficulty increases every semester, so it is important to master the past papers and take some supplementary python practice problems on your own.
reviews.comment_workload: Lecture notes are around 20 slides each. Each set took me about 20-30 minutes to review and learn on my own, so the lectures themselves are not too heavy at all. Assignments tend to take more time, because the smallest mistakes can cause a big problem in the program. You will suffer less if you just take it to the TA or a friend who had taken this course when these situations occur. Don't overwork your brain.. it will be hard to find those errors on your own.

reviews.author: xelostar

He likes to make little jokes in the lectures to make them more interesting and he makes really detailed powerpoint slides which help with easier understanding. Labs are very detailed but I skipped most of them so not much to say.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is pretty good as a whole I think but you pretty much need to make no mistakes if you want to get an A+.

Midterm (0% or 20%): 100/100, Mean 69.1, SD 22.2
Assignment 1 (20%): 90/100, Mean 89.9, SD 15.43
Assignment 2 (20%): 100/100, Mean 94.1, SD 12.67
Final (40% or 60%): 90/100, Mean 62.3, SD 22.6

Total Grade 94% --> A
So you need at least 95 to get an A+ unfortunately...
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fine, just the two assignments and a midterm and final. The assignments should be easy to get full marks on because they basically guide you through the whole thing. You really need to check it lots of times before submission so you won't lose 10 points over an unnecessary line of code like me = =

The midterm and final are open book exams.

reviews.comment_teaching: The Professor is very nice and always willing to answer students' questions after class. The class may not extremely funny, but not too bad.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very nice.
Follow the instruction in lab, which will help you finish parts of the assignments. It is sort of easy to get the full marks for the assignments since you can run the program to see if it works or not.
You may gain extra point if answer a question during class.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is 1 mid-term and 1 final, both are open book exams. You can take all the lecture notes and your work from the lab section.  
There are also 2 assignments. Both of them is to write a program. One is a music system and another one is a game.

reviews.author: Jeb
reviews.comment_content: Very easy introduction class in Python where you just learn the basics of programming like strings, for, if/else, and while loops. I wouldn't worry about it too much however if you're not a logical thinker it could be a bit tricky however there's a lot of online resources like codeacademy or coursera which go much farther in depth than this class.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is what you would expect for an intro class
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was very fair and the final exam was extremely easy if you understood your basics.
reviews.comment_workload: There's only two real assignments that do take a bit of time because errors can take a while to figure out.

reviews.author: schalkxidiot
reviews.title: Great Course along with Great instruction
reviews.comment_content: This course is about Python. Of course, as a 1000 level course, the content covers the basic and the easiest part of Python such as loops and some class things but students can still learn the way of thinking of computer programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: Both instructors, two Dr. Lam, may be two of the best teaching staff I have ever met at HKUST. They are so kind and helpful. They will not hesitate to answer your question. Lectures and labs are so fun and the learning atmosphere is wonderful.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not bad and it is typical although the mean of this course is very scary for some people especially freshmen (around 70 marks). Above 0.5-1 sd may give you a B to B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload since there are only two assignments while both of them are talked about in the labs. If you attend all the labs, I am sure that you can handle the assignments very well. Lessons and the mid-term can be skipped but I dont recommend you doing this because you will miss a lot of learning opportunities.

reviews.author: MyVarian
reviews.title: GOOD
reviews.comment_content: this course is about how to use python. it is really easy and interesting. some basic code and introduction to turtle graphics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
just so so it mostly depends on yourself
i think reading notes is better than listening to the lecture
reviews.comment_grading: 2 assignment and very easy to get full mark. final is easy and if your midterm will decrease your mark they can overlook your midterm. finally i think it is easy to get A plus
reviews.comment_workload:
small just 2 assignments and some labs
assignments can mostly be completed in labs

reviews.author: LeoWong
reviews.comment_content: Most of them were essential basics for programming beginners, and the content is not too difficult for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is a very good instructor. He teaches students in a way that does not make students feel boring. Moreover, to make the class more interactive, he sometimes asks questions to students, which will award you with bonus marks if you are the first one to answer them all correctly. Also, he answers questions after class
reviews.comment_grading:
Carefulness is the key to get A+ for the course.
Grading policy:
Homework 1: 22%
Homework 2: 22%
The remaining 56% will be allocated like this:
If your midterm mark > final mark:
mid-term exam: 22%
final exam: 34%
otherwise:
final exam: 56%
reviews.comment_workload: 2 homeworks, 1 midterm, 1 final exam, nothing special.

reviews.author: Kelvin_Leung
reviews.title: A good start with programming
reviews.comment_content:
the course is about python
not too deep and difficult in this course
it's useful and fun to learn to draw some graphic using turtle and basic computer language stuff is covered.
it's not hard to learn even you are fresh to programming and have no related background knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson taught well and it's not boring
the notes will be distributed in the first two lessons
all the notes and labs are explained and designed will that it's easy to understand
No attendance will be taken, so u can skip all lectures including labs(not suggested) if u have confidence to do self-study.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade with good scheme
there are 2 methods to calculate the final total marks and the better one will be chosen
However, almost full marks are required to get A+
but not difficult to get A or A- if you have study past paper and look through all the notes.
MId-term and final is open-book and open-notes, so u can bring whatever which helps.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much
2 assignments in total (22% each), they are a music player with some easy control and a shooting game this semester
each can be finished within 4 hours as long as you have done all the things taught in the lab.

reviews.author: Jacky CHAN
reviews.title: COMP1021
reviews.comment_content: There is 2 program assignments, one designing a music player, the other one designing the space invader game.With 2 exams, midterm and final, all open notes and books. The notes should be beyond enough for the exam. The lecture notes have no differences to those in the past, just ask the seniors for notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is funny, and has shown a very strong understanding in Python. I was really stunned when he sent us the 'Puzzle and dragon' game in Python file.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair, and cannot say it is good or bad. Just fair.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite demanding without the TA's assistance.

reviews.author: Kristian
reviews.comment_content: This is an introduction course to computer science. The course mainly covers the basics of using the Python interpreter. The teachers teach us about some of the basic implementations of coding such as, input and output, conditional statements, for and while loops. Other materials are dictionaries, stacks, and classes. The teachers also teaches the use of the pygame module that is included which allows to programmer to import some modules which can be used to help to programmer to make games.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teacher teaches in a very engaging and interesting way. He is able to explain the concepts of course and makes it easy for students to understand. Teacher also makesly jokes in class which makes the learning environment very interesting and is clearly very knowledgeable in the course material that he is teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very nice. Teacher gives bonus assignment points in class for answering some easy questions that he asks in class. To get into A range only need to get up to mean sd range. Also there is the disappearing midterm mark so you can skip the midterm and just do good on the finals exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is really light. You don't actually need to do anything in the lab sections. You only need to do two assignments for the whole course which is rather easy and can be finished in a rather short amount of time considering the amount of guide that they give us.

reviews.author: tavy
reviews.comment_content: Great introduction to several programming methods using the python programming logic. Great for students without any background in cs.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Lam usually speaks with a monotonous tone which may drive you into boredom and cause you to sleep. But he is a very patient and helpful professor if you have nay doubts.
reviews.comment_grading: Great grading. Do well on the assignments and decent in the exams, you will probably come out with an A-
reviews.comment_workload: 2 assignments. A midterm which does not count if it worsens your overall grade and a final. Not very demanding at all and the assignments are a lot of fun.

reviews.author: Em
reviews.comment_content:
Python 2.3 language - pretty simple and easy introduction!
ex. turtle graphics, pygame, different loops (while/if/recurring), if conditions (elif...),
reviews.comment_teaching:
Funny professor, tries to make it as interesting as possible. Reads everything from his detailed ppts, so u actually don't need to go to class.
Lectures are less than an hour, which makes it easy to concentrate if u are there!
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was pretty good.
The final exam was not that hard, but had tricky questions. Mid-term was easier! both were open notes exams, which was really helpful!

Assignments were not that hard thus alot of ppl would get full marks so its really important that u get it as well, or else it would be hard to get a good grade

22% Assignment 1
22% Assignment 2
34% Final
22% Optional Midterm
reviews.comment_workload:
pretty light, 2 pretty easy assignments but may take some time! TAs were really helpful answering questions regarding the assignments
As long as you understand the concepts u don't need to practice that much,, actually doing the assignments yourself would help alot.

no attendance taken for both lectures and labs!!

reviews.author: Stephen
reviews.comment_content: Nothing fancy, basic programming knowledge. Would be a waste of time for those familiar with other programming languages.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof mainly read from his lecture notes. Actually, there is no much to comment on.
reviews.comment_grading: I think it is pretty good, because there are so many students taking the course. And the introduction courses are certainly not set to scare people off. There are pastpapers actually. The questions are pretty similar in every year's exams.
reviews.comment_workload: Pretty light workload. Two exams, two assignments. I think its less than 500 lines of code.

reviews.author: Brian
reviews.title: Praise the lawd that it isn't Python 2.7
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of programming using Python 3.2 because at the time I took this course, it was almost 2017.

Objects, Loops, Lists, Slicing, Functions, and some other stuff.

Used Pygame (for turtle and midi projects)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching for the classes I went to. Labs were quite good as well, fast-paced but clear. The lecturer was very enthusiastic.

And then, well, I stopped going to class. So I don't really know what the classes were like after the second lecture.

Same goes for the labs (oops).
reviews.comment_grading:
22% Assignment 1
22% Assignment 2
34% Final
22% Optional Midterm (weight will be moved to the final)

Got mean, was a B.
reviews.comment_workload: Too light. Spent 10 hours overall studying and working on projects for the course. There should be more coding practice involved.

reviews.author: ParanoidAndroid
reviews.title: A very good introductory course
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is quite good, the lecture slides are high quality and the assignments are enjoyable and not difficult. The language taught is Python, which is in my opinion the best language for beginners.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is acceptable. The pace is quite slow especially if you know some programming, but is tolerable.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is very nice. Exams are not difficult, but sometimes tricky. Assignments are easy, the slides quite literally walk you through the whole assignment so you don't have to do anything but to implement what you're told.
The midterm mark is omitted if you end up with a higher overall grade without it. I did relatively bad on the midterm, but ended up with an A+ thanks to the final.
reviews.comment_workload: All the exams are open notes, so there's actually no need to study for them. There are two assignments that are easy and can be done entirely in a couple of hours.

reviews.author: sgargaa
reviews.title: Fun course, but labs require prior work
reviews.comment_content: For any student who is being acquainted to programming for the first time, the course does look interesting. The programming language taught here is Python, which has a simpler syntax as compared to other languages like Java or C++. However, if you are looking at this course from the perspective of going for a major in Computer Science, I would recommend you to skip this course and instead look at COMP1022P.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Rossiter is a great professor, who is so lively that you seldom feel sleepy in his class. He has a great and a very understandable accent, and he knows how to engage the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
The marks distribution used is:
Midterm 22%
Assignment-1 22%
Assignment-2 22%
Final exam 34%
However, if using the midterm mark gives you a lower end-of-semester score, then your midterm mark will be automatically ignored. It will be worth 0 percent of the course to you. In this situation, the marks distribution used used would be:
Midterm 0%
Assignment-1 28.25%
Assignment-2 28.25%
Final exam 43.5%
So based on this, it is lenient to an acceptable level.
reviews.comment_workload: The course has lectures, tutorials and laboratories. So it does have a considerable amount of workload. But in general, the amount of time you need to spend on each topic is pretty low and the course content is very generic and basic.

reviews.author: stereo
reviews.comment_content:
Python 3.2, Topic大部份同中學ICT Programming一樣(唔贅述, 其他review寫得好好)
　
佢個網站會有齊所有野, lecture slides, example program, cheatsheet....
　
Python多左個叫Turtle既東西, 可以用黎畫下公仔既....
然後會用到其中一個額外library 'pygame', 除左assignment之外應該冇用, 考試都唔洗特別背code, 因為open notes....
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment x2 @22%; Midterm 22%; Final 34%
Midterm冇考/考得差的話可以唔計, 呢個case既話Final 56%
平時落堂之前會問幾條問題, 答岩一題有1分加落assignment, 當你assignment唔高分果陣應該有用
　
mean/SD
assignments: 89.1/18, 92.7/15
midterm: 69.6/17 ; final: 69/23.2
所以assignment最好滿分
　
因為考試open notes, 所以自製/佢比既cheatsheet有code都要非常小心, final因為咁失左少少分, 其他滿分, A+
reviews.comment_workload:
輕鬆, lab係幫你做assignment, 正常冇壓力
如果冇上過堂, 最好assignment deadline前早d追返哂所有野+做assignment
　
assignment應該會定期改一次題目, 就算topic同上年一樣, 比分位都會唔同左, 有source都冇乜用

reviews.author: Jimmy Lee
reviews.comment_content: The content is very fun and applicable. You get to build your own game. Good course for programming novices who want their first experience with a programming language.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter is the better professor. He makes the class very interesting and definitely does not make it difficult to want to attend class.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is okay. Just do relatively well and it should be at least a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not too much. There are a few assignments but overall, the midterm and final do not require much studying at all.

reviews.author: ziwon
reviews.title: Great course for COMP beginners
reviews.comment_content: Learn about basic programming skills in 'Python' including "Hello World" and other terminologies with hands-on lab sessions on Functions, Arrays, Recursion, GUI and even a slight touch on Classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: David Rossiter is a FANTASTIC professor. Teaches the concepts in a really passionate way so that students can get the idea really easily and quickly. Greatest professor ever met in terms of teaching in UST.
reviews.comment_grading: A Common Core course with nice grading. Exams are very easy with those who have the necessary skillets for computer science.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is alright. No group project for the best part (unlike many other common core courses). Assignments can be annoying and time consuming sometimes but it's really fun to do.

reviews.author: Ling
reviews.comment_content:
Basic Python programming.
For students who want a easier course may take the VBA course instead. But this course is not too diffiicult though.
reviews.comment_teaching:
David will demonstrate every examples showed on the notes so it is suggested to attend the lectures.

Attendance of lab sections is not required, but I highly suggest student not to miss any of the lab section because many of the assignment details will be go through during the lab.
reviews.comment_grading: Great. I think above mean a sd can get a A grade or so.
reviews.comment_workload:
The "game" assignment is interesting.
Exam is open-notes.

reviews.author: StANLeyXXX
reviews.comment_content: Very BASIC programming concept. If...then...else, loops and etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very funny and energetic instructor, should not have any problem understanding his English.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you do the programming assignments yourself without copying each other, you should not have any problem with your midterm and final. Students without programming background should be able to get B range or above. (As long as you are not terrible at programming)
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload is the programming assignment. It depends on whether you are terrible at understanding basic programming concept or not.

reviews.author: acewhite
reviews.title: Fun Professor but limited content
reviews.comment_content: The course is designed as a introductory, so it didn't cover many topics which are important for Python. A bit inadequate for people who wish to learn more about Python or CS students. Anyway, not bad.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter is very funny. His lectures are always full of laughs. And obviously he is a native speaker.  He is also willing to answer students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Everyone I know got good grades, like A or A+. The projects are quite easy and if written appropriately. Even if someone scored poorly in the midterm, with a little effort, could get A or higher.
reviews.comment_workload: It's work on programming is too little as a CS course. Only a few hundreds of codes per project. And a student proficient in programming could finish that two hours.

reviews.author: maymay
reviews.comment_content:
教用Python寫program,都係d
-Type of variables
-while / for loop
-function
-if
-recursion
等等比較易上手既topic
reviews.comment_teaching:
一個好有趣既外藉professor,上堂唔悶,講野都幾易明,間中抽人答問題:)
不過好唔中意人嘈,傾計太大聲會比佢話:(
reviews.comment_grading: grade都唔錯,2份功課都幾高分,但final得mean,最後B左
reviews.comment_workload: workload唔太大,一個sem只係要交2份assignment,其他lab都唔計分。而兩份assignment上堂都會教你做大概1/3先,有上堂既話淨番既應會識做,就算唔識搵TA幫手佢地都好肯解答問題!!所以功課唔難高分;)

reviews.author: charlotte777oz
reviews.comment_content: Basic Python programming language. No need for computer background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Excellent teacher

Very engaging and humorous to keep lectures fun and exciting. Explains everything step-by-step to make sure everyone even without computer background can understand.

Powerpoint notes are very straightforward and concise, uploaded online each week. Can ask questions after lectures or TAs in lab time, they are friendly and willing to help.
reviews.comment_grading: Reasonable grading, ~1SD for A range
reviews.comment_workload:
Low workload

Two assignments that can be mostly completed during lab time, a final and an optional midterm (both open-note).

Even if you cannot attend the lectures, they are filmed and uploaded online, no attendance required.

reviews.author: Asflsy
reviews.comment_content: 都是程序很基礎的知識，雖然不深，但對於後續的學習會蠻有用。
reviews.comment_teaching:
非常有趣，很難有困意。
add/drop period會把所有的slides都替我們印出來，很貼心的。
reviews.comment_grading: 給的grade算是很好的了，assignment和midterm final都不難。
reviews.comment_workload: 有兩個大assignment，沒有其他作業，課後只需把程序自己玩一遍即可。

reviews.author: Yolanda
reviews.comment_content: 简单的Python，入门。如果没有基础又想学programming的话应该会喜欢这种课。
reviews.comment_teaching: 幽默，轻松。TA也都很负责，会解答问题，还有视频可以帮助复习。
reviews.comment_grading: 细心点，有好龟。但是题目简单大家分数都高了，基本不能有错，如果要A+
reviews.comment_workload: 基本为零。两次assignment。一次midterm，一次final。都是开卷考。

reviews.author: Aloha
reviews.title: 打波先嚟落雨 唔通連個天都唔鐘意我?
reviews.comment_content: 成個Course都係學python, 由基本syntax開始. for loop, if-else, while loop, recursion, object, etc..
reviews.comment_teaching:
教授幾風趣 上堂會demo 啲example畀你睇
lab就可上可不上 但啲exercise就一定要做 有啲會喺assignment用返
題外話: Rossiter好似唔鐘意人地將佢個名讀成rosister Be careful
題外話2: lab度有啲helper 如果你呢個course拎A range就可以做lab helper 時薪好似48元 好似幾攤條嘅一份工嚟
reviews.comment_grading:
22%*2 assignment
22% midterm
34% final
幾好grade midterm >1.1sd final >1.6sd assignment full  get an A+
mean有B
reviews.comment_workload:
assignment主要係某幾個lab exercise嘅extension 難度唔算高 唔識我諗TA/professor都會教到你識為止
第1個assignment係整個music player 冇咩特別
第2個assignment係用python turtle整隻唔好玩兼唔耐玩嘅無聊game出嚟 都係冇咩特別
midterm final open note 然而呢啲case 有否open係冇乜影響
主要係短答題同埋MC
lab唔計分唔計attendance 鐘意上就上啦~ 如果programming廢但又怕爛grade嘅話就最好上 唔識可以問TA/helper

reviews.author: UMR
reviews.title: Valuable course
reviews.comment_content: Teaching the basic concept of programming using Python. Python is a relatively easy programming language for beginners because the codes are like English. You have to attend most of the lessons in order to get familiar with the logic flows for exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Really fun. The professor can give you a happy lesson. I Promise.
reviews.comment_grading: This course is easy. You may feel disappointed when you get B range even you achieve 90% or above. But, the grading is still reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload:
One midterm
Two assignments
One final exam

Actually, the workload is low. You can learn a lot from doing assignment. Remember do them by yourself, you will feel hopeless in final exam if your assignments are carried by your friends.

reviews.author: John Ma
reviews.title: Introductory course that incorporates interesting elements and interactive teaching.
reviews.comment_content:
The course format is basically two exams, 2-3 assignments, labs and an individual project.

The syllabus covers the basics of Python, loops, data types and the Turtle graphic library.

There is no attendance requirement for the lectures. Do attend the labs as you get to ask the TAs about your assignments/labs.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer always teaches with passion and presents material in humorous way.

The TAs are typically helpful with your work. Ask and you can receive.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is reasonable. The exam format is MC plus short questions (code filling etc.)
reviews.comment_workload:
No reading or online homwork.
There are weekly labs and several assignments to be completed.

The assignments mostly involve completing skeleton codes etc.

reviews.author: rubyyyy
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content: Basic python skills. For those without any computer background, it is also easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is good to attend David's lecture. You will never feel boring in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading: normal grading. I got mean in the final exam but below one SD in the midterm exam. I got a B in the result.
reviews.comment_workload: With the help of TA, it is quite easy to finish the assignment . Actually, you can finish most part of the assignment in computer labs, we just need to add a few at home.

reviews.author: firegod
reviews.comment_content:
呢個Course 係programming嘅入門班，如果之前有讀過ICT programming會好快上手。個course主要教你用python去學習programming嘅basic idea，同埋會學一d python特有嘅syntax，再會教你用d python好容易做到嘅function例如turtle同埋music playing。

連考法都好似ICT programming咁，比blank你填code，dry run code等等。
reviews.comment_teaching:
都冇咩上lecture其實lol，不過感覺上Gibson都講得幾清晰。反而我有去足lab，個TA（好似叫Catherine）教得好好，同埋問佢問題佢都用心解答，所以強烈推薦上lab，因為我覺得lab做嘅野等於課堂內容精華版，落手做好快吸收。

雖然我係學過C 所以覺得有d syntax唔洗解釋咁多，不過我覺得d lecture notes真係有d類聚，因為我自己整咗個份神notes入去考都係得5頁就有齊成個course嘅內容，不過呢個course連final前派嘅cheatsheet都有幾多頁下...
reviews.comment_grading: 我覺得OK好grade啦，我兩份assignment都滿分，midterm 高個幾sd, final高一個sd，最後有A，不過真係feel唔到點先會有A＋lol
reviews.comment_workload: 唔算太重，有兩份assignment，lab唔計attendance又冇野交，基本上靜係教你做assignment個幾個 lab先去上都ok。final理論上唔會考翻midterm前嘅內容，只不過讀親programming點都要承繼翻basic嘅idea同syntax咁姐。

reviews.author: 小龜
reviews.comment_content:
Language: Python

內容不要期待太多，正如普通的入門programming course一樣，教的是
loop
drawing
if statement
array indexing
import/save file 之類的東西



Tips: 請注意每個command的用法，是用法。注意哪些指令會call variable。多想像些奇怪的situation,考試就是考這些。

ps: physics同學，python 遲些有用
reviews.comment_teaching:
首先請認實DAVID ROSSITER !
英國人，上堂風趣幽默，喜歡自嘲，九點堂都很難有睡意。英語清晰，條理算是分明。

隨堂派note,final前派cheatsheet,那份cheatsheet叫一個歎為觀止，從每一個command的用途，用法到例子應有盡有，本來自己寫了cheatsheet都不想用了。
reviews.comment_grading:
grade神
1. 高一個sd就有A (我那年80%)
2. 考試每一題都很重要，錯一條基本一個sub-grade(當年我有個中同mid-term多錯一條就 A-了。。）
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments+midterm+final+Lab(?)

Labs：
Lab不take attendance。
去了基本浪費時間，TA基本把可以20分鐘打完的code說整堂。
但...是...
lab的material很重要，請自己做，自己做。

Assignments:
assignment 1:
音樂顯示，考的是import files/drawing(turtle graphic)之類的東西
assignment 2:

reviews.author: Lucaswat

The fundamentals of Python, such as if/else, logical operators (AND, OR,...), functions, classes and objects, various data types (lists, dictionaries,...), and recursion, are the focus of this course.

In this course on graphics and geometry, Turtle plays a prominent role (which I consider this useless based on my need for future).


In general, it is not too difficult. The content's level of complexity is beginner-friendly.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor David is a humorous instructor. His way of speaking will keep you awake for the whole lesson. He knows the common mistakes and points them out during class.

42% lab + 58% final

My grade A+ (overall 100/100)
reviews.comment_workload: Three labs only. Each lab is guided by the TAs, so nothing to worry. Pay attention in class or watch the recordings would be enough for understanding the concepts.

reviews.author: Vivian Sze
reviews.title: Gibson yyds
reviews.comment_content:
As a student without computer science knowledge, the content in this course is easy to comprehend. It's mostly about turtle graphics, looping, if statements, lists, recursion, and other topics covered in the exams. I strongly suggest not just simply going over all the PowerPoint slides for revision but watching the lecture videos instead. Sometimes there are only little things in the slides but the professors might elaborate a lot on them in class.

Finals are on a higher level of difficulty. Do not expect finals to be easier than midterms as it discusses about class and recursion. I personally find this the most challenging topic to comprehend at first glance apart from looping and if statements. But just like any other topic, just do enough interactive practices and past papers (mostly past papers because I think they are more helpful than interactive practices) at https://course.cse.ust.hk/comp1021/.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is a good professor. I was afraid that learning about computer science would be tedious and challenging but Gibson had a light atmosphere in his class because he sometimes makes jokes. He also manages to make good examples right after teaching us a concept so we can understand what we were taught about and was left a deep impression.
reviews.comment_grading:
This class does not take attendance.

There are two different grading systems and the professors will use the way that gives you the highest grade.

1.
Midterm 24% Lab projects 36% Final 40%

2.
Midterm 0% Lab projects 42% Final 58%

Then again,  you only get an A+ if you get full marks for everything.

Check your lab projects again and again before the submission is strongly recommended. Sometimes dumb mistakes are made and they are an easy way to lose points.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much stuff to do apart from lab projects. There're five in total for the entire semester and it is usually given after teaching some concepts. These lab projects allow you to understand and practice multiple concepts simultaneously. If you have trouble finishing these lab projects, you can always watch the video that was given to help you with the lab project or attend the lab session.

reviews.author: JSang
reviews.comment_content:
Evaluation of the course (see another post for information on the syllabus):
Introduction to Module 0
only outlining some fundamental chemistry and biology ideas. Students who never took chemistry and biology in high school should be the target audience for this section. Terence said that it wouldn't be covered in tests, but I'm not sure whether that's accurate.
reviews.comment_teaching: He's a professor in the area. Both the language and the tempo are relaxed and simple to follow. Frankly, he behaves and speaks more like your friends, who are constantly friendly and kind, rather than academics who always maintain a straight face and are serious. This greatly improves the learning environment and closes the gap between professors and students. It is excellent.
reviews.comment_grading:
Unfortunately, new courses sometimes have an odd quality to them. It would be the enrolled pupils in this instance. For whatever reason, the class's pupils are very talented and competitive this semester, which produces a relatively high mean and a small SD.

The following is the grading system:

Participation in class (10%, in-class Canvas)
- Homework (4 sets, 10%)
- Group Project (20% of the total grade, 5% report, 5% peer review, and 10% poster presentation) (You will forfeit the 5% report if your peer assessment score is less than 30%.) (You will forfeit the 10% poster presentation fee if you do not attend the poster presentation.)
- The midterm test (30%)
- The final test (30%)
reviews.comment_workload:
Since you get to read all the material during the tests, there isn't much preparation to do before them. It is very crucial to comprehend the lecture material.

I completed all 4 HW in less than an hour, so it really isn't much effort for the HW either. For solutions, see your lecture notes.

But the collective project requires a lot of work. With the weekly group meetings, however, the task is organized for the whole semester, and you may work on the project while being closely supervised by the UG TA.

reviews.author: arashiaa
reviews.title: Labs are easy but midtem and final are quite challenging
reviews.comment_content:
An introductory course to python. It is suitable for those students who haven't learned python programming language before.

There are lab sessions each week, which are optional. Students can attend the lab session to ask their questions.

This course won't take attendance during lectures or labs.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Lam is a good teacher. He explains all the concepts clearly.
