reviews.author: Leoml
reviews.title: A Good course from CSE department
reviews.comment_content: The course introduces the basics of Python programming. It is quite intuitive and friendly to beginners like me. The slides are clear and there are interactive exam for us to consolidate our knowledge. It is overall easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Lam is good. His teaching is clear and he tries to let us understand what is going on for each piece of code in the examples.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
24% midterm, 36% lab, 40% final OR
0% midterm, 42% lab, 58% final
It seems that this year’s midterm and final is easier than previous terms. There is much time for me to check paper since there are more than 10 minutes for checking in each session, so careless mistakes are not tolerated. In fact, many people could get full marks in the midterm and exam. Mean of both midterm and final are around 70.
I got full in all of them.
Grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, there are 3 hand in lab assignments and 3 optional. They are a bit challenging and takes a few hours to complete the code. Clear instructions are given to us as well.

reviews.author: wkwkwkkwkw
reviews.title: Good course for beginners
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture 1: Getting Started with Python
Lecture 2: Beginning to Programming Python
Lecture 3: Introduction to Turtle Graphics
Lecture 4: Making Decisions
Lecture 5: Loops
Lecture 6: Example of a Nested Loop
Lecture 7: Using For Loops with and without Graphics
Lecture 8: Lists, Tuples, and Strings
Lecture 9: Handling Repeating Patterns
Lecture 10: More on Using Loops and Logic
Lecture 11: Slicing
Lecture 12: More on Lists and Strings and Functions
Lecture 13: Handling Data Types

MIDTERM

Lecture 15: Turtle Shapes, Creating Turtles, and Clicking and Dragging Turtles
Lecture 16: Handling Key Presses and Clicking on the Turtle Window
Lecture 17: More on Functions
Lecture 18: More on Operators
Lecture 19: Text and File Handling
Lecture 20: The Coordinate System and Understanding Colours
Lecture 21: Dictionaries
Lecture 22: Objects and State Diagrams
Lecture 23: Recursion

This course, overall, is very beginner friendly and teaches you a lot of interesting things about programming. It is also a grade booster if you already had a background in Python.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Rossiter is a very good professor. Unlike other UST professors, his lectures aren't sleep-inducing. You could actually pay attention to what he's trying to teach you without sleeping.

He explains the concepts clearly and teaches at an appropriate pace.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two grading schemes:
1. 24% Midterm, 36% Labs, 40% Finals
2. 42% Labs, 58% Finals

Labs:
Definitely try your best to get 100 here (very possible), the labs are pretty much free marks. Furthermore, they also give video tutorials where they give you a huge chunk of the code.

Midterm:
Objectively easy. However, I fucked up a lot and got a really bad score.

Finals:
Objectively easy. I made some careless mistakes too.

The exams in this course are very similar to the SAT. You are given questions that test your logic in a very short amount of time.

If you don't understand the code given to you in the question then you could just type it out in Python and run it (requires fast typing though).
reviews.comment_workload: Little to no workload.

reviews.author: Apple5682
reviews.comment_content: It is super hard for those who have no idea about programming. The code is understandable for simple command. However, the code in mid term or final was too complicated for me which took plenty of time for understanding.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is quite boring. He just read the notes with little demonstration.
reviews.comment_grading: I got a C overall. My mid term and final were below mean quite a lot. So it is acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload: There were few labs. The first two were quit easy to finish. However, the others were difficult to finish by yourselves. Seeking help is a must.

reviews.author: cmh
reviews.comment_content: Computer Science introduction course. You dont need to have any comp sci background. The course mainly emphasize Python programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: simple, straightforward, step-by-step guidance. There are quite a lot of tutorials and practices for you to try out at home. Gibson used quite a long of analogy and metaphors to help you understand the abstract idea of python (but honestly sometimes i feel like he is over simplifying to a point that people who are new to computer science can barely think out of the box when they are doing the tasks themselves.)
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term is optional.
Lab submissions.
Final exam.
Your final grade will be calculated by the weighting that results in the highest mark (there are different weightings: if you didnt take mid term or performed badly in mid term, your final grade would only include final exam if the calculation results in higher mark than including the mid term exam)

I did not take the Mid term exam.
All lab tasks 100%
Final Exam: 58/100 ( a few marks above mean)
Final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload:
Not a lot of workload.
Only 3 lab tasks.
But sure do need quite a lot of time practicing.

- varaiable and data type
- sequence, selection, and iteration
- function
- coordinate system in turtle
- recursion
- file handling

Overall, good course to get into programming. I am a little confused whey they choose teaching turtle, a barely useful library.

Midterm is easy. But each multiple choice would worth around 7 marks which made it easy to loose some of the marks. Again, I was lucky that I got full marks in the midterm.
Final is really strange. There are all kinds of strange question asking about minor details. Anyway, I got around 70/100.
Thanks to my labs and midterm, I got A+.

reviews.comment_workload:

reviews.author: aaoillam
reviews.comment_content: Content is quite easy if you already know basic python. Still achievable for students who do not have any prior programming knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching was quite good, the professor explained topics clearly with good examples.

The TA gave useful side information during the lecture and also answered questions posed by students quite quickly and effectively.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two grading types:
Labs: 36%, Midterm: 24%, Final 40%.

Labs 42%, Midterm 0%, Final 58%

They will take the higher of your score.

Midterm:
Average: 64.4%
Standard Deviation: 21.5%
Max: 100%
Min: 2.5%

Final:
Average: 55.9%
Standard Deviation: 20.5%
Max: 100%
Min: 8.6%
The weakest question in each section was removed, and there was 1 incorrect question, so the marks were given to all students for that one question.

This final was said to be the hardest final in the most recent years for COMP 1021.

Curve based grading causes very high grade boundaries.

Even if you have a good understanding of python, the exam may still prove difficult as it is very easy to make simple mistakes.

I would recommend to spend enough time to get a good grade on your assignment, as the average is quite high for all assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, total of 7 lab assignments, 3 needed to be handed in. Very good instruction on how to do the assignments.

reviews.author: 芝士奶蓋綠茶
reviews.comment_content:
Includes basic stuff related to Programming such as loops, if-statements, data type, functions, etc.
The stuff before Mid-Term is easy. Just very simple logic of programming. After Mid-Term it turns harder and takes time to understand. I advise you to study your exams earlier if you decided to skip all lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Rossiter's Teaching is great. He uses different examples in the class and not only reading out all the powerpoints. He also has interactive questions or polling to check whether students could understand the underlying principles. However, in my personal view, if you got some programming background (programming courses or experience before entering university), you could just skip the lectures. I don't think it is necessary to attend lectures, and there is also no attendance too. You could simply understand the concepts by studying powerpoints and go over the examples provided.

Lab sessions are not compulsory, only go to the sessions when you encounter problems.
reviews.comment_grading:
Two Grading Methods
One counts mid-term in your total grade while one doesn't
Since I did well in mid-term and I didn't keep a record of the other grading method, I can only give information abt the grading method with mid-term results.

Labs: 36% (3 labs, 12% each)
Mid-Term: 24%
Final: 40%

I got full mark in labs, almost full mark in Mid-Term and +1.32 SD in Final. Got an A. Fair Grading tho I thought I could get an A+.

Lab1: 100 (Mean: 97.2)
Lab2: 100 (Mean: 98.1)
Lab3: 100 (Mean: 95.4)
Mid-Term: 91.67% (Mean: 64.4%, SD: 21.5%, +1.27SD)
Final: 82.86% (Mean: 55.9%, SD: 20.5%, +1.32 SD)
Total Score: 91.14%, A

One thing about the exam is that the arrangement is terrible. Since they are offering around 1200 vacancies for students to enrol the class, it makes the exam difficult to organize. In the mid-term, the course website just went down before the exam and they delayed the exam for 30 minutes. The Final Exam was another case. The TAs could not open the zoom meeting for invigilating, causing them to delay the exam too.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 Hand-in Lab Assignments, 6 Non-Hand-in Lab (Just for practice). Honestly, the labs were not too difficult, there are step-by-step videos as well as lab sessions. And you got plenty of time to finish your labs. Most people scored full in labs. If you want to get A range in this course, I think full mark lab is a must as each lab counts for 12% of the Final Grade.

My lab session is useless because the lab instructor talked very slowly and was very boring. However everything that were discussed in the lab are printed in the notes, so you can basically skip every lab and do it at home by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
I have some programming background so the course is quite easy for me.
In this semester, the final exam was replaced by an online quiz assignment. We were given a few days to finish the quiz so many ppl got very high marks.

The book is unnecessary, since lecture notes already covered most things that will be examined. And it is useless during mid-term since you won't have enough time to read the book.

For the mid-term, I only brought a few pages of lecture slides in case i forgot some syntax. I suggest you to bring a blank paper because some questions are about coordinate system and it is easier if you can draw them out.

2 methods for grading:
method 1:
assignment 1 (25%)
assignment 2 (25%)
mid-term (35%)
online quiz (15%)

method 2:
assignment 1 (35%)
assignment 2 (35%)
mid-term (10%)
online quiz (20%)

There are also 3% total bonus scores
In this semester we need to watch online lecture videos and answer some simple questions discussed in the videos.

Statistics:
- Assignment 1: Max: 100, Min: 3, Avg: 92.5, SD: 29.6
- Assignment 2: Max: 100, Min: 20, Avg: 92.6, SD: 28.6
- Midterm: Max: 100, Min: 1, Avg: 57.9, SD: 25.1
- Online Quiz: Max: 100, Min (excluding 0s): 8, Avg: 87, SD: 14.77

My score:
assignment 1: 100/100
assignment 2: 100/100
mid-term: 100/100
online quiz: 100/100
bonus: 3/3
A+

Since the averages are very high in this semester (due to online assessment), it is not easy to get A-range.
reviews.comment_workload:
Since I have some programming background, so the only workload is finishing the 2 assignments (about 2-3 hours each)
All lectures and labs does not require attendance, so you can skip everything if you wish.

reviews.author: RJJ
reviews.comment_content:
Intermediate levels of python.
Topics are pretty easy before midterm.
And it gets harder after midterm.
Final is open-booked yet quite challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor explains and demonstrates the content slowly and clearly, yet the tone is quite boring. At the end of each lesson, the professor asks simple questions about the lecture and the student who answers correctly can get bonus points for the assignments. He is also willing to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good. A range can be achieved if your score is higher than the mean score by 1 S.D.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload.
Only 2 assignments throughout the semester:  
The lab will help you finish most part of the assignment and the remaining parts are not difficult if you really understand the mechanism behind. You can also discuss the problem encountered with your classmates.

reviews.author: Tuna
reviews.comment_content:
The course is basically about Python 3.2.

It's a bit hard to me as i do not have any prior ICT or programming background.

The course covers turtle graphics, music and game.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lam Ngok's teaching is quite boring and in a really slow pace, he could never catch up the  timeline. He kept on repeating without using different ways to explain so I am still confused even he explained so many times.

As they provide lecture videos, I skipped my classes and listen to Rossiter's class which is a lot much better. He's like a typical western people so I feel much interested.
reviews.comment_grading:
It has a really good grade for people without prior knowledge. I am not sure for scoring A range.

I got above mean for assignment 1 and full mark for assignment 2. Midterm and final slightly below mean. I still get a B. So it's much much much better than other course in UST.

Don't worry about assignment as there will be a lab with some TAs, some are not TAs in this course, however, they are very nice to answer the questions so you can get high marks for it easily.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments and 1 midterm and 1 final.

Assignments are a bit tough but the TAs are really nice to help you. Just save enough time for them.

Midterm and final are open notes. However, some questions need you to have some sense on mathematics as well.

reviews.author: mybedno.1
reviews.title: ok la
reviews.comment_content: simple python and turtle, boring as hell
reviews.comment_teaching: kinda good, ppt is easy to understand, and the exam practice explaining videos are clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
great grades
Remember to copy or type everything into your IDE and just run it
DON'T DRY RUN !!!
IT TAKES MORE TIME THAN TYPING EVERYTHING IN IDE :((
reviews.comment_workload: kinda easy, just have a few labs and the labs are easy to complete. remember to complete all exam practice and try to get yourself familiar with the question type. Its basically talking DSE, more practice higher marks.

reviews.author: KamJai
reviews.comment_content: It would not difficult if you attend the lesson. The lab would provide vidoe and instrustion to let you follow. The online interactive examples is good to let you familiar with the concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor provide the teachhing with a suitable pace.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading should not be too bad according to past.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too high. Since the not every lab is required to submitted. Also, as mentioned before, the instruction video will be provide for each lab.  The lab can be finished in 1~2 hours with no programming knowledge (It should be faster if you are clever).

reviews.author: Aatrox
reviews.title: Good grading
reviews.comment_content:
the content is just some simple python instructions. Here are what we learn in this course:

Introduction to Python
Introduction to Turtle Graphics
Comments and Text
Making Decisions
Loops
Lists and Tuples
Slicing
Functions
Data Types
File Handling
Dictionaries
State Diagrams
Turtle Object Creation
Event Handling
Stacks
Advanced Operators
Objects
Recursion


Reference book:

Interactive Python Programming for Beginners - Written by Gibson Lam and David Rossiter
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of Prof. Rossiter is good. It is very interactive and he invites students to answer his questions during the lecture. The accent is definitely not a problem as he is British.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading, I got 100/100 in my mid-term. It is very easy to get 100 marks in this course. As I remember, over 140 students got full marks in the mid-term.

There are two ways to calculate your score:

1. Midterm 24%, Lab projects 36%, Final exam 40%
2. Midterm 0%, Lab projects 42%, Final exam 58%

SO, LAB PROJECTS ARE ACTUALLY MORE IMPORTANT THAN YOUR MID-TERM!
reviews.comment_workload: No revision is needed as long as you pay attention in class and finish your hand-in lab on time. By the way, the only thing you have to do after the lecture is the hand-in lab. It is very important. DON'T MISS IT!

reviews.author: Jeff Li
reviews.title: Easy course with good grading and interesting teaching
reviews.comment_content:
Teaching is mainly about the simplest loop and if logic, which is really easy to understand. The course used turtle package to help us understand the basic concept, making the easy course even easier.
SOOOO EASYYYY
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson is a nice instructor. Passionate and helpful with humorous teaching style. The only problem about the lecture is that the content is so easy, making me easy to be distracted. But I guess it is common for a ccc.

He is always willing to answer questions and replies emails almost immediately. His teaching makes the simple - if not boring - content attractive
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair
Three labs assignments, one mid-term, one final.
The final score is computed in two different ways:
Midterm 24%, Lab projects 36%, Final exam 40%
Midterm 0%, Lab projects 42%, Final exam 58%
Then the higher one will be used for your grading.

The teaching team provides a long script with detailed steps to help you do the lab. All you need to do is just a kind of fill-in-the-blank job. So the average score for three labs are all above 95%. I think you will get a100% for your work unless you skipped, because there's no way for you to get score reducted.

The mid-term is just as easy as the lab, testing only the most basic logic. Stats is shown as below:
Average 64.4%
Standard deviation 21.5%
Maximum 100%
Minimum (excluding zeros) 2.5%
TBH, cant imagine how to get below 80 in the exam... I got 91, which surprised me because I was expecting a 95+.
reviews.comment_workload:
LOW

Never ever take a course with such a low worklaod.
As mentioned before, the only three assignments - lab projects - are provided with detailed scripts.
I spent 1hr for the first two, and around 2hr for the last one.

The exam is easy so you dont have to spend time on the slides. Just attend the lectures and pay attention to the instructor will be enough to get A range.

reviews.author: Hong Zhaoyang
reviews.comment_content: Basic Python programming
reviews.comment_teaching: Not bad at all. Professor is kind and patient, you can ask any question during the class. Attendance is not a must, feel free to watch the recordings after class.
reviews.comment_grading: very nice, can choose different schemes(including mt or not), if you fail mt, you still have chance to remedy it. And exams are not hard at all, only remember to go to the lab and finish your assignments then you'll be fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost 0, just finish the lab, attend the exams(do some necessary preparations would be better)

reviews.author: Marco_XD2000
reviews.title: Good basic programming course
reviews.comment_content:
Basic programming logic and skills in Python
Include a little bit OOP
If you do not have any programming background, it is recommended to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson and Rossiter are very good
Their lectures are interesting and you can learn much from them.
They never just read ppt, instead, they teach with some interactive method.
Even this semester is online, I still wanted to attend all their lectures
reviews.comment_grading:
Got full mark, therefore A+
Many said it was hard, but I disagree.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 3 hand in Labs
Lecture can skip if you want, but not recommended

reviews.author: Cheese_5040
reviews.title: Great Lecturer
reviews.comment_content: Easy to understand classes, with informative slides and basic content
reviews.comment_teaching: David Rossiter is great lecturer, he makes his classes entertaining despite it being online for the semester.  In addition, he will occationally crack jokes to keep the class lively, and I appreciate that.
reviews.comment_grading: Great grading with easy tests (if you understand in class)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light and easy to complete, only 5 lab works that can be finished within a day.  In addition, there are guides for the labs, thus making it simple if you follow the instructions

reviews.author: Squidgy
reviews.title: Don't believe good grades
reviews.comment_content:
I don't know what's the point of drawing turtles for a whole semester. For a common course, the content is definitely adequate, but for those who want to take higher level COMP courses, 1021 is definitely not enough.
However, if you just want to satisfy your CCC, then just give it a try.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dave is quite good since he is a native speaker.
Jimmy is the best TA in UST, he's willing to answer students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 82/100
Mean: 78-79
SD: very high
Final: 43/100
Mean: 41
Me: B+

There are two grading schemes, one is for those who fucked up their midterm and prefer to all in the final exam.
DON'T BELIEVE THAT GRADING SCHEME, THE FINAL IS VERY DIFFICULT, at least this online semester is.
So if you accidentally got punched hard on midterm (many people get at least 90 ups), you barely have chance to have a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 3 to 4 hand-in assignments, and merely no workload.

reviews.author: 杜寅玮
reviews.comment_content: 其实python学完就是教会你怎么用turtle画画，如果想学知识请移步1022p。
reviews.comment_teaching: 老师人很幽默，吐槽科大的饭又难吃又容易长胖，讲课还是挺好的。
reviews.comment_grading: 这门课我一直在作死，最后只有一个A，如果细心一点，考试的时候仔细看题，应该拿A+没有问题。
reviews.comment_workload: 基本没有，两个assignment都会在lab上手把手教你一个大概的框架，一般一两天就可以写完。听说每年assignment基本是不变的，那第一个注意一下细节，第二个改的很松，有点小错TA可能都不会发现。反正作业可以抱大腿，就随便写写啦。

reviews.author: Liwanyi
reviews.comment_content: Regarding the course content, COMP 1021 covers the necessary topics for students to gain a solid foundation in programming. The course material is divided into several modules, each of which focuses on a specific aspect of programming. The course website also provides a detailed syllabus, which gives students a clear understanding of what to expect from each module.
reviews.comment_teaching: In terms of teaching, the course has a team of experienced instructors who are well-versed in programming and have experience teaching the course. The instructors provide lectures, tutorials, and office hours to assist students in understanding the course material. The course also has a discussion forum where students can ask questions and engage with their peers.
reviews.comment_grading: In terms of grading, the course appears to have a rigorous evaluation system. According to the course website, the final grade is determined based on several components, including assignments, quizzes, exams, and a final project. This approach to grading ensures that students are evaluated on their overall understanding of the course material and their ability to apply it.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for COMP 1021 appears to be moderate to high. The course involves several assignments, quizzes, exams, and a final project, which can be time-consuming. However, this workload is necessary to ensure that students understand the course material thoroughly and can apply it to practical situations.

reviews.author: Art
reviews.title: Nice course!!! Highly recommend!!
reviews.comment_content: Watch some past papers and prepare your hand speed for the exams and run the programme and you will get a high grade.
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually idk. I skipped all lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is ok.
There are 2 grading policy.
1.  Lab+midterm+final
2. Lab+final

Midterm: me: 18/100 Average: 57.8 S.D.: 22.5
Final: me:94/100 Average: 74.5, S.D.: 19.4

At last I got A for 96.5%.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not very large. It only required a lab work in weeks and the lab was well guided. They could be easily done and take a good mark.(All labs 100)

Python.

REALLY BAD

only labs, no attendance.

reviews.author: Disha
reviews.comment_content: course is based on python and by the end of it you'd be well trained in the language. The course is very well mapped out.
reviews.comment_teaching: very engaging and fun class, one of the best professors. Keeps the class lively and involves students very well. He wrote the book so his experience in the field is undoubtedly one of the best.
reviews.comment_grading: I havent been graded in his course yet so im unsure regarding the grading.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is adequate for a first year student. A really good course for students interested in CSE.

reviews.comment_content: Easy, didn’t attend any lessons and didn’t revise still got an A+. Just simply programming beginner course. Nothing hard, can learn it in a short time, no need to afraid ah,really.

reviews.comment_grading: Easy ah got 99.3% in total, A+. The grading is fair, the average is high and as long as you work hard you can get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Easy, just a few labs to do ah, can finish each lab within 30 minutes. Low workload

reviews.author: GoodgradeKid

reviews.author: hakenchok1
reviews.title: Honest review of an international student
reviews.comment_content: Very basic Python. The content is pretty easy and quite understandable. Everyone is talking about it in reviews, so you can read it in other reviews if you want.
reviews.comment_teaching: Theaching is OK. Even good for UST. You can skip lectures and work on materials on your own. It could be even better than wasting time in the classroom.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is good. Average = B. Labs are the thing you should take seriously and have 100/100. They are not difficult but time-consuming. Many local students want to finish them as soon as possible to go and play computer games. So, you can beat them in this part being very careful and attentive. The competition is extremely high in this course, so you have no right to make mistakes. There are also 2 grading schemes because some students (me including) have never experienced tests in programming world and can perform not satisfying their plans. You know, asians can do well without understanding much because they have tests in their DNA. That's why having 2 grading schemes is a good idea.

My results:
Labs - 100/100 (Avg: 92)
Midterm - 60/100 (Avg: 62)
Final: 79/100(Avg: 70)
Second grading scheme -> 87.8% overall B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Do not listen to other reviews in terms of workload. Again, for many asians a task which is not mandatory means NO TASK. That's a silly approach. In fact, you need to spend 4-5 hours on materials+tasks+lab every week.
IF YOU WANT TO DO WELL IN THE EXAM:
There are so many past papers! Start a long time before the exams and it will help you a lot! Many students will look only on 10% of them. You can be better!

reviews.author: 化工之鬼

reviews.comment_content:

get prepared for such a shit course, i know u dont have a choice anyway
reviews.comment_teaching: the lecturer is fine, im not complaining on that, he teaches slow, maybe its just me that i couldn't understand the concepts. although he skips the examples fast that i couldn't understand, or maybe its just me being that stupid

shitty grading

too much
too fucking much

reviews.author: Harsh1
reviews.title: EASY A+
reviews.comment_content: Content starts off easy with the basics of coding, and python. After the midterm python is covered in more depth, thus helping students gain more coding knowledge and experience.
reviews.comment_teaching: Classes are taught with the assumption that the student knows nothing about python and coding. Lam Gibson is one of the best teachers out there, mostly denoted by his light classes and humor.
reviews.comment_grading: This course consists of many students which results in a large IQR. As long as you focus in class and do the homework you can get an easy A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework is extremely easy if you pay attention in class, have some coding experience, or have smart friends.

reviews.author: steveaq
reviews.title: relatively good grade coarse
reviews.comment_content:
great, learn the basics of python

Self-study using textbooks or use powerpoints, note that some content in powerpoints is not included in textbooks ( if you don't attend lectures, you need to check powerpoints.)

Content:
basic programming knowledge,
turtle programming,
for/while loop,
if / else / elif statement,
nested loop/if statement,
data type handling
file handling
function
dictionary
object
recursion
and a lot of small stuff (e.g. slicing,timer)
reviews.comment_teaching:
you don't need to attend the lecture.
Gibson's lecture is fun though, studying yourself is quicker but his lecture is also a kind of enjoyment while learning.

The coarse webpage is the best coarse webpage in UST, a huge amount of exercise given before the exam. (you don't need to do them all but it's nice they provide it)
reviews.comment_grading:
2 methods: (automatically choose the best method)
method 1:
3 labs: 12%@ 36%total
mid term: 24%
final: 40%
method 2:
3 labs: 14%@ 42%total
mid term: 0%
final:58%

midterm is rather easy, final is somewhat hard.
In fact the final for this year is too hard that they removed 2 weakest question for each person.

(there is 7 labs, only 3 counts marks)
Lab01: mean:97.2 sd:9.3 range:[20,100]
Lab05: mean:98.1 sd:11.7 range:[5,100]
Lab07: mean:95.4 sd:11.4 range:[20,100]
Midterm: mean:64.4 sd:21.5 range:[2.5,100]
final: mean:55.9 sd:20.5 range:[8.6,100]

don't ask my score.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 lab, 3hours workload each,
the 2 hours per week lecture time is enough to study all material and get an A, (provided that you self-study, rather than attend lecture)

reviews.author: 靚仔
